StatsBlock.Name: Aasimar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 13

Description.Skills: Aasimars receive a +2 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks.
Description.Characters: An aasimar's favored class is paladin.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light
SpecialAbility.Text: Aasimars can use light once per day as cast by a sorcerer of 1st level or their character level, whichever is higher.

StatsBlock.Name: Aboleth
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 tentacles x1 +12 melee (1d6+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 15, Wis 17, Cha 17

Description.General: Aboleth speak their own language, as well as Undercommon and Aquan.
Description.Combat: An aboleth attacks by flailing with its long, slimy tentacles, though it prefers to fight from a distance using its illusion powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Transformation
SpecialAbility.Text: A blow from an aboleth's tentacle can cause a terrible transformation. Affected creatures must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or begin to transform over the next 1d4+1 minutes, the skin gradually becoming a clear, slimy membrane. A transformed creature must remain moistened with cool, fresh water or suffer 1d12 points of damage every 10 minutes. A remove disease spell cast before the transformation is complete will restore an afflicted creature to normal. Afterward, however, only a heal or mass heal spell can reverse the change.

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: hypnotic pattern, illusory wall, mirage arcana, persistent image, programmed image, project image, and veil. These effects are as the spells cast by a 16th-level sorcerer (save DCs, where applicable, are 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Enslave
SpecialAbility.Text: Three times a day, an aboleth can attempt to enslave any one living creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or be affected as though by a dominate person spell cast by a 16th-level sorcerer. An enslaved creature obeys the aboleth's telepathic commands (but will not fight on its behalf) until freed by remove curse or dispel magic, and can attempt a new Will save every 24 hours to break free. The control is also broken if the aboleth dies or travels more than one mile from its slave.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mucus Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: An aboleth underwater surrounds itself with a viscous cloud of mucus roughly 1 foot thick. Any creature coming into contact with and inhaling this substance must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or lose the ability to breathe air for the next 3 hours. The affected creature suffocates in 2d6 minutes if removed from the water. Renewed contact with the mucus cloud and failing another Fortitude save continues the effect for another 3 hours.

StatsBlock.Name: Abomination
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 30 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 30 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Unknown (2d4+6) or Unknown (2d6+6) Unknown (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Psionics, Spell-Like Abilities, Improved Grab (If Snake-Headed), Constrict 1d6+6
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Dodge, Expertise, Improved Initiative

Description.General:
Yuan-ti abominations are all snake (01-50 on d%) or have a single human feature, either a head (51-75) or arms (76-00).
Yuan-ti speak their own language, plus Common, Draconic, and Abyssal.
Description.Skills: *Yuan-ti using chameleon power receive a +8 circumstance bonus to Hide checks.
Description.Characters: The favored class for yuan-ti abominations is cleric. Yuan-ti clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, Destruction, and Plant.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, a snake-headed abomination must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: An abomination deals 1d6+6 points of damage with a successful grapple check (using the bite attack bonus if snake-headed) against Large or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: (Human-headed) 1/day-animal trance, cause fear, deeper darkness, entangle, neutralize poison, suggestion, and polymorph other. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text:
All yuan-ti can produce the following effects at will:
  • Detect Poison: As the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.
  • Alternate Form: The yuan-ti can assume the form of a Tiny to Large viper. This ability is similar to a shapchange spell cast by a 19th-level sorcerer but allows only viper forms. If the yuan-ti has a poisonous bite of its own, it uses its own or the viper's poison, whichever is more potent.
  • Chameleon Power: The yuan-ti can change the coloration of itself and its equipment to match its surroundings.
  • Produce Acid: The yuan-ti can exude acid from its body, dealing 1d6 points of damage to anything it touches. The acid becomes inert when it leaves the yuan-ti's body.
  • Aversion: The yuan-ti creates a compulsion effect targeting one creature within 30 feet. The subject must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or gain an aversion to snakes for 10 minutes. Affected subjects must stay at least 20 feet from any snake or yuan-ti, alive or dead; if already within 20 feet, they move away. A subject can overcome the compulsion by succeeding at another DC 17 Will save, but still suffers deep anxiety. This causes a -4 reduction to Dexterity until the effect wears off or the subject is no longer within 20 feet of a snake or yuan-ti. This ability is otherwise similar to antipathy as cast by a 16th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Halfbloods and abominations with snake heads only-bite, Fortitude save (DC 17); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Achaierai
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (2d6+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (4d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +13, Jump +13, Listen +11, Move Silently +10, Spot +11, +11

Description.General: Achaierai speak Infernal.
Description.Combat: In close combat, achaierai lash out with two of their four legs and snap with their powerful beaks. These attack modes alone would make them deadly warriors.

SpecialAbility.Name: Black Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: Up to three times per day an achaierai can release a choking, toxic black cloud. Those other than achaierai within 10 feet instantly take 2d6 points of damage. They must also succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be affected for 3 hours as though by an insanity spell cast by a 16th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Arrowhawk - Adult
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Electricity ray x1 +6 melee (2d8+2)bite x1 +6 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 21, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Escape Artist +15, Intuit Direction +7, Listen +11, Search +10, Sense Motive +11, Spot +11

Description.General: Arrowhawks speak Auran, but they are not talkative creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Electricity Ray
SpecialAbility.Text: An arrowhawk can fire this ray once a round, with a range of 45 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Arrowhawks have acid, electricity, and poison immunity.

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Elder
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 33, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Mobility

Description.General:
An elder air elemental is 40 feet high and weighs 12 lbs.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Air Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: Airborne creatures suffer a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls against an air elemental.

SpecialAbility.Name: Whirlwind
SpecialAbility.Text:
The elemental can transform itself into a whirlwind once every 10 minutes and remain in that form for up to 1 round for every 2 HD it has. In this form, the elemental can move through the air or along a surface at its fly speed. The whirlwind is DC 27, damage 2d8, and height 10-60 feet.
The whirlwind is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 30 feet wide at the top, and up to 50 feet tall, depending on the elemental's size. The elemental controls the exact height, but it must be at least 10 feet.
Creatures one or more sizes smaller than the elemental might take damage when caught in the whirlwind (see the following table for details) and may be lifted into the air. An affected creature must succeed at a Reflex save when it comes into contact with the whirlwind or take the listed damage. It must also succeed at a second Reflex save or be picked up bodily and held suspended in the powerful winds, automatically taking the listed damage each round. A creature that can fly is allowed a Reflex save each round to escape the whirlwind. The creature still takes damage but can leave if the save is successful. The DC for saves against the whirlwind's effects varies with the elemental's size.
The elemental can eject any carried creatures whenever it wishes, depositing them wherever the whirlwind happens to be. A summoned elemental always ejects trapped creatures before returning to its home plane.
If the whirlwind's base touches the ground, it creates a swirling cloud of debris. This cloud is centered on the elemental and has a diameter equal to half the whirlwind's height. The cloud obscures all vision, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. Creatures 5 feet away have one-half concealment, while those farther away have total concealment. Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check to cast a spell (DC equal to the Reflex save DC).

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Greater
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 31, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
A greater air elemental is 36 feet high and weighs 10 lbs.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Huge
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x3 +14/+9/+4 melee (2d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 29, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
A huge air elemental is 32 feet high and weighs 8 lbs.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Large
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x2 +7/+2 melee (2d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 25, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
A large air elemental is 16 feet high and weighs 4 lbs.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Medium
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +4 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 21, Con 14, Int 4, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
A medium-size air elemental is 8 feet high and weighs 2 lbs.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Air Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: Airborne creatures suffer a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls against an air elemental.

Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check to cast a spell (DC equal to the Reflex save DC).

StatsBlock.Name: Air Elemental, Small
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 4, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
A small air elemental is 4 feet high and weighs 1 lb.
Air elementals speak Auran, although they rarely choose to do so. Their voices sound like the high-pitched screech of a tornado or the low moan of a midnight storm.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Air Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: Airborne creatures suffer a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls against an air elemental.

Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check to cast a spell (DC equal to the Reflex save DC).

StatsBlock.Name: Air Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +12, Listen +6, Move Silently +9, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of dust and grit, 15 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d8, Reflex half DC 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour an air mephit can surround itself with vapor, duplicating the effects of a blur spell as cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer. Once per day it can use gust of wind as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer. (save DC 12 + spell level)

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: An air mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and is exposed to moving air, be it a breeze, a draft, a spell effect, or even the mephit fanning itself.

StatsBlock.Name: Allip
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Incorporeal touch x1 +2 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +8, Intimidate +11, Intuit Direction +4, Listen +7, Search +7, Spot +7

Description.Combat: Allips are unable to cause physical harm, although they don't appear to know that. They keep flailing away at their enemies, yet they inflict no wounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Babble
SpecialAbility.Text: An allip constantly mutters and whines to itself, creating a hypnotic effect. All sane creatures within 60 feet of the allip must succeed at a Will save (DC 16) or be affected as though by a hypnotism spell for 2d4 rounds. This is a sonic, mind-affecting compulsion. Opponents who successfully save cannot be affected by the same allip's babble for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Wisdom Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Those whose Wisdom is reduced to 0 by the allip become helpless until at least 1 point of Wisdom is restored.

SpecialAbility.Name: Madness
SpecialAbility.Text: Anyone targeting the allip with a mind-control or telepathic ability makes direct contact with its tortured mind and takes 1d4 points of temporary Wisdom damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Androsphinx
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +18 melee (2d4+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 10, Con 19, Int 16, Wis 17, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Cleave, Great Cleave, Flyby Attack, Power Attack, Track

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a sphinx leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A sphinx that pounces onto a creature can make two rake attacks with its hind legs. Attack bonus +18 melee, damage 2d4+3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Roar
SpecialAbility.Text: Three times per day an androsphinx can loose a mighty roar. The first time it does this, all creatures within 500 feet must succeed at a Will save (DC 19) or be affected as though by a fear spell for 12 rounds. If the sphinx roars a second time during the same encounter, all creatures within 250 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or be paralyzed for 1d4 rounds, and all those within 90 feet are deafened for 2d6 rounds (no save). If it roars a third time during the same encounter, all those within 250 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or take 2d4 points of temporary Strength damage for 2d4 rounds. In addition, any Medium-size or smaller creature within 90 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or be thrown to the ground and take 2d8 points of damage. The force of this roar is so great that it deals 50 points of damage to any stone or crystalline object within 90 feet. Magic items and held or carried items can avoid damage with a successful Reflex save (DC 19). Other androsphinxes are immune to these effects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: An androsphinx casts divine spells as a 6th-level cleric from the cleric spell list and from the Good, Healing, and Protection domains.

StatsBlock.Name: Ankheg
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +4 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 1, Wis 13, Cha 6

Description.Combat: An ankheg usually lies 5 to 10 feet below the surface until its antennae detect the approach of prey. It then burrows up to attack. (Treat this as a charge.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the ankheg must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it deals automatic bite damage each round the hold is maintained. If the ankheg is damaged after grabbing its prey, it retreats backward down its tunnel at burrowing speed, dragging the victim with it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: Acidic enzymes drip from an ankheg's mouth each round it maintains a hold. It automatically deals 1d4 points of acid damage each round in addition to bite damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spit Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: Stream of acid 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 30 feet long, once every 6 hours; damage 4d4, Reflex half DC 14. One such attack depletes the ankheg's acid supply for 6 hours. It cannot spit acid or deal acid damage during this time. Ankhegs do not use this ability unless they are desperate or frustrated. They most often spit acid when reduced to fewer than half their hit points or when they have not successfully grabbed an opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Ankhegs can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Annis
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +9 melee (1d6+7) or bite x1 +4 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 12, Con 14, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 10

Description.General: Annis speak Giant and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the annis must hit a Large or smaller creature with a claw attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: An annis that hits with both claw attacks latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This attack automatically deals an additional 2d6+14 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tear
SpecialAbility.Text: An annis automatically hits a held opponent with all its melee attacks each round it maintains the hold.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-change self and fog cloud. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Steely Skin
SpecialAbility.Text: The steely skin of an annis reduces damage dealt by slashing and piercing weapons by 1 point of damage per hit. Conversely, their brittle bones increase damage dealt by bludgeoning weapons by 1 point per hit. (Treat combination weapons such as morningstars as bludgeoning weapons.)

StatsBlock.Name: Ape
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7

StatsBlock.Name: Ape
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d6+6) or bite x1 +3 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire ape that hits with both claw attacks latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This automatically deals an additional 2d6+12 points of damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Aquatic Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8)longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 9, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Elves speak Elven, and most also know Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: An aquatic elf's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Aquatic Elf Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Aquatic elves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Gills: Aquatic elves can survive out of the water for 1 hour per point of Constitution.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Aquatic elves can see four times as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, and similar conditions of low illumination.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Aranea
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d6)web x1 melee ()
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 14, Wis 13, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +14, Concentration +8, Craft +8, Jump +6, Listen +3, Spot +3, +8

Description.General: Araneas speak Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Araneas avoid physical combat and use their webs and spells when they can. In a battle, they try to immobilize or distract the most aggressive opponents first. Araneas often subdue opponents for ransom.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Araneas cast spells as 3rd-level sorcerers (save DC 12 + spell level). They prefer illusions and charms but avoid fire spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Web
SpecialAbility.Text: In spider or hybrid form (see Alternate Form, below), an aranea can cast a web up to six times per day. This is similar to an attack with a net but has a maximum range of 50 feet, with a range increment of 10 feet, and is effective against targets of up to Large size. The web anchors the target in place, allowing no movement. An entangled creature can escape with a successful Escape Artist check (DC 20) or burst the web with a successful Strength check (DC 26). The web has 6 hit points and takes double damage from fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 13); initial damage 1d6 temporary Strength, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: An aranea's natural form is that of a Large monstrous spider. It can assume two other forms. The first is a Small or Medium-size humanoid (the exact form is fixed at birth). The second form is a Medium-size, spider-humanoid hybrid. Changing form is a standard action. In humanoid form, the aranea gains all the abilities of the form (for example, an aranea in dwarf form has dwarven racial traits). The aranea keeps its ability scores and can cast spells, but it cannot use webs or poison in humanoid form. In hybrid form, an aranea looks like a humanoid at first glance, but a successful Spot check (DC 18) reveals the creature's fangs and spinnerets. The aranea can use weapons and webs in this form. An aranea remains in one form until it chooses to assume a new one. A change in form cannot be dispelled, nor does the aranea revert to its natural form when killed. A true seeing spell, however, reveals its natural form if it is in humanoid or hybrid form.

StatsBlock.Name: Assassin Vine
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +7 melee (1d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 10, Con 16, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 9

Description.Combat: Assassin vines use simple tactics: They lie still until prey comes within reach, then attack. They use their entangle ability both to catch prey and to deter counterattacks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Entangle
SpecialAbility.Text: An assassin vine can animate plants within 30 feet of itself as a free action. The effect lasts until the vine dies or decides to end it (also a free action). The ability is otherwise similar to entangle as cast by a 4th-level druid (save DC 13).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the assassin vine must hit with its slam attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: An assassin vine deals 1d6+7 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Assassin vines have no visual organs but can ascertain all foes within 30 feet using sound, scent, and vibration.

SpecialAbility.Name: Camouflage
SpecialAbility.Text: Since an assassin vine looks like a normal plant when at rest, it takes a successful Spot check (DC 20) to notice it before it attacks. Anyone with Wilderness Lore or Knowledge (plants or herbs) can use those skills instead of Spot to notice the plant. Dwarves can use stonecunning to notice the subterranean version.

StatsBlock.Name: Astral Deva
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +3 heavy mace of disruption +21/ x1 +18 melee (1d8+12)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistance (), Uncanny Dodge, Protective Aura, Poison Saves, Tongues, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 20
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +19, Escape Artist +19, Hide +19, Listen +25, Move Silently +19, Sense Motive +19, Spot +25, +17
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Cleave, Improved Initiative, Power Attack

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Extremely alert, astral devas receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stun
SpecialAbility.Text: If an astral deva strikes an opponent twice in one round with its mace, that creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be stunned for 1d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: aid, continual flame, detect evil, discern lies, dispel evil, dispel magic, holy aura, holy smite, holy word, invisibility sphere (self only), polymorph self, remove curse, remove disease, and remove fear; 7/day-see invisibility and cure light wounds; 1/day-heal and blade barrier. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Uncanny Dodge
SpecialAbility.Text: Astral devas are never caught flat-footed and cannot be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Protective Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, devas can surround themselves with a nimbus of light having a radius of 20 feet. This acts as a double-strength magic circle against evil and as a minor globe of invulnerability, both as cast by a sorcerer whose level equal to the celestial's Hit Dice. The aura can be dispelled, but the celestial can create it again as a free action on its next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Devas are immune to electricity, petrification, cold, and acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Athach
StatsBlock.Attacks: Huge club melee (2d6+8) or 2 Huge clubs melee (2d6+4) or bite melee (2d8+2)rock melee (2d6+8) or 2 rocks melee (2d6+8)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge club x2 +15/+10 melee (2d6+8) or 2 Huge clubs x1 +13 melee (2d6+4) or bite x1 +13 melee (2d8+2)rock x2 +15/+10 melee (2d6+8) or 2 rocks x1 +13 melee (2d6+8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 12, Con 21, Int 7, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.General: Athachs speak a crude dialect of Giant.
Description.Combat: Athachs charge into melee combat unless their opponents are out of reach, in which case they throw rocks. They sometimes try to overrun armored opponents to reach unarmored opponents in back ranks. With their first few melee attacks, athachs tend to flail about indiscriminately. After a few rounds, they concentrate on foes that have been hitting them most often and use their bites on whoever has dealt them the most damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 22); initial damage 1d6 temporary Strength, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

StatsBlock.Name: Average Salamander
StatsBlock.Attacks: Longspear melee (1d8+2) or tail slap melee (2d6+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longspear x2 +6/+1 melee (1d8+2) or tail slap x1 +4 melee (2d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Craft +16, Escape Artist +11, Hide +11, Listen +14, Move Silently +11, Search +12, Spot +14

Description.General: Salamanders speak Ignan. Some average salamanders also speak Common.
Description.Skills: Salamanders receive a +4 racial bonus to Craft (metalworking) skill checks.
Description.Feats: Salamanders have the Multiattack feat even without the requisite three natural weapons.
Description.Characters: Average salamanders may be clerics, sorcerers, or fighters (their favored class).

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander generates so much heat that its mere touch deals additional fire damage. Salamanders' metallic weapons also conduct this heat.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander deals automatic tail slap damage (including fire damage) with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Average Xorn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (4d6+3) or 3 claws x1 +5 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Cold), Resistance (), 360 Vision, Half Damage From Slashing, Tremorsense
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +10, Intuit Direction +10, Listen +10, Move Silently +10, Search +10, Spot +14

Description.General: Xorns speak Terran and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burrow
SpecialAbility.Text: A xorn can glide through stone, dirt, or almost any other sort of earth except metal as easily as a fish swims through water. Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other signs of its presence. A move earth spell cast on an area containing a burrowing xorn flings the xorn back 30 feet, stunning the creature for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half Damage from Slashing
SpecialAbility.Text: Slashing weapons deal only half damage to xorns, with a minimum of 1 point of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: All-Around Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns' symmetrically placed eyes allow them to look in any direction, bestowing a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Search checks. Xorns can't be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Avoral (Guardinal)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +6 melee (2d6+2)2 wings x1 +6 melee (2d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Petrification), Lay On Hands, Animal Telepathy, True Seeing, Resistances, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 15, Wis 16, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +10, Concentration +8, Hide +10, Listen +10, Move Silently +10, Sense Motive +10, Spellcraft +9, Spot +18, +9

Description.General:
Their visual acuity is unbelievable: They can see detail on objects up to 10 miles away and are said to be able to discern the color of a creature's eyes at 200 paces.
Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: An avoral's sharp eyes give it a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: aid, blur (self only), command, detect magic, dimension door, dispel magic, gust of wind, hold person, light, magic circle against evil (self only), magic missile, and see invisibility; 1/day-lightning bolt. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day an avoral can create an aura of fear in a 20-foot radius. It is otherwise identical with fear as cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 17).

SpecialAbility.Name: Lay on Hands
SpecialAbility.Text: This works just like the paladin's ability, but the avoral can heal as much damage per day as its own undamaged hit point total.

SpecialAbility.Name: Animal Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: An avoral can mentally communicate with animals as a free action. This works exactly like speak with animals as cast by an 8th-level druid but does not require sound.

SpecialAbility.Name: True Seeing
SpecialAbility.Text: This is identical with true seeing as cast by a 14th-level cleric, except that it has personal range and the avoral must concentrate for 1 full round before it takes effect. Thereafter it remains in effect as long as the avoral concentrates on it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Guardinals have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Azer
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Warhammer x1 +1 melee (1d8+1)halfspear x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 12, Cha 9
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +2, Craft +6, Hide +0, Listen +4, Search +4, Spot +5

Description.General: Azers speak Ignan and Common.
Description.Combat: Azers use broad-headed spears or well-crafted hammers in combat. When unarmed, they attempt to grapple foes. They wear no armor, for their tough skin provides ample protection.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: Azers' bodies are intensely hot, so their unarmed attacks deal additional fire damage. Their metallic weapons also conduct this heat.

StatsBlock.Name: Baboon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 4

StatsBlock.Name: Badger
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d2) or bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

SpecialAbility.Name: Rage
SpecialAbility.Text: A badger that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +4 Strength, +4 Constitution, and -2 AC. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

StatsBlock.Name: Badger
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +2 melee (1d4+2) or bite x1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Rage
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire badger that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage on its next turn, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +4 Strength, +4 Constitution, and -2 AC. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

StatsBlock.Name: Balor (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.Attacks: +1 vorpal greatsword +18/+13/+8 melee (2d6+8) or whip melee (1d4+3)2 slams melee (1d6+7)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +1 vorpal greatsword +18/+13/+8 x1 +18 melee (2d6+8) or whip x1 +13 melee (1d4+3)2 slams x1 +18 melee (1d6+7)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Fear, Spell-Like Abilities, Entangle, Body Flames, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Death Throes
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +18, Concentration +19, Diplomacy +17, Hide +13, Knowledge +13, Listen +28, Move Silently +13, Scry +21, Search +20, Sense Motive +20, Spellcraft +21, Spot +29

Description.General: Balors speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Balors receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-blasphemy, deeper darkness, desecrate, detect good, detect law, fear, greater dispelling, pyrotechnics, read magic, suggestion, symbol (any), telekinesis, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), tongues (self only), unhallow, unholy aura, unholy blight, and wall of fire; 1/day-fire storm and implosion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear
SpecialAbility.Text: A creature hit by a balor's slam attack must succeed at a Will save (DC 19) or flee in terror for 1d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Entangle
SpecialAbility.Text: A balor's whip entangles foes much like an attack with a net. The whip has a maximum range of 40 feet, with a range increment of 10 feet, and 20 hit points. The whip needs no folding. If it hits, the target and the balor immediately make opposed Strength checks; if the balor wins, it drags the target against its flaming body (see below). The target remains anchored against the balor's body until it escapes the whip.

SpecialAbility.Name: Body Flames
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors can wreathe their bodies in roaring flames as a free action. The balor suffers no harm, but anyone grappling with it takes 4d6 points of fire damage each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vorpal Sword
SpecialAbility.Text: Every balor carries a +1 vorpal greatsword that looks like a flame or a bolt of lightning. The sword also has the spell-like ability to detect good as cast by a 12th-level sorcerer, except that its range is 30 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Magic
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors continuously detect magic as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: See Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors continuously see invisibility as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a balor can automatically summon 4d10 dretches, 1d4 hezrous, or one nalfeshnee, glabrezu, marilith, or balor. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Death Throes
SpecialAbility.Text: When killed, a balor explodes in a blinding flash of light that deals 50 points of damage to everything within 100 feet (Reflex half DC 20).

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Balors can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Barbazu (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Glaive x2 +6/+1 melee (1d10+3)claws x1 +6 melee (1d4+2) x1 +6 Unknown (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Wounding, Beard, Battle Frenzy, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Baatezu Qualities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 11, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +7, Hide +6, Listen +6, Move Silently +6, Sense Motive +6, Spot +6

Description.General: Barbazu speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: animate dead, charm person, command, desecrate, magic weapon, major image, produce flame, and suggestion. Barbazu also can induce fear by touch as the spell, except it affects only the creature touched. These abilities are as cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level). A barbazu can teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only) at will as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Wound
SpecialAbility.Text: A hit from a barbazu's glaive causes a bleeding wound. The injured creature loses 2 additional hit points each round until the wound is bound (a DC 10 Heal check) or the creature dies. This is an ability of the barbazu, not of the weapon.

SpecialAbility.Name: Beard
SpecialAbility.Text: If a barbazu hits a single opponent with both claw attacks, it automatically hits with its beard. The affected creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be infected with a vile disease called devil chills (incubation period 1d4 days, damage 1d4 points of temporary Strength). Damage is dealt each day until the afflicted creature succeeds at three consecutive Fortitude saves, the disease is cured magically, or the creature dies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Battle Frenzy
SpecialAbility.Text: A barbazu can work itself into a battle frenzy similar to the barbarian's rage ability (+4 Strength, +4 Constitution, +2 morale bonus to Will saves, -2 AC penalty), for a +2 morale bonus to attacks and damage and 12 extra hit points. The frenzy lasts 6 rounds, and the barbazu suffers no ill effects afterward.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a barbazu can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures with a 50% chance of success, or another barbazu with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Barghest
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (1d6+3) or 2 claws x1 +2 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Scent, Alternate Form
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +11, Hide +11, Intimidate +11, Jump +12, Listen +11, Move Silently +10, Spot +11

Description.General: Barghests speak Goblin, Worg, and Infernal.
Description.Combat: Barghests can claw and bite, no matter what their form, and usually disdain weapons. Though they love killing, they have little stomach for direct combat and attack from ambush whenever possible. Once battle is joined, barghests hide and use project image to conceal their true numbers and locations, with emotion and charm person to keep opponents off balance. They try to pit as many of themselves against as few of the enemy as possible, and use their high speed to stay way from the enemy's main strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-levitate, misdirection, and project image; 1/day-charm monster, charm person, dimension door, and emotion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the barghest's HD (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Feed
SpecialAbility.Text: When a barghest slays a humanoid opponent, it can feed on the corpse, devouring both flesh and life force, as a full-round action. For every 8 HD or levels a barghest consumes, it gains 1 Hit Die. Feeding destroys the victim's body and prevents any form of raising or resurrection that requires part of the corpse. A wish, miracle, or true resurrection spell can restore a devoured victim to life, but there is a 50% chance that even such powerful magic will fail.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A barghest can assume the form of a goblin or a large wolf as a standard action. This ability is similar to the polymorph self spell, except that it allows only goblin and wolf forms. *While in wolf form, a barghest gains the higher of the two listed speeds and a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pass Without Trace
SpecialAbility.Text: A barghest in wolf form can pass without trace (as the spell) as a free action.

StatsBlock.Name: Basilisk
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +6 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 8, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.Skills: *The basilisk's dull coloration and its ability to remain motionless for long periods of time grant it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks in natural settings.

SpecialAbility.Name: Petrifying Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Turn to stone permanently, range 30 feet; Fortitude negates DC 13.

StatsBlock.Name: Bat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d2) or bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 1, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 4

Description.Skills: *Bats receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. These bonuses are lost if Blindsight is negated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Bats can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the bat to rely on its weak vision, which has a maximum range of 10 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Bat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +5 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 22, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

Description.General: Blindsight: Dire bats can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this ability and forces the bat to rely on its weak vision, which has a maximum range of 10 feet.
Description.Skills: Dire bats receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. *These bonuses are lost if blindsight is negated.

StatsBlock.Name: Bear
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +18 melee (2d4+10) or bite x1 +13 melee (2d8+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 31, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the dire bear must hit with a claw attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Bear, Black
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d4+4) or bite x1 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

StatsBlock.Name: Bear, Brown
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (1d8+8) or bite x1 +5 melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

StatsBlock.Name: Bear, Polar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +13 melee (1d8+8) or bite x1 +8 melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Skills: *A polar bear's white coat bestows a +12 racial bonus to Hide checks in snowy areas.

StatsBlock.Name: Bebilith
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +19 melee (2d6+9) or 2 claws x1 +14 melee (2d4+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Scent, Telepathy, Protective Aura, Plane Shift
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 12, Con 18, Int 11, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +21, Hide +11, Jump +21, Listen +17, Move Silently +15, Search +14, Sense Motive +15, Spot +17
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Cleave, Power Attack, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Bebiliths do not speak but understand Abyssal. Their telepathy allows them to communicate silently with one another.
Description.Skills: The bebilith's mottled coloration gives it a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Web
SpecialAbility.Text: Four times per day a bebilith can shoot webs from its abdomen. This attack is like a web spell, with a few exceptions. The range is 30 feet, and the webs are permanent, nonmagical, and cannot be dispelled. The DC for evading or breaking free from the webs is 20, and there is a 75% chance that the webbing won't burn if any sort of fire is applied to it (check each round).

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 20); initial damage 1d6 temporary Constitution, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Constitution. Bebilith venom is highly perishable, losing its potency and becoming inert, foul-smelling goo almost as soon as it comes into contact with air.

SpecialAbility.Name: Armor Damage
SpecialAbility.Text: A bebilith's claws can catch and tear an opponent's armor. If the opponent has both armor and a shield, roll 1d6: A roll of 1-4 affects the armor and a roll of 5-6 affects the shield. Make a grapple check whenever the bebilith hits with a claw attack, adding to the opponent's roll any magical bonus for the armor or shield. If the bebilith wins, the affected armor or shield is torn away and ruined.

SpecialAbility.Name: Protective Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: A magic circle against chaos, evil, good, or law effect always surrounds a bebilith, identical with the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer. The bebilith usually chooses magic circle against chaos but can change the aura each round as a free action. The aura can be dispelled, but the bebilith can create it again during its next turn as a free action. (The defensive benefits from the aura are not included in the creature's statistics.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Plane Shift
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability affects only the bebilith. It is otherwise similar to the spell of the same name.

StatsBlock.Name: Behir
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +14 melee (2d4+8) or 6 claws x1 +9 melee (1d4+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Improved Grab, Swallow Whole, Constrict 2d8+8
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 7, Wis 14, Cha 12

Description.General: Behirs speak Common.
Description.Combat: A behir usually bites and grabs its prey first, then either swallows or constricts the opponent. If beset by a large number of foes, it uses its breath weapon.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Line of lightning 5 feet wide, 5 feet high, and 20 feet long, once a minute; damage 7d6, Reflex half DC 19.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the behir must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can attempt to swallow or constrict the opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A behir can try to swallow a grabbed Medium-size or smaller opponent by making a successful grapple check. A behir that swallows an opponent can use its Cleave feat to bite and grab another opponent. The swallowed creature takes 2d8+8 points of crushing damage and 8 points of acid damage per round from the behir's gizzard. A swallowed creature can also cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must again cut its own way out. The behir's gizzard can hold two Medium-size, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A behir deals 2d8+8 damage with a successful grapple check against Gargantuan or smaller creatures. It can use its claws against the grappled foe as well.

StatsBlock.Name: Beholder
StatsBlock.Attacks: Eye rays melee (2d4) or bite melee ()
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Eye rays x1 +5 melee (2d4) or bite x1 melee ()
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 17, Wis 15, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Shot On The Run

Description.General: Beholders speak their own language and the Common tongue.

SpecialAbility.Name: Eye Rays
SpecialAbility.Text:
Each of the ten small eyes can produce a magical ray once a round, even when the beholder is attacking physically or moving at full speed. The creature can easily aim all its eyes upward, but its own body tends to get in the way when it tries to aim the rays in other directions. During a round, the creature can aim only three eye rays at targets in any one arc other than up (forward, backward, left, right, or down). The remaining eyes must aim at targets in other arcs or not at all. A beholder can tilt and pan its body each round to change which rays it can bring to bear in an arc. Each eye's effect resembles a spell cast by a 13th-level sorcerer but follows the rules for a ray. All rays have a range of 150 feet and a save DC of 18.
  • Charm Person: The target must succeed at a Will save or be affected as though by the spell. Beholders use this ray to confuse the opposition, usually employing it early in a fight. The beholder generally instructs a charmed target to either restrain a comrade or stand aside.
  • Charm Monster: The target must succeed at a Will save or be affected as though by the spell. Beholders use this ray in the same manner as the charm person ray.
  • Sleep: This works like the spell, except that it affects one creature with any number of Hit Dice. The target must succeed at a Will save to resist. Beholders like to use this ray against warriors and other physically powerful creatures. They know their foes can quickly awaken the sleepers, but they also know that doing so takes time and can delay an effective counterattack.
  • Flesh to Stone: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be affected as though by the spell. Beholders like to aim this ray at enemy spellcasters. They also use it on any creature whose appearance they find interesting. (After the fight, the beholder takes the statue to its lair as a decoration.)
  • Disintegrate: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be affected as though by the spell. The beholder likes to use this ray on any foe it considers a real threat.
  • Fear: This works like the spell, except that it targets one creature. The target must succeed at a Will save or be affected as though by the spell. Beholders like to use this ray against warriors and other powerful creatures early in a fight, to break up the opposition.
  • Slow: This works like the spell, except that it affects one creature. The target must make a Will save to resist. Beholders often use this ray against the same creature targeted by their disintegrate, flesh to stone, or finger of death rays. If one of the former rays fails to eliminate the foe, this ray might at least hamper it.
  • Inflict Moderate Wounds: This works just like the spell, causing 2d8+10 points of damage (Will half).
  • Finger of Death: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be slain as though by the spell. The target suffers 3d6+13 damage if his saving throw succeeds. Beholders use this ray to eliminate dangerous foes quickly.
  • Telekinesis: The beholder can move objects or creatures that weigh up to 325 pounds, as though with a telekinesis spell. Creatures can resist the effect with a successful Will save.
  • All-Around Vision (Ex): Beholders are exceptionally alert and circumspect. Their many eyes give them a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Search checks, and they can't be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Antimagic Cone
SpecialAbility.Text: A beholder's central eye continually produces a 150-foot antimagic cone extending straight ahead from the creature's front. This functions just like antimagic field cast by a 13th-level sorcerer. All magical and supernatural powers and effects within the cone are suppressed-even the beholder's own eye rays. Once each round, during its turn, the beholder decides which way it will face, and whether the antimagic cone is active or not (the beholder deactivates the cone by shutting its central eye). Note that a beholder can bite only creatures to its front.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flight
SpecialAbility.Text: A beholder's body is naturally buoyant. This buoyancy allows it to fly as the spell, as a free action, at a speed of 20 feet. This buoyancy also grants it a permanent feather fall effect with personal range.

StatsBlock.Name: Belker
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 wings melee (1d6+2) or bite melee (1d4+1) or 2 claws melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 wings x1 +4 melee (1d6+2) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d4+1) or 2 claws x1 +2 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 21, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.Combat: In most cases, a belker fights with its nasty claws and painful bite.

SpecialAbility.Name: Smoke Claws
SpecialAbility.Text: A belker in smoke form (see below) can engulf opponents by moving on top of them. It fills the air around one Medium-size or smaller opponent without provoking an attack of opportunity. The target must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or inhale part of the creature. Smoke inside the victim solidifies into a claw or talon and begins to rip at the surrounding organs, dealing 3d4 points of damage per round. The affected creature can attempt another Fortitude save each subsequent round to cough out the semivaporous menace.

SpecialAbility.Name: Smoke Form
SpecialAbility.Text: Most of the time a belker is more or less solid, but at will it can assume a smoke form. It can switch forms once a round as a free action and can spend up to 20 rounds per day in smoke form. A belker in smoke form can fly at a speed of 50 feet (perfect maneuverability). The ability is otherwise similar to a gaseous form spell cast by a 7th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Bison
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Butt x1 +6 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 10, Con 16, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

SpecialAbility.Name: Stampede
SpecialAbility.Text: A frightened herd of bison flees as a group in a random direction (but always away from the perceived source of danger). They literally run over anything of size Large or smaller that gets in their way, dealing 1d12 points of damage for each five bison in the herd. A successful Reflex save (DC 16) halves the damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Black Pudding
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +7 melee (2d6+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Acid, Constrict 2d6+4 And 2d6 Acid
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 1, Con 19, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Ooze
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: An ooze's entire body is a primitive sensory organ that can ascertain prey by scent and vibration within 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the black pudding must hit with its slam attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: The pudding secretes a digestive acid that dissolves organic material and metal quickly. Any melee hit deals acid damage. The pudding's acidic touch deals 50 points of damage per round to wood or metal objects. The opponent's armor and clothing dissolve and become useless immediately unless they succeed at Reflex saves (DC 19). The acid can dissolve stone, dealing 20 points of damage per round of contact. A metal or wooden weapon that strikes a black pudding also dissolves immediately unless it succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 19).

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A black pudding deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check. The opponent's clothing and armor suffer a -4 penalty to Reflex saves against the acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Split
SpecialAbility.Text: Weapons deal no damage to a black pudding. Instead the creature splits into two identical puddings, each with half the original's hit points (round down). A pudding with only 1 hit point cannot be further split.

StatsBlock.Name: Blink Dog
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +4 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.General: They speak their own language.
Description.Combat: Blink dogs hunt in packs, teleporting in a seemingly random fashion until they surround their prey, allowing some of them to make flank attacks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blink
SpecialAbility.Text: A blink dog can blink as the spell cast by an 8th-level sorcerer, and can evoke or end the effect as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dimension Door
SpecialAbility.Text: A blink dog can teleport as dimension door cast by an 8th-level sorcerer, once per round as a free action. The ability affects only the blink dog, which never appears within a solid object and can act immediately after teleporting.

StatsBlock.Name: Blue Slaad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 rakes x1 +11 melee (2d6+4) or bite x1 +9 melee (2d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 6, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +14, Jump +15, Listen +8, Move Silently +9, Spot +8

Description.Characters: Slaadi rarely have the focus to devote themselves to a character class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: hold person, passwall, and telekinesis. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 10th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level).
Once per day three blue slaadi working together can produce chaos hammer (save DC 16) as the spell cast by a 15th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Disease
SpecialAbility.Text: The bite of a blue slaad can cause a terrible transformation. Affected creatures must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) or be infected with a disease that transforms the victim over the next week into a red slaad. The infected creature can attempt a new save each day to throw off the infection. If the infected being is an arcane spellcaster, the disease instead produces a green slaad.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Slaad
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a blue slaad can attempt to summon another blue slaad with a 40% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A slaad that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All slaadi have acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic resistance 5.

StatsBlock.Name: Boar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +2 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 4

SpecialAbility.Name: Ferocity
SpecialAbility.Text: A boar is such a tenacious combatant that it continues to fight without penalty even while disabled or dying.

StatsBlock.Name: Boar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +10 melee (1d8+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 8

SpecialAbility.Name: Ferocity
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire boar is such a tenacious combatant that it continues to fight without penalty even while disabled or dying.

StatsBlock.Name: Bodak
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +5 melee (1d8+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistance (), Immunities (Electricity ), Regeneration, Flashbacks
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 12

Description.Combat: Bodaks love to approach their opponents at a leisurely pace, letting their gaze do its work before closing.

SpecialAbility.Name: Death Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Death, range 30 feet, Fortitude negates DC 15. Humanoids who die from this attack are transformed into bodaks in one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sunlight Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: Bodaks loathe sunlight, for its merest touch burns their impure flesh. Each round of exposure to the direct rays of the sun deals 1 point of damage to the creature.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flashbacks
SpecialAbility.Text: From time to time, a bodak sees something that reminds it of its almost-forgotten life. At the start of every encounter, there is a 5% chance that it notices something about an opponent (randomly determined, if more than one opponent is present) that causes it to recall its life. If this happens, the bodak takes no action for 1 round and thereafter suffers a -2 morale penalty to all attacks directed at that opponent.

StatsBlock.Name: Bugbear
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Morningstar x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)javelin x1 +2 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 12, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 9
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +2, Hide +3, Listen +3, Move Silently +6, Spot +3

Description.General: Bugbears speak Goblin and Common.
Description.Combat: Bugbears prefer to ambush opponents whenever possible. When hunting, they normally send scouts ahead of the main group who, if they spy prey, return to report and bring up reinforcements. Bugbear attacks are coordinated, and their tactics are sound if not brilliant.
Description.Skills: Bugbears receive a +4 racial bonus to Move Silently checks.
Description.Characters: A bugbear's favored class is rogue. Most bugbear leaders are fighters or fighter/rogues. Bugbear clerics (favored weapon: morningstar) can choose any two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, Trickery, and War.

StatsBlock.Name: Bulette
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (2d8+8) or 2 claws x1 +7 melee (2d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 15, Con 20, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

Description.Combat: A bulette attacks anything it regards as edible, choosing the easiest or closest prey first. The only creatures it refuses to eat are elves, and it dislikes dwarves. When burrowing underground, the landshark relies on vibrations to detect prey. When it senses something edible (that is, senses movement), it breaks to the surface, crest first, and begins its attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Leap
SpecialAbility.Text: A bulette can jump into the air during combat. This allows it to make four claw attacks instead of two, but it cannot bite. The attack bonus is +12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Bulettes can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Camel
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d4+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 1, Wis 11, Cha 4

Description.General: The two-humped, or Bactrian, camel is suited to cooler, rocky areas. It is stockier, slower (speed 40), and has a better Constitution score (16).
Description.Carrying: A light load for a camel is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; a heavy load, 601-900 pounds. A camel can drag 4,500 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Carrion Crawler
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 tentacles x1 +1 melee (+2) or bite x1 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 1, Wis 15, Cha 6

Description.Combat: Carrion crawlers use their keen senses of sight and smell to detect carcasses and potential prey. When attacking, a crawler lashes out with all eight tentacles and tries to paralyze its victim. The tentacles deal no other damage. The creature then kills the paralyzed victim with its bite and devours the flesh. Multiple crawlers do not fight in concert, but each paralyzes as many opponents as possible. The unintelligent creature continues to attack as long as it faces any moving opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Those hit by a carrion crawler's tentacle attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 13) or be paralyzed for 2d6 minutes.

StatsBlock.Name: Cat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d2) or bite x1 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7
StatsBlock.Skills: Balance +10, Climb +5, Hide +17, Listen +4, Move Silently +9, Spot +4

Description.Skills: Cats receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus rises to +8.

StatsBlock.Name: Centaur
StatsBlock.Attacks: Greatclub melee (1d10+4) or Unknown (1d6+2)mighty composite longbow melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Greatclub x1 +6 melee (1d10+4) or Unknown (1d6+2)mighty composite longbow x1 +6 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 14, Con 15, Int 8, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.General: Centaurs speak Sylvan and Elven.
Description.Combat: Centaurs usually don't provoke a fight. Their normal response to aggression is swift retreat, perhaps launching a few arrows to discourage pursuit. Against creatures dangerous to their communities, they use much the same tactics, except that about half their number will circle around to lie in ambush or attack the foe from the rear.
Description.Characters: Centaurs sometimes become bards, rangers, or druids. Their favored class is ranger. Centaur rangers often choose a magical beast or some variety of humanoid as their favored enemy. Centaur clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Animal, Good, and Plant.

StatsBlock.Name: Chaos Beast
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Spell Resistance, Immune To Transformation, Immune Tocritical Hits
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +12, Escape Artist +11, Hide +10, Jump +10, Listen +9, Spot +9, Tumble +10

Description.General: Chaos beasts do not speak.
Description.Combat: Regardless of form, the creature seems unable to manage more than two attacks per round. Its continual transmutations prevent the coordination needed to do more.

SpecialAbility.Name: Corporeal Instability
SpecialAbility.Text: A blow from a chaos beast can cause a terrible transformation. A living creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or become a spongy, amorphous mass. Unless controlled through an act of will, the victim's shape melts, flows, writhes, and boils. The affected creature is unable to hold or use any item. Clothing, armor, rings, helmets, and backpacks become useless. Large items: armor, backpacks, even shirts hamper more than help, reducing the creature's Dexterity score by 4. Soft or misshapen feet and legs reduce speed to 10 feet or one-quarter normal, whichever is less. Searing pain courses along the nerves, so strong that the creature cannot act coherently. It cannot cast spells or use magic items, and it attacks blindly, unable to distinguish friend from foe (-4 penalty to hit and a 50% miss chance, regardless of the attack roll). Each round the creature spends in an amorphous state deals 1 point of permanent Wisdom drain from mental shock. If the creature's Wisdom score falls to 0, it becomes a chaos beast itself. A creature with a strong sense of self can regain its own shape by taking a standard action to attempt a Charisma check (DC 15). A success reestablishes the creature's normal form for 1 minute. On a failure, the creature can still repeat the check each round until successful. Corporeal instability is not a disease or a curse and so is hard to remove. A shapechange or stoneskin spell does not cure the afflicted creature but fixes its form for the duration of the spell. A restoration, heal, or greater restoration spell removes the affliction (a separate restoration is necessary to restore any lost Wisdom).

SpecialAbility.Name: Immune to Transformation
SpecialAbility.Text: No mortal magic can affect or fix a chaos beast's form. Effects such as polymorph or petrification force the creature into a new shape for a moment, but it immediately returns to its mutable form as a free action.

StatsBlock.Name: Cheetah
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d6+3) or 2 claws x1 melee (1d2+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 19, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A cheetah that hits with a claw or bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the cheetah.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sprint
SpecialAbility.Text: Once an hour, a cheetah can take a charge action to move ten times its normal speed (500 feet).

StatsBlock.Name: Chimera
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (2d6+4) or bite melee (1d8+2) or butt melee (1d8+1) or 2 claw melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (2d6+4) or bite x1 +9 melee (1d8+2) or butt x1 +9 melee (1d8+1) or 2 claw x1 +9 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 4, Wis 13, Cha 10

Description.General: Chimeras can speak Draconic but seldom bother to do so, except when toadying to more powerful creatures.
Description.Combat: A deadly foe, the chimera prefers to surprise prey. It often swoops down from the sky or lies concealed until it charges. The dragon head can loose a breath weapon instead of biting. Several chimeras attack in concert.
Description.Skills: The chimera's three heads give it a +2 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text:
Every 1d4 rounds, damage 3d8, Reflex half DC 17. Use all rules for dragon breath of the appropriate variety (see the Dragon entry) except as specified in the table below. To determine the head color and breath weapon randomly, roll 1d10 and consult the table. 
1d10	Head Color	Breath Weapon
----	----------	-------------
1-2	Black		Line of acid
3-4	Blue		Line of lightning
5-6	Green		Cone of gas
7-8	Red		Cone of fire
9-10	White		Cone of cold
A line is always 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 40 feet long. A cone is always 20 feet long.

StatsBlock.Name: Choker
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 tentacle slaps x1 +4 melee (1d3+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 4, Wis 13, Cha 7

Description.General: Chokers speak Undercommon.
Description.Combat: A choker likes to perch near the ceiling, often at intersections, archways, wells, or staircases, and reach down to attack its prey.

SpecialAbility.Name: Haste
SpecialAbility.Text: Although not particularly dexterous, a choker is supernaturally quick. It can take an extra partial action each round, as if affected by a haste spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the choker must hit an opponent of up to Large size with a tentacle attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A choker deals 1d3+3 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Large or smaller creatures. Because it seizes victims by the neck, a creature in the choker's grasp cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components.

StatsBlock.Name: Chuul
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (2d6+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 16, Con 18, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 5

Description.Combat: A chuul prefers to wait by the shore, submerged in murky water, until it hears nearby prey (in or out of the water) that it can attack with surprise. A chuul facing multiple opponents grabs with its claws and crushes its foes, then passes one opponent to its tentacles. It tries to always have one claw free, so if it faces a great number of opponents, it drops paralyzed or dead victims without eating them and continues grabbing, crushing, and paralyzing the rest.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the chuul must hit with a claw attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Squeeze
SpecialAbility.Text: A chuul that gets a hold automatically deals claw damage, with an additional 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage from the crushing force, each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: The chuul can transfer grabbed victims from a claw to its tentacles as a partial action. The tentacles grapple with the same strength as the claw but deal no damage. However, they exude a paralytic secretion. Those held in the tentacles must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or be paralyzed for 6 rounds. While held in the tentacles, paralyzed or not, the victim automatically takes 1d8+2 points of damage each round from the creature's mandibles.

StatsBlock.Name: Clay
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +12 melee (2d10+7)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Construct, Immunities (Magic ), Damage Reduction 20/+1, Immune To Piercing And Slashing, Haste
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 1

Description.General:
A golem's creator can command it if the golem is within 60 feet and can see and hear its creator. If uncommanded, the golem usually follows its last instruction to the best of its ability, though if attacked it returns the attack. The creator can give the golem a simple program to govern its actions in his or her absence.
Golems do not need to breathe and are immune to most forms of energy.
Description.Construction:
The cost listed for each golem includes that of the physical body and all the materials and spell components that are consumed or become a permanent part of it.
Understanding the rituals requires a character of the required level with the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats. The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom. The chamber is similar to an alchemist's laboratory and costs 500 gp to establish.
When not working on the rituals, the creator must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If personally constructing the golem's body, the creator can perform the building and rituals together. If the creator misses a day of rituals, the process fails and must be started again. Money spent is lost, but XP spent are not. The golem's body can be reused, as can the laboratory.
Completing the ritual drains the appropriate XP from the creator and requires casting any spells on the final day. The creator must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls.
The clay golem costs 60,000 gp to create, including 1,500 gp for the body and 30,000 gp for vestments, which can be reused. Creating the body requires a successful Craft (sculpting or masonry) check (DC 15). The ritual requires a 16th-level creator who can cast divine spells.
