Completing the ritual drains 1,200 XP from the creator and requires animate objects, bless, commune, prayer, and resurrection.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Berserk
SpecialAbility.Text: When a clay golem enters combat, there is a cumulative 1% chance each round that its elemental spirit breaks free and goes berserk. The uncontrolled golem goes on a rampage, attacking the nearest living creature or smashing some object smaller than itself if no creature is within reach, then moving on to spread more destruction. Once the golem goes berserk, no known method can reestablish control.

SpecialAbility.Name: Wound
SpecialAbility.Text: The damage a clay golem deals doesn't heal naturally. Only a heal spell or a Healing spell of 6th level or higher can heal it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immune to Slashing and Piercing
SpecialAbility.Text: Slashing and piercing weapons, even enchanted ones, deal no damage to a clay golem.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Clay golems are immune to all spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural effects, except as follows. A move earth spell drives the golem back 120 feet and deals 3d12 points of damage to it. A disintegrate spell slows the golem (as the slow spell) for 1d6 rounds and deals 1d12 points of damage. An earthquake cast directly at a clay golem stops it from moving that round and deals 5d10 points of damage. The golem gets no saving throw against any of these effects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Haste
SpecialAbility.Text: After it has engaged in at least 1 round of combat, a clay golem can haste itself once per day as a free action. The effect lasts 3 rounds and is otherwise the same as the spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Cloaker
StatsBlock.Attacks: Tail slap melee (1d6+5) or bite melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Tail slap x1 +7 melee (1d6+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 16, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 15

Description.Combat: Cloakers usually lie still, watching and listening for prey. If facing a single opponent, a cloaker uses its engulf attack. Against multiple foes, it lashes with its tail in concert with its moan and shadow shift abilities to reduce the opposition's numbers, then engulfs a survivor. Multiple cloakers usually split up, leaving one or two behind to use special abilities while the rest attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Moan
SpecialAbility.Text:
A cloaker can emit a dangerous subsonic moan instead of biting. By changing the frequency, the cloaker may cause one of four effects. Cloakers are immune to these sonic, mind-affecting attacks. Unless noted otherwise, creatures who successfully save against these effects cannot be affected by the same moan effect from the same cloaker for one day.
  • Unnerve: All within an 80-foot spread automatically suffer a -2 morale penalty to attack and damage rolls. Those forced to hear the moan for more than 6 consecutive rounds must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or enter a trance, unable to attack or defend themselves until the moaning stops. Even on a success, they must repeat the save in each round the moaning continues.
  • Fear: All those within a 30-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or flee in terror for 2 rounds.
  • Nausea: Everyone in a 30-foot cone must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be overcome by nausea and weakness. Affected characters fall to the ground and are unable to take any actions, including defending themselves, for 1d4+1 rounds.
  • Stupor: A single creature within 30 feet of the cloaker must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be affected as though by a hold person spell for 5 rounds. Even after a successful save, the creature must repeat the save if the cloaker uses this effect again.

SpecialAbility.Name: Engulf
SpecialAbility.Text: A cloaker can try to wrap a Medium-size or smaller creature in its body as a standard action. The cloaker attempts a grapple that does not provoke an attack of opportunity. If it gets a hold, it bites the engulfed victim with a +4 attack bonus. It can still use its whiplike tail to strike at other targets. Attacks that hit an engulfing cloaker deal half their damage to the monster and half to the trapped victim.

SpecialAbility.Name: Shadow Shift
SpecialAbility.Text:
Cloakers can manipulate shadows. This ability is effective only in shadowy areas and has several possible effects.
  • Obscure Vision: The cloaker gains one-quarter concealment (10% miss chance) for 1d4 rounds.
  • Dancing Images: This duplicates a mirror image spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.
  • Silent Image: This duplicates a silent image spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Cloud Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gargantuan morningstar x3 +22/+17/+12 melee (4d6+18)rock x3 +22/+17/+12 melee (2d8+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 35, Dex 13, Con 23, Int 12, Wis 12, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Description.Skills: Cloud giants have EHD as though they were large creatures.
Description.Feats: Cloud giants have EHD as though they were large creatures.
Description.Characters: Good clerics have access to any two of the following domains: Good, Healing, Strength, and Sun. Evil clerics have access to any two of the following domains: Death, Evil, and Trickery.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Cloud giants who dwell on cloud islands (see below) can use the following as the spells cast by a 15th-level sorcerer: 3/day-levitate (self plus 2,000 pounds) and obscuring mist; 1/day-fog cloud.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Cockatrice
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 9

Description.Combat: The cockatrice fiercely attacks anything that it deems a threat to itself or its lair. Flocks of cockatrices do their utmost to overwhelm and confuse their foes, and sometimes fly directly into their opponents' faces.

SpecialAbility.Name: Petrification
SpecialAbility.Text: A cockatrice can turn beings to stone with a touch. Creatures hit by a cockatrice must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or instantly turn to stone.

SpecialAbility.Name: Petrification Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Cockatrices are immune to the petrifying ability of other cockatrices, but other petrifying attacks affect them normally (a medusa's gaze, gorgon's breath, a flesh to stone spell, etc.).

StatsBlock.Name: Colossal Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +33 melee (4d6+13)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 4, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Colossal Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +24 melee (2d8+8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Colossal Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +33 melee (4d6+13)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 6, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 3

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Cornugon (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Whip melee (1d6+5) or tail melee (1d4+2) Unknown (1d4+2) or Unknown (1d3+5)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Whip x3 +12/+7/+2 melee (1d6+5) or tail x1 +7 melee (1d4+2) x1 +12 Unknown (1d4+2) or x1 +7 Unknown (1d3+5)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Spell-Like Abilities, Fear Aura, Stun, Wound, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Baatezu Qualities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +14, Climb +16, Concentration +15, Hide +7, Listen +14, Move Silently +14, Search +14, Sense Motive +14, Spot +14

Description.General: Cornugons speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: animate dead, charm person, desecrate, detect good, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel chaos, dispel good, magic circle against good, major image, produce flame, pyrotechnics, suggestion, and teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only); 3/day-fireball and lightning bolt; 1/day-wall of fire. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, a cornugon can create an aura of fear in a 5-foot radius. It is otherwise identical with fear cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 17). If the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that cornugon's fear aura for one day. Other baatezu are immune to the aura.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stun
SpecialAbility.Text: Whenever a cornugon hits with a whip attack, the opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) or be stunned for 1d4 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Wound
SpecialAbility.Text: A hit from a cornugon's tail attack causes a bleeding wound. The injured creature loses 2 additional hit points each round until the wound is bound (a DC 10 Heal check) or the creature dies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a cornugon can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures or 1d6 barbazu with a 50% chance of success, 1d6 hamatulas with a 35% chance of success, or another cornugon with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Cornugons take normal damage from acid, and from holy and blessed weapons of at least +2 enchantment.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Couatl
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (1d3+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 17, Wis 19, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +14, Knowledge +8, Listen +16, Search +15, Sense Motive +16, Spellcraft +15, Spot +16, Tumble +15

Description.General: Couatls speak Common, Draconic, and Celestial and also have the power of telepathy.
Description.Combat: A couatl seldom attacks without provocation, though it always attacks evildoers caught red-handed. Since it is highly intelligent, a couatl usually casts spells from a distance before closing. If more than one couatl is involved, they discuss their strategy before a battle.
Description.Skills: Arcana, history, and nature are favored Knowledge skills among couatls.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: A couatl casts spells as a 9th-level sorcerer, except that it does not need material components. It can also cast spells from the cleric list and from the Air, Good, and Law domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: detect chaos, detect evil, detect good, detect law, detect thoughts, invisibility, plane shift, and polymorph self. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 16); initial damage 2d4 temporary Strength, secondary damage 4d4 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A couatl deals 2d8+6 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Huge or smaller creatures. Often, a couatl uses a stilled and quickened spell against other opponents while constricting a foe.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A couatl can communicate telepathically with any creature within 90 feet that has an Intelligence score of at least 1. The creature can respond to the couatl if it wishes-no common language is needed.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ethereal Jaunt
SpecialAbility.Text: This works like the spell as cast by a 16th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Criosphinx
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Butt x1 +13 melee (2d6+6) or 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a sphinx leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A sphinx that pounces onto a creature can make two rake attacks with its hind legs. Attack bonus +15 melee, damage 1d6+3.

StatsBlock.Name: Crocodile
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +4 melee (1d8+6)tail slap x1 +4 melee (1d12+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: *A crocodile gains a +12 racial bonus to Hide checks when submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the crocodile must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, the crocodile grabs the opponent with its mouth and drags it into deep water, attempting to pin it to the bottom. The crocodile automatically deals bite damage each round it maintains the pin.

StatsBlock.Name: Crocodile, Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +9 melee (2d8+12)tail slap x1 +9 melee (1d12+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 12, Con 19, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.General: Giant crocodiles can grab and hold creatures of Large or smaller size but otherwise fight and behave like their smaller cousins.

StatsBlock.Name: Dark Naga
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +7 melee (2d4+2) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 16, Wis 15, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +9, Concentration +13, Listen +11, Sense Motive +8, Spellcraft +12, Spot +11
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Lightning Reflexes

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Thoughts
SpecialAbility.Text: A dark naga can continuously detect thoughts as the spell cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (DC 15). This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 16) or lapse into a nightmare-haunted sleep for 2d4 minutes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Guarded Thoughts
SpecialAbility.Text: Dark nagas are immune to any form of mind reading.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charm Resistance
SpecialAbility.Text: Dark nagas receive a +2 racial bonus to saving throws against all charm effects (not included in the statistics block).

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Dark nagas cast spells as 7th-level sorcerers.

StatsBlock.Name: Darkmantle
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +4 melee (1d4+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 10, Cha 10

Description.Combat: A darkmantle attacks by dropping onto its prey and wrapping its tentacles around the opponent's head. Once attached, it squeezes and tries to suffocate the foe. A darkmantle that misses its initial attack often flies up and tries to drop on the opponent again.
Description.Skills: A darkmantle receives a +4 racial bonus to Listen checks. *This bonus is lost if its blindsight is negated. The creature's variable coloration gives it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a darkmantle can cause darkness as the spell cast by a 5th-level sorcerer. It most often uses this ability just before attacking.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the darkmantle must hit with its slam attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A darkmantle deals 1d4+4 damage with a successful grapple check.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: A darkmantle can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allows it to ascertain objects and creatures within 90 feet. A silence spell negates this and effectively blinds the darkmantle.

StatsBlock.Name: Death Slaad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +17 melee (3d6+5) or bite x1 +15 melee (2d10+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Damage Reduction 20/+2, Telepathy, Resistances, Alternate Form
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 18, Con 17, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +23, Escape Artist +22, Hide +22, Jump +23, Knowledge +22, Listen +22, Move Silently +22, Search +22, Spot +22
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Improved Initiative, Multiattack, Power Attack

Description.Characters: Slaadi rarely have the focus to devote themselves to a character class. The most powerful death slaadi take on evil aspects and train as rogues to take the assassin class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stun
SpecialAbility.Text: A death slaad can use Stunning Fist as the feat, three times per day. The save DC is 21.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: animate objects, circle of death, chaos hammer, cloak of chaos, deeper darkness, detect magic, dispel law, fear, finger of death, fireball, fly, identify, invisibility, magic circle against law, power word blind, see invisibility, shatter, and word of chaos; 1/day-implosion. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 14 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text:
A death slaad can shift between its natural and any humanoid form at will as a standard action. A death slaad whose personal treasure includes magic weapons will use these when in humanoid form.
A death slaad remains in humanoid form indefinitely. The ability is otherwise similar to polymorph self cast by a 15th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Slaad
SpecialAbility.Text: Twice per day a death slaad can attempt to summon 1-2 red or blue slaadi with a 40% chance of success, or 1-2 green slaadi with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A slaad that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All slaadi have acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic resistance 5.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Death slaadi can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Deep Dwarf
StatsBlock.Attacks: Dwarven waraxe melee (1d10) or shortbo melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dwarven waraxe x1 melee (1d10) or shortbo x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 6

Description.General: Deep dwarves speak Dwarven and Goblin, and occasionally Draconic or Undercommon.
Description.Skills: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft or Profession checks that are related to stone or metal.
Description.Characters: A deep dwarf's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dwarven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Deep dwarves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against orcs and goblinoids, through special combat training.
  • +3 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +3 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against all poisons.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants, through special defensive training.
  • Darkvision up to 90 feet.
  • Light Sensitivity (Ex): Deep dwarves suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls in bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A dwarf who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A dwarf can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Deep Halfling
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8)heavy crossbow x1 melee (1d10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +0, Hide +5, Jump +0, Listen +3, Move Silently +4

Description.General: Deep Halflings speak Halfling, Common, and Dwarven.
Description.Combat: Halflings prefer to fight defensively, usually hiding and launching ranged attacks as the foe approaches.
Description.Skills: Deep halflings receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft checks that are related to stone or metal. Their keen hearing bestows a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks.
Description.Characters: A deep halfling's favored class is rogue.

SpecialAbility.Name: Deep Halfling Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Deep halflings benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Halflings gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • +1 racial bonus to all saving throws.
  • +2 morale bonus to saving throws against fear. (This bonus stacks with the halfling's +1 bonus to saving throws in general.)
  • +1 racial attack bonus with a thrown weapon.
  • Darkvision up to 60 feet.
  • Stonecunning: Like dwarves, deep halflings receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but that is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A deep halfling who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A deep halfling can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Deinonychus
StatsBlock.Attacks: Rake melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws melee (1d3+2) or bite melee (2d4+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Rake x1 +6 melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3+2) or bite x1 +1 melee (2d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +7, Jump +13, Listen +11, Spot +11, Wilderness Lore +9

Description.Skills: A deinonychus receives a +8 racial bonus to Hide, Jump, Listen, Spot, and Wilderness Lore checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Delver
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +15 melee (1d6+8)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Acid ), Corrosive Slime, Tremorsense, Stone Shape
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Intuit Direction +9, Knowledge +9, Listen +13, Move Silently +19, Spot +13
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Improved Initiative, Power Attack

Description.General: Delvers speak Terran and Undercommon.
Description.Combat: Delvers prefer to fight from their tunnels, which they use to protect their flanks while lashing out with their flippers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Corrosive Slime
SpecialAbility.Text: Delvers produce a mucuslike slime that contains a highly corrosive substance. The slime is particularly effective against stone. A delver's mere touch deals 2d6 points of damage to organic creatures or objects. Against metallic creatures or objects, a delver's slime deals 4d8 points of damage, and against stony creatures (including earth elementals) or objects it deals 8d10 points of damage. A slam attack by a delver leaves a patch of slime that deals 2d6 points of damage on contact and another 2d6 points of damage in each of the next 2 rounds. A large quantity (at least a quart) of water or weak acid, such as vinegar, washes off the slime. An opponent's armor and clothing dissolve and become useless immediately unless the wearer succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 22). Weapons that strike a delver also dissolve immediately unless the wielder succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 22). Creatures attacking the delver with natural weapons take damage from the slime each time their attacks hit unless they succeed at Reflex saves (DC 22).

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: A delver can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stone Shape
SpecialAbility.Text: A delver can alter its slime to temporarily soften stone instead of dissolving it. Once every 10 minutes, a delver can soften and shape up to 25 cubic feet of stone, as stone shape cast by a 15th-level druid.

StatsBlock.Name: Derro
StatsBlock.Attacks: Dagger melee (1d4) or repeating light crossbo melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4) or repeating light crossbo x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Dark Vision, Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Derro Traits
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 9, Dex 14, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 6

Description.Combat: Derro are encountered only in squads or platoons, carrying daggers, spiked bucklers, and repeating light crossbows that fire poisoned bolts. This poison is either greenblood oil or a substance that causes initial and secondary damage of 2d6 points of temporary Strength (Fortitude negates DC 14). Derro have very few clerics, but those who follow this path can choose two of the following domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, and Trickery. Derro savants are at least 5th-level sorcerers; they have one to three Knowledge skills (usually arcana and other esoteric fields) and are able to use any magic item or weapon. A savant is accompanied by two lower-level students, each of which has one minor magic item.
Description.Skills: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft or Profession checks that are related to stone or metal.
Description.Characters: A derro's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Derro Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Derro benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Spell resistance 18.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against orcs and goblinoids, through special combat training.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +2 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against all poisons.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants, through special defensive training.
  • Darkvision up to 30 feet.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A dwarf who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A dwarf can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.
  • Sunlight Vulnerability (Ex): Derro take 1 point of temporary Constitution damage for every hour they are exposed to sunlight, dying when their Constitution reaches 0. Lost Constitution points are recovered at the rate of 1 per day out of the sun.
  • Blind-Fight feat.

StatsBlock.Name: Destrachan
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +9 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 12, Con 16, Int 12, Wis 18, Cha 12

Description.General: A destrachan speaks no language but understands Common. If one must communicate, it does so through action.
Description.Combat: A destrachan uses its claws only as a last resort or to finish off foes weakened by its sonic attacks. Being extremely intelligent, it often enters battle with surprise if possible. It first focuses on destroying metal armor and weapons and then changes to harmonics that disrupt flesh.
Description.Skills: With perhaps the most sophisticated auditory organs in existence, the destrachan gains a +10 racial bonus to Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Destructive Harmonics
SpecialAbility.Text:
A destrachan can blast sonic energy in a cone up to 80 feet long. It can tune the harmonics of this destructive power to affect different types of targets.
  • Flesh: Disrupting tissue and rending bone, this horrible attack deals 4d6 points of damage to all within the cone (Reflex half DC 15).
  • Nerves: The destrachan can focus its harmonics to subdue rather than slay. This attack plays havoc with nerves and sensory systems, dealing 6d6 points of subdual damage to all within the cone (Reflex half DC 15).
  • Material: The destrachan chooses wood, stone, metal, or glass. All objects made of that material within the cone must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or shatter. Objects (or portions of objects) that have up to 30 hit points are potentially affected by this attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reverberating Harmonics
SpecialAbility.Text: The destrachan can use a wall, a ceiling, or even a floor to reflect any of the sonic attacks listed above (except those that would damage the reflecting surface). This attack affects all within 30 feet of the destrachan, which is immune to the effects of its own ability.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: A destrachan can use hearing to ascertain all foes within 100 feet as a sighted creature would.

SpecialAbility.Name: Protection from Sonics
SpecialAbility.Text: While they can be affected by loud noises and sonic spells (such as ghost sound or silence), destrachans are less vulnerable to sound-based attacks (+4 circumstance bonus on all saves) because they can protect their ears. A destrachan whose sense of hearing is impaired is effectively blind, treating all targets as totally concealed.

StatsBlock.Name: Devourer
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (1d6+5)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Energy Drain, Trap Essence, Spell-Like Abilities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 16, Wis 16, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Expertise, Improved Initiative, Weapon Focus

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures hit by a devourer's claw attack or spectral hand ability receive one negative level. The Fortitude save to remove the negative level has a DC of 19.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trap Essence
SpecialAbility.Text: The devourer is named for its ability to consume an enemy's life essence. To do so, it must forgo its normal melee attacks and make a trap essence attack. This requires a normal attack roll to hit but deals no damage. The affected creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or die instantly. The slain creature's essence is trapped within the devourer's ribs, and the diminutive figure takes on that victim's features. The trapped essence cannot be raised or resurrected, but a limited wish, miracle, or wish spell frees it, as does destroying the devourer. A devourer can hold only one essence at a time. The trapped essence provides the devourer with enough power to use five spell-like abilities per HD or level of the trapped creature. As this energy is expended, the twisted soul fades away until it evaporates completely. The trapped essence receives one negative level for every five spell-like uses. When the number of negative levels equals the creature's total HD or level, the essence is destroyed. If an essence is freed, the restored creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) for each negative level or lose that level permanently.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At the start of any encounter, the trapped essence within a devourer is assumed to have 3d4+3 levels (enough fuel for 30 to 75 uses). Once per round, the devourer can use one of following as the spell cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level): confusion, control undead, ghoul touch, lesser planar ally, ray of enfeeblement, spectral hand, suggestion, and true seeing.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Deflection
SpecialAbility.Text: The trapped essence provides a measure of magical protection. If any of the following spells are cast at the devourer and overcome its spell resistance, they affect the imprisoned essence instead: banishment, chaos hammer, confusion, detect thoughts, dispel evil, dominate person, emotion, fear, geas/quest, holy word, hypnosis, imprisonment, magic jar, maze, suggestion, trap the soul, or any form of charm or compulsion. In many cases, this effectively neutralizes the spell (charming a trapped essence, for example, is useless). Some of them (banishment, for example), might eliminate the trapped essence, robbing the devourer of its magical powers until it can consume another.

StatsBlock.Name: Digester
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Rake x1 +11 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.Combat: When hunting, it looks about for a likely target, then charges forth and delivers a gout of acid. If the initial attack is insufficient to kill the prey, the digester attacks with its hind feet until it can spray acid again.
Description.Skills: The digester's coloration gives it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks. It also has a +4 racial bonus to Jump checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid Spray
SpecialAbility.Text: A digester can spray acid in a cone 20 feet long, dealing 4d8 points of damage to everything in the area.Once a digester uses this ability, it can't use it again until 1d4 rounds later. The creature can also produce a concentrated stream of acid that deals 8d8 points of damage to a single target within 5 feet. In either case, a successful Reflex save (DC 17) halves the damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Displacer Beast
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 tentacles x1 +7 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 8

Description.Combat: Displacer beasts rake opponents with their tentacles and bite foes that get close.
Description.Skills: A displacer beast receives a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks, thanks to its displacement power.

SpecialAbility.Name: Displacement
SpecialAbility.Text: A light-bending glamer continually surrounds a displacer beast, making it difficult to surmise the creature's true location. Any melee or ranged attack directed at it has a 50% miss chance unless the attacker can locate the beast by some means other than sight. A true seeing effect allows the user to see the beast's position, but see invisibility has no effect.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistance to Ranged Attacks
SpecialAbility.Text: A displacer beast gains a +2 resistance bonus to saves against any ranged spell or ranged magical attack that specifically targets it (except for ranged touch attacks).

StatsBlock.Name: Djinni
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x2 +7/+2 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 19, Con 14, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +9, Concentration +9, Craft +11, Escape Artist +11, Knowledge +9, Listen +9, Move Silently +9, Sense Motive +9, Spellcraft +9, Spot +9
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Djinn speak Auran, Celestial, Common, and Ignan.

SpecialAbility.Name: Air Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: Airborne creatures suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to attack and damage rolls against a djinni.

SpecialAbility.Name: Whirlwind
SpecialAbility.Text:
The djinni can transform itself into a whirlwind once every 10 minutes and remain in that form for up to 7 rounds. In this form, it can move through the air or along a surface at its fly speed. The whirlwind is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 30 feet wide at the top and up to 50 feet tall. The djinni controls the exact height, but it must be at least 10 feet. Medium-size or smaller creatures might take damage when caught in the whirlwind and be lifted into the air. An affected creature must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 20) when it comes into contact with the whirlwind or take 3d6 points of damage. It must also succeed at a second Reflex save or be picked up bodily and held suspended in the powerful winds, automatically taking 1d8 points of damage each round. A creature that can fly is allowed a Reflex save (DC 20) each round to escape the whirlwind. The creature still takes damage but can leave if the save is successful. The djinni can eject any carried creatures whenever it wishes, depositing them wherever the whirlwind happens to be.
If the whirlwind's base touches the ground, it creates a swirling cloud of debris. This cloud is centered on the djinni and has a diameter equal to half the whirlwind's height. The cloud obscures all vision, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. Creatures 5 feet away have one-half concealment, while those farther away have total concealment. Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check (DC 20) to cast a spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/round-invisibility (self only); 1/day-create food and water, create wine (as create water, but wine instead), major creation (created vegetable matter is permanent), persistent image, and wind walk. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). Once per day, a djinni can assume gaseous form (as the spell) for up to 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plane Shift
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can enter any of the elemental planes, the Astral Plane, or the Material Plane. This ability transports the genie and up to six other creatures, provided they all link hands with the genie. It is otherwise similar to the spell of the same name.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Dog
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Skills: *Dogs receive a +8 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

StatsBlock.Name: Dog, Riding
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.General: If trained for war, these animals can make trip attacks just as wolves do (see the Wolf entry). A riding dog can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Skills: *Riding dogs receive a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a riding dog is up to 100 pounds; a medium load, 101-200 pounds; a heavy load, 201-300 pounds. A riding dog can drag 1,500 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Donkey
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 1, Wis 11, Cha 4

Description.Skills: Donkeys receive a +2 racial bonus to Balance.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a donkey is up to 50 pounds; a medium load, 51-100 pounds; a heavy load, 101-150 pounds. A donkey can drag 750 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Doppelganger
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +4 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +12, Disguise +12, Listen +11, Sense Motive +6, Spot +8

Description.Skills: A doppelganger receives a +4 racial bonus to Bluff and Disguise checks. *When using alter self, a doppelganger receives an additional +10 circumstance bonus to Disguise checks. If it can read an opponent's mind, it gets a further +4 circumstance bonus to Bluff and Disguise checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Thoughts
SpecialAbility.Text: A doppelganger can continuously detect thoughts as the spell cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 13). It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alter Self
SpecialAbility.Text: A doppelganger can assume the shape of any Small or Medium-size humanoid. This works like alter self as cast by an 18th-level sorcerer, but the doppelganger can remain in the chosen form indefinitely. It can assume a new form or return to its own as a standard action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Doppelgangers are immune to sleep and charm effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Dragon Turtle
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +18 melee (4d6+8) or 2 claws x1 +13 melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +7, Intimidate +16, Intuit Direction +10, Listen +18, Search +16, Spot +18

Description.General: Dragon turtles speak Aquan, Draconic, and Common.
Description.Skills: *Dragon turtles receive a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks when submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cloud of superheated steam 20 feet high, 25 feet wide, and 50 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 20d6, Reflex half DC 21; effective both on the surface and underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Snatch
SpecialAbility.Text: A dragon turtle that hits with a bite attack attempts to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it gets a hold on a creature three or more sizes smaller, it seizes the creature with its mouth and automatically deals bite damage each round. If it does not move and takes no other action in combat, it deals double bite damage to the snatched creature. A snatched creature gets no saving throw against the dragon turtle's breath weapon. The dragon turtle can drop a creature it has snatched as a free action or use a standard action to fling it aside. A flung creature travels 60 feet and takes 6d6 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Capsize
SpecialAbility.Text: A submerged dragon turtle that surfaces under a boat or ship less than 20 feet long capsizes the vessel 95% of the time. It has a 50% chance to capsize a vessel from 20 to 60 feet long and a 20% chance to capsize one over 60 feet long.

StatsBlock.Name: Dragon, Black, Adult
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (2d6+6) or 2 Claws melee (1d8+3) or 2 Wings melee (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +21 melee (2d6+6) or 2 Claws x1 +16 melee (1d8+3) or 2 Wings x1 +16 melee (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spells, Frightful Presence, Spell-Like Abilities
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Damage Reduction 5/+1, Spell Resistance, Water Breathing, Blindsight, Keen Senses
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 19, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +13, Concentration +13, Diplomacy +13, Escape Artist +13, Knowledge +12, Listen +19, Scry +12, Search +19, Spellcraft +19, Spot +19

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Line of acid 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 5x5x80 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 12d4, Reflex half DC 23; effective both on the surface and underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 19 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 180 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 20) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 3, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-darkness (radius 60 feet), 1/day-corrupt water (see below). These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer of level 6 (save DC 11 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Corrupt Water
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day the dragon can stagnate 10 cubic feet of water, making it become still, foul, and unable to support animal life. The ability spoils liquids containing water. Magic items (such as potions) and items in a creature's possession must succeed at a Will save (DC 20) or become fouled.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All black dragons are also immune to acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 180 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 600 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Dragon, Black, Ancient
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (2d8+11) or 2 Claws melee (2d6+5) or 2 Wings melee (1d8+2) or 1 Tail slap melee (2d6+12)1 Crush melee (2d8+11)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +37 melee (2d8+11) or 2 Claws x1 +32 melee (2d6+5) or 2 Wings x1 +32 melee (1d8+2) or 1 Tail slap x1 +32 melee (2d6+12)1 Crush x1 +37 melee (2d8+11)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spells, Frightful Presence, Spell-Like Abilities
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Damage Reduction 15/+2, Spell Resistance, Water Breathing, Blindsight, Keen Senses
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 33, Dex 10, Con 23, Int 16, Wis 17, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +31, Concentration +31, Diplomacy +31, Escape Artist +31, Knowledge +31, Listen +31, Scry +31, Search +31, Spellcraft +31, Spot +31

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Line of acid 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 5x5x100 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 20d4, Reflex half DC 31; effective both on the surface and underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 31 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 300 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 28) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 11, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-darkness (radius 100 feet) and insect plague; 1/day-plant growth. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer of level 11 (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Corrupt Water
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day the dragon can stagnate 10 cubic feet of water, making it become still, foul, and unable to support animal life. The ability spoils liquids containing water. Magic items (such as potions) and items in a creature's possession must succeed at a Will save (DC 28) or become fouled.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All black dragons are also immune to acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 300 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 1000 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Dragon, Black, Great wyrm
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 200 ft. (Clumsy)
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 200 ft. (Clumsy)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (4d6+13) or 2 Claws melee (2d8+6) or 2 Wings melee (2d6+3) or 1 Tail slap melee (2d8+14)1 Crush melee (4d6+19)1 Tail sweep melee (2d6+19)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +45 melee (4d6+13) or 2 Claws x1 +40 melee (2d8+6) or 2 Wings x1 +40 melee (2d6+3) or 1 Tail slap x1 +40 melee (2d8+14)1 Crush x1 +45 melee (4d6+19)1 Tail sweep x1 +45 melee (2d6+19)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spells, Frightful Presence, Spell-Like Abilities
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Damage Reduction 20/+3, Spell Resistance, Water Breathing, Blindsight, Keen Senses
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 37, Dex 10, Con 27, Int 20, Wis 21, Cha 20
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +50, Concentration +50, Diplomacy +49, Escape Artist +49, Knowledge +49, Listen +37, Scry +49, Search +37, Spellcraft +37, Spot +37

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Line of acid 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 5x5x120 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 24d4, Reflex half DC 36; effective both on the surface and underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 37 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 360 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 33) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 15, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-darkness (radius 120 feet), charm reptiles (see below), and insect plague; 1/day-plant growth. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer of level 15 (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Corrupt Water
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day the dragon can stagnate 10 cubic feet of water, making it become still, foul, and unable to support animal life. The ability spoils liquids containing water. Magic items (such as potions) and items in a creature's possession must succeed at a Will save (DC 33) or become fouled.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charm Reptiles
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can use this ability three times per day. It operates as a mass charm spell (as cast by a sorcerer of level 15) that works only on reptilian animals. The dragon can communicate with any charmed reptiles as though casting a speak with animals spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All black dragons are also immune to acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 360 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 1200 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Dragon, Black, Juvenile
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 150 ft. (Poor)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (1d8+3) or 2 Claws melee (1d6+1) or 2 Wings melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +15 melee (1d8+3) or 2 Claws x1 +10 melee (1d6+1) or 2 Wings x1 +10 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Water Breathing, Blindsight, Keen Senses
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Sound Imitation
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can mimic any voice or sound it has heard, anytime it likes. Listeners must succeed at a Will save (DC 31) to detect the ruse.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 300 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 1000 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Line of lightning 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 5x5x120 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 24d8, Reflex half DC 37; effective both on the surface and underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 39 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 360 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 35) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 17, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score. Can also cast cleric spells and those from the Air, Evil, and Law domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-ventriloquism; 1/day-hallucinatory terrain, veil, and mirage arcana. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 17 level sorcerer (save DC 16 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Create/Destroy Water
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can use this ability three times per day. It works like the create water spell (as by a 17 level sorcerer), except that the dragon can decide to destroy water instead of creating it, which automatically spoils unattended liquids containing water. Magic items (such as potions) and items in a creature's possession must succeed at a Will save (DC 35) or be ruined.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All blue dragons are also immune to electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sound Imitation
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can mimic any voice or sound it has heard, anytime it likes. Listeners must succeed at a Will save (DC 35) to detect the ruse.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 360 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 1200 feet.

It works like the create water spell (as by a 5 level sorcerer), except that the dragon can decide to destroy water instead of creating it, which automatically spoils unattended liquids containing water. Magic items (such as potions) and items in a creature's possession must succeed at a Will save (DC 21) or be ruined.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All blue dragons are also immune to electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sound Imitation
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can mimic any voice or sound it has heard, anytime it likes. Listeners must succeed at a Will save (DC 21) to detect the ruse.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 150 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 500 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Either a line of fire 5 feet high, 5 feet wide, and 5x5x80 feet long or a cone of sleep gas 40x40x40 feet long. It cannot use either breath weapon until 1d4 rounds later. Fire damage 6d6, Reflex half DC 23; cone damage Will save (DC 23) or sleep for 1d6+6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 19 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 180 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 21) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 7, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score. Can also cast cleric spells and those from the Chaos and Knowledge domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-speak with animals; 3/day- endure elements (radius 60 ft.); 1/day-suggestion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 7 level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All brass dragons are also immune to fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 180 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 600 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 16 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 150 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 20) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 21 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 180 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 25) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 7, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score. Can also cast cleric spells and those from the Animal, Law, and Water domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will - speak with animals; 3/day-create food and water, polymorph self, fog cloud. A bronze dragon's polymorph self ability works just like the spell, except that each use allows only one change, which lasts until the dragon assumes another form or reverts to its own (which does not count as a use of this ability). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 7 level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 26 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 240 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 27) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 23 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 180 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 26) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 7, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score. Can also cast cleric spells and those from the Law, Luck, and Good domains domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-polymorph self and bless. A gold dragon's polymorph self works just like the spell, except that each use allows only one change, which lasts until the dragon assumes another form or reverts to its own (which does not count as a use of this ability). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 7 level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Luck Bonus
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day the dragon can touch one gem, usually embedded in the dragon's hide, and enchant it to bring good luck. As long as the dragon carries the gem, it and every good creature in a 60-foot radius dragon receives a +1 luck bonus to all saving throws and similar dice rolls, as for a stone of good luck. If the dragon gives a gem to another creature, only that bearer gets the bonus. The enchantment lasts 1d3+18 hours plus but ends if the gem is destroyed.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All gold dragons are also immune to fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged (the cone of fire becomes a cone of superheated steam underwater).

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 180 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 600 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Gems
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can use this ability three times per day. This is a divination effect similar to a detect magic spell, except that it finds only gems. The dragon can scan a 60-degree arc each round: By concentrating for 1 round it knows if there are any gems within the arc; 2 rounds of concentration reveal the exact number of gems; and 3 rounds reveal their exact location, type, and value.

These abilities are as the spells cast by a 19 level sorcerer (save DC 21 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Luck Bonus
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day the dragon can touch one gem, usually embedded in the dragon's hide, and enchant it to bring good luck. As long as the dragon carries the gem, it and every good creature in a 120-foot radius dragon receives a +1 luck bonus to all saving throws and similar dice rolls, as for a stone of good luck. If the dragon gives a gem to another creature, only that bearer gets the bonus. The enchantment lasts 1d3+36 hours plus but ends if the gem is destroyed.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Gems
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can use this ability three times per day. This is a divination effect similar to a detect magic spell, except that it finds only gems. The dragon can scan a 60-degree arc each round: By concentrating for 1 round it knows if there are any gems within the arc; 2 rounds of concentration reveal the exact number of gems; and 3 rounds reveal their exact location, type, and value.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All gold dragons are also immune to fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged (the cone of fire becomes a cone of superheated steam underwater).

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 360 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 1200 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 26 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 210 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 28) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

A gold dragon's polymorph self works just like the spell, except that each use allows only one change, which lasts until the dragon assumes another form or reverts to its own (which does not count as a use of this ability). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 3 level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All gold dragons are also immune to fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged (the cone of fire becomes a cone of superheated steam underwater).

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 90 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 300 feet.

StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 60 ft., Swim 60 ft., Fly 200 ft. (Poor)

StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +24, Concentration +24, Diplomacy +23, Escape Artist +23, Jump +20, Knowledge +23, Listen +20, Scry +23, Search +20, Spellcraft +20, Spot +20

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Either a cone of fire 50x50x50 feet long or a cone of weakening gas 50x50x50 feet long. It cannot use either breath weapon until 1d4 rounds later. Fire damage 10d10, Reflex half DC 25; gas damage Fortitude save (DC 25) or take 5 points of temporary Strength damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 20 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 150 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 24) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 5, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score. Can also cast cleric spells and those from the Law, Luck, and Good domains domains as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-polymorph self and bless. A gold dragon's polymorph self works just like the spell, except that each use allows only one change, which lasts until the dragon assumes another form or reverts to its own (which does not count as a use of this ability). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 5 level sorcerer (save DC 14 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All gold dragons are also immune to fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use its breath weapon, spells, and other abilities while submerged (the cone of fire becomes a cone of superheated steam underwater).

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 150 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 500 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 37 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 330 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 37) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +16, Concentration +16, Diplomacy +16, Escape Artist +16, Knowledge +16, Listen +24, Scry +16, Search +24, Spellcraft +24, Spot +24

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: A cone of cold 50x50x50 feet long, every 1d4 rounds; damage 8d6, Reflex half DC 27.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can unsettle foes with its mere presence whenever it attacks, charges, or flies overhead. Creatures with fewer than 24 Hit Dice (except for other dragons) within 240 feet of the dragon must succeed at a Will save (DC 23) to avoid this fear effect, and remain immune to that dragon's frightful presence for one day. On a failure, creatures with 4 or fewer HD become panicked for 4d6 rounds and those with 5 or more HD become shaken for 4d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Knows and casts arcane spells as a sorcerer of level 5, gaining bonus spells for a high Charisma score.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-gust of wind and fog cloud. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 8 level sorcerer (save DC 11 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Freezing Fog
SpecialAbility.Text: The dragon can use this ability three times per day. It is similar to a solid fog spell but also causes a rime of slippery ice to form on any surface the fog touches, creating the effect of a grease spell. The dragon is immune to the grease effect because of its icewalking ability.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: All dragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects. All white dragons are also immune to cold.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity, double damage from fire except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Icewalking
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability works like the spider climb spell cast by a 8 level sorcerer, but the surfaces the dragon climbs must be icy. It is always in effect.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Can ascertain creatures by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues) with a range of 240 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Text: Sees four times as well a human in low-light conditions and twice as well in normal light. It also has darkvision with a range of 800 feet.
