StatsBlock.Name: Dragonne
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws x1 +6 melee (2d4+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 12

Description.General: Dragonnes speak Draconic.
Description.Combat: If opponents attempt to charge or encircle it, the dragonne simply takes to the air and finds a more defensible position. Dragonnes prefer not to fight in the air, since they are very slow and maneuver poorly compared to most other flying creatures.
Description.Skills: Dragonnes receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Roar
SpecialAbility.Text: A dragonne can loose a terrifying roar every 1d4 rounds. All creatures (except dragonnes) within 120 feet must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or be weakened with fear, losing half their current Strength scores for 2d6 rounds. Those within 30 feet become deafened for 2d6 rounds: Creatures with 8 or fewer HD get no saving throw, but others can negate the effect with a successful Fortitude save (DC 15). Deafened creatures cannot be affected again by the dragonne's roar.

StatsBlock.Name: Dretch (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d4) or bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 5, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Dretches speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-darkness, scare, and telekinesis; 1/day-stinking cloud. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 2nd-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a dretch can attempt to summon another dretch with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Dretches are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Dretches have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Dretches can communicate telepathically with creatures within 100 feet that speak Abyssal.

StatsBlock.Name: Drider
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 short swords melee (1d6+2) or bite melee (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d4)shortbow melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 short swords x1 +4 melee (1d6+2) or bite x1 melee (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d4)shortbow x1 +4 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 15, Wis 16, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +14, Concentration +10, Hide +8, Listen +9, Spellcraft +10, Spot +9, +7

Description.General: Driders speak Drow, Common, and Undercommon.
Description.Combat: Driders seldom pass up an opportunity to attack other creatures, especially from ambush. They usually begin with a spell assault and often levitate out of the enemy's reach.
Description.Skills: A drider receives a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Driders may be 6th-level clerics, wizards, or sorcerers. Drider clerics can choose from the following domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, and Trickery.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/day-dancing lights, darkness, detect chaos, detect evil, detect good, detect law, detect magic, faerie fire, and levitate. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level). Once per day a drider cleric can additionally use clairaudience/clairvoyance, discern lies, dispel magic, and suggestion as a 6th-level caster.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 16), initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Strength.

StatsBlock.Name: Drow
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Dark Vision, Spell Resistance, Elven Traits, Light Blindness
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 13, Wis 11, Cha 9

Description.General: Drow speak their own language, Drow. Many also speak Undercommon.
Description.Combat:
Drow are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Drow usually coat their arrows with a potent venom: Poisoned Arrows: Fortitude save (DC 17) or fall unconscious. After 1 minute, the subject must succeed at another Fortitude save (DC 17) or remain unconscious for 2d4 hours.
Description.Characters: A male drow's favored class is wizard. Female drow favor the cleric class rather than wizard and have access to two of the following domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, and Trickery.

SpecialAbility.Name: Drow Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Drow benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Spell resistance 11 + class level.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • Spell-Like Abilities: 1/day-dancing lights, darkness, and faerie fire. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer of the drow's character level.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.
  • Darkvision up to 120 feet.
  • Light Blindness (Ex): Abrupt exposure to bright light (such as sunlight or a daylight spell) blinds drow for 1 round. In addition, they suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks while operating in bright light.

StatsBlock.Name: Dryad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 11, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +9, Escape Artist +7, Hide +7, Listen +9, Move Silently +7, Sense Motive +7, Spot +9, Wilderness Lore +7, +0

Description.General: Dryads speak Common, Elven, and Sylvan.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Dryads can communicate with plants at will (as speak with plants). They can also, at will, step inside any tree and use dimension door as cast by a 7th-level sorcerer to reach their own oak tree. A dryad can use charm person three times per day, as cast by a 4th-level sorcerer; targets must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or be charmed for 4 hours.

SpecialAbility.Name: Symbiosis
SpecialAbility.Text: Each dryad is mystically bound to a single, enormous oak tree and must never stray more than 300 yards from it. Any who do become ill and die within 4d6 hours. A dryad's oak does not radiate magic.

StatsBlock.Name: Duergar
StatsBlock.Attacks: Dwarven waraxe melee (1d10) or shortbo melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dwarven waraxe x1 melee (1d10) or shortbo x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Duergar Traits, Light Sensitivity
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +2, Craft +2, Listen +3, Move Silently +4, Spot +3

Description.General: Duergar speak Dwarven and Undercommon.
Description.Skills: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft or Profession checks that are related to stone or metal.
Description.Characters: A duergar's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/day-enlarge and invisibility as a wizard twice the duergar's level (minimum 3rd level); these affect only the duergar and whatever it carries.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to paralysis, phantasms, and magical or alchemical poisons (but not normal poisons).

SpecialAbility.Name: Duergar Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Duergar benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • +4 racial bonus to Move Silently checks.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against orcs and goblinoids, through special combat training.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +2 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against all poisons.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants, through special defensive training.
  • Darkvision up to 120 feet.
  • Light Sensitivity (Ex): Duergar suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, saves, and checks in bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.
  • Listen +1, Spot +1.
  • Alertness feat.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A dwarf who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A dwarf can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Dust Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +12, Listen +6, Move Silently +9, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of irritating particles, 10 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by itching skin and burning eyes. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour a dust mephit can surround itself with a plume of dust, duplicating the effects of a blur spell cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer. Once per day it can create a mass of roiling dust that duplicates the effect of wind wall as cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A dust mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and in an arid, dusty environment.

StatsBlock.Name: Eagle
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3) or bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

Description.Skills: *Eagles receive a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks during daylight.

StatsBlock.Name: Earth Elemental, Elder
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 33, Dex 8, Con 21, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical, Power Attack, Sunder

Description.General:
Elder earth elementals are 40 feet high and weigh 60,000 lbs.
Earth elementals speak Terran but rarely choose to do so.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Earth Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: An earth elemental gains a +1 attack and damage bonus if both it and its foe touch the ground. If an opponent is airborne or waterborne, the elemental suffers a -4 penalty to attack and damage. (These modifiers are not included in the statistics block.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Push
SpecialAbility.Text: An earth elemental can start a bull rush maneuver without provoking an attack of opportunity. The combat modifiers given in Earth Mastery, above, also apply to the elemental's opposed Strength checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Earth Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d3+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 8, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +5, Hide +9, Listen +6, Move Silently +5, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of rock shards and pebbles, 15 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d8, Reflex half DC 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/hour-enlarge; 1/day-soften earth and stone. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: An earth mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is underground or buried up to its waist in earth.

StatsBlock.Name: Efreeti
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x2 +13/+8 melee (1d8+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 15, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +12, Concentration +16, Escape Artist +13, Intimidate +11, Listen +12, Move Silently +13, Sense Motive +11, Spellcraft +11, Spot +12
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Efreet speak Ignan, Common, Auran, and Infernal.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: produce flame and pyrotechnics; 1/day-grant up to three wishes (to nongenies only), detect magic, enlarge, gaseous form, invisibility, permanent image, polymorph self, and wall of fire. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: An efreeti's red-hot body deals 1d6 points of additional fire damage whenever it hits in melee, or when grappling, each round it maintains a hold.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plane Shift
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can enter any of the elemental planes, the Astral Plane, or the Material Plane. This ability transports the genie and up to six other creatures, provided they all link hands with the genie. It is otherwise similar to the spell of the same name.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Eight-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 bites x1 +10 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Eight-Headed Hydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 bites x1 +8 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

StatsBlock.Name: Eight-Headed Lernaean Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 bites x1 +10 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +9 melee (2d8+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 14, Con 20, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 9

StatsBlock.Name: Arrowhawk - Elder
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Electricity ray x1 +17 melee (2d8+6)bite x1 +17 melee (2d6+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 21, Con 16, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Escape Artist +23, Intuit Direction +16, Knowledge +15, Listen +19, Search +18, Sense Motive +19, Spot +19
StatsBlock.Feats: Blind-Fight, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Weapon Finesse

Description.General: Arrowhawks speak Auran, but they are not talkative creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Electricity Ray
SpecialAbility.Text: An arrowhawk can fire this ray once a round, with a range of 45 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Arrowhawks have acid, electricity, and poison immunity.

StatsBlock.Name: Elder Xorn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +18 melee (4d8+7) or 3 claws x1 +16 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Cold), Resistance (), 360 Vision, Half Damage From Slashing, Tremorsense
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 10, Con 19, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +14, Intuit Direction +18, Knowledge +12, Listen +18, Move Silently +18, Search +22, Spot +22
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Multiattack, Power Attack

Description.General: Xorns speak Terran and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burrow
SpecialAbility.Text: A xorn can glide through stone, dirt, or almost any other sort of earth except metal as easily as a fish swims through water. Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other signs of its presence. A move earth spell cast on an area containing a burrowing xorn flings the xorn back 30 feet, stunning the creature for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half Damage from Slashing
SpecialAbility.Text: Slashing weapons deal only half damage to xorns, with a minimum of 1 point of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: All-Around Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns' symmetrically placed eyes allow them to look in any direction, bestowing a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Search checks. Xorns can't be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Elephant
StatsBlock.Attacks: Slam melee (2d6+10) or 2 stamps melee (2d6+5)gore melee (2d8+15)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +14 melee (2d6+10) or 2 stamps x1 +9 melee (2d6+5)gore x1 +14 melee (2d8+15)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 30, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 7

Description.General: This entry describes an African elephant. Indian elephants are slightly smaller and weaker (Strength 28), but more readily trained (Wisdom 15). These statistics can also represent prehistoric creatures such as mammoths and mastodons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An elephant can trample Medium-size or smaller creatures for automatic gore damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the elephant can attempt a Reflex save (DC 20) to halve the damage.

A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Erinyes (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x2 +6/+1 melee (1d8+3)longbow x2 +6/+1 melee (1d8+2)rope x1 +6 melee (+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Rope Entangle, Charm Person, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Baatezu Qualities, Tongues
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 20
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +9, Disguise +11, Escape Artist +8, Hide +9, Listen +10, Move Silently +9, Search +9, Spot +10

Description.General: Erinyes speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: animate dead, charm monster, desecrate, invisibility (self only), magic circle against good (self only), major image, polymorph self, produce flame, see invisibility, suggestion, and unholy blight. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).
An erinyes also can teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only) at will as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charm Person
SpecialAbility.Text: An erinyes can charm a humanoid creature with a look. This is not a gaze attack, and the target need not meet the erinyes's eye. The ability has a range of 60 feet; an affected opponent must succeed at a Will save (DC 18) or become utterly loyal to the erinyes. The victim will do anything to protect the erinyes, even if that means slaying his or her companions or facing certain death. The ability is otherwise similar to charm person cast by an 8th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Entangle
SpecialAbility.Text: Each erinyes carries a stout rope some 50 feet long that entangles opponents of any size as an animate rope spell cast by a 16th-level sorcerer. The erinyes can hurl the rope 30 feet with no range penalty.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day an erinyes can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures with a 50% chance of success, or 1d4 barbazu with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: An erinyes has a permanent tongues ability as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer. Erinyes usually use verbal communication when dealing with mortals and save telepathic communication for conversing with other fiends.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Erinyes can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Ethereal Filcher
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 18, Con 11, Int 7, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.General: Ethereal filchers do not speak.
Description.Combat: An ethereal filcher lurks on the Ethereal Plane waiting for a likely mark. Upon locating one, it shifts to the Material Plane, attempting to catch its victim unawares. The creature attempts to snatch an item, then retreats quickly back to the Ethereal. It is not above delivering a bite to distract its target.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ethereal Jaunt
SpecialAbility.Text: An ethereal filcher can shift from the Ethereal to the Material Plane as part of any move action, and shift back again as a free action. It can remain on the Ethereal Plane for 1 round before returning to the Material. The ability is otherwise identical with ethereal jaunt cast by a 15th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Magic
SpecialAbility.Text: Ethereal filchers continuously detect magic as the spell cast by a 5th-level sorcerer. A filcher can suppress or restart the ability once per round as a free action.

StatsBlock.Name: Ethereal Marauder
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Unknown (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 12, Con 11, Int 7, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.Combat: Once a marauder locates prey, it shifts to the Material Plane to attack, attempting to catch its victim flat-footed. The creature bites its victim, then retreats quickly back to the Ethereal Plane. When badly hurt or wounded, the marauder escapes to its home plane rather than continue the fight.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ethereal Jaunt
SpecialAbility.Text: An ethereal marauder can shift from the Ethereal to the Material Plane as a free action, and shift back again as a move-equivalent action (or as part of a move-equivalent action). The ability is otherwise identical with ethereal jaunt cast by a 15th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Ettercap
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d8) or 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 15, Cha 8

Description.General: Ettercaps speak Common.
Description.Combat: Ettercaps are not brave creatures, but their cunning traps often ensure that the enemy never draws a weapon. When an ettercap does engage its enemies, it attacks with its keen-edged claws and venomous bite.
Description.Skills: *Ettercaps in shadow receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Web
SpecialAbility.Text: An ettercap can cast a web eight times per day. This is similar to an attack with a net but has a maximum range of 50 feet, with a range increment of 10 feet, and is effective against targets of up to Medium-size (see page 102 in the Player's Handbook for details on net attacks). The web anchors the target in place, allowing no movement. An entangled creature can escape with a successful Escape Artist check (DC 20) or burst the web with a successful Strength check (DC 26). The web has 6 hit points and takes double damage from fire. Ettercaps can also create sheets of sticky webbing from 5 to 60 feet square. They usually position these to snare flying creatures but can also try to trap prey on the ground. Approaching creatures must succeed at a Spot check (DC 20) to notice a web or stumble into it and become trapped as though by a successful web attack. Attempts to escape or burst the webbing receive a +5 bonus if the trapped creature has something to walk on or grab while pulling free. Each 5-foot-square section has 6 hit points and takes double damage from fire. An ettercap can move across its own sheet web at its climb speed and can determine the exact location of any creature touching the web.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 13); initial damage 1d6 temporary Dexterity, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Dexterity.

StatsBlock.Name: Ettin
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 greatclubs x2 +11/+6 melee (1d10+6)2 longspears x2 +11/+6 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 8, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 11

Description.General: Ettins have no language of their own but speak a pidgin of Orc, Goblin, and Giant. Creatures that can speak any of these languages must succeed at an Intelligence check (DC 15) to communicate with an ettin. Check once for each bit of information: If the other creature speaks two of these languages, the DC is 10, and for someone who speaks all three, the DC is 5.
Description.Skills: An ettin's two heads give it a +2 racial bonus to Listen, Spot, and Search checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Superior Two-Weapon Fighting
SpecialAbility.Text: An ettin fights with a club or spear in each hand. Because each of its two heads controls an arm, the ettin does not suffer an attack or damage penalty for attacking with two weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Fire Elemental, Elder
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 29, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Spring Attack, Weapon Finesse

Description.General:
An elder fire elemental is 40 feet high and weighs 12 lbs.
Fire elementals speak Ignan, though they rarely choose to do so. When one does, its voice sounds like the crackle and hiss of a great fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burn
SpecialAbility.Text:
Those hit by a fire elemental's slam attack must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 26) or catch fire. The flame burns for 1d4 rounds. A burning creature can take a move-equivalent action to put out the flame.
Creatures hitting a fire elemental with natural weapons or unarmed attacks take fire damage as though hit by the elemental's attack, and also catch fire unless they succeed at a Reflex save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 27, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Spring Attack, Weapon Finesse

StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 25, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Weapon Finesse

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x2 +7/+2 melee (2d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 21, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General:
A large fire elemental is 16 feet high and weighs 4 lbs.
Fire elementals speak Ignan, though they rarely choose to do so. When one does, its voice sounds like the crackle and hiss of a great fire.

SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Fire Elemental, Medium
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +4 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 4, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General:
A medium-size fire elemental is 8 feet high and weights 2 lbs.
Fire elementals speak Ignan, though they rarely choose to do so. When one does, its voice sounds like the crackle and hiss of a great fire.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Fire Elemental, Small
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 4, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: A small fire elemental is 4 feet high and weighs 1 lb.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burn
SpecialAbility.Text:
Those hit by a fire elemental's slam attack must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 11) or catch fire. The flame burns for 1d4 rounds. A burning creature can take a move-equivalent action to put out the flame.
Creatures hitting a fire elemental with natural weapons or unarmed attacks take fire damage as though hit by the elemental's attack, and also catch fire unless they succeed at a Reflex save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Fire Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatsword x3 +18/+13/+8 melee (2d8+15)rock x3 +18/+13/+8 melee (2d6+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 31, Dex 9, Con 21, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Sunder

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Description.Characters: Clerics have access to any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Trickery, and War (most choose Trickery or War).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Fire Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +5, Hide +11, Listen +6, Move Silently +7, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of fire, 15 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d8, Reflex half DC 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/hour-magic missile as the spell cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer; 1/day-heat metal as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A fire mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is touching a flame at least as large as a torch.

StatsBlock.Name: Five-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 5 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 5 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These reddish hydras can breathe jets of fire 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Five-Headed Pyrohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 5 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These reddish hydras can breathe jets of fire 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Flamebrother
StatsBlock.Attacks: Halfspear melee (1d6+1) or tail slap melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Halfspear x1 +2 melee (1d6+1) or tail slap x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Craft +11, Escape Artist +7, Hide +9, Listen +7, Search +7, Spot +7

Description.General: Flamebrothers speak only Ignan.
Description.Skills: Salamanders receive a +4 racial bonus to Craft (metalworking) skill checks.
Description.Feats: Salamanders have the Multiattack feat even without the requisite three natural weapons.
Description.Characters: Flamebrothers have no favored class. They sometimes become adepts or warriors.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander generates so much heat that its mere touch deals additional fire damage. Salamanders' metallic weapons also conduct this heat.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander deals automatic tail slap damage (including fire damage) with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Flesh
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +10 melee (2d8+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 1

Description.General:
A golem's creator can command it if the golem is within 60 feet and can see and hear its creator. If uncommanded, the golem usually follows its last instruction to the best of its ability, though if attacked it returns the attack. The creator can give the golem a simple program to govern its actions in his or her absence.
Golems do not need to breathe and are immune to most forms of energy.
Description.Construction:
The cost listed for each golem includes that of the physical body and all the materials and spell components that are consumed or become a permanent part of it.
Understanding the rituals requires a character of the required level with the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats. The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom. The chamber is similar to an alchemist's laboratory and costs 500 gp to establish.
When not working on the rituals, the creator must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If personally constructing the golem's body, the creator can perform the building and rituals together. If the creator misses a day of rituals, the process fails and must be started again. Money spent is lost, but XP spent are not. The golem's body can be reused, as can the laboratory.
Completing the ritual drains the appropriate XP from the creator and requires casting any spells on the final day. The creator must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls.
The flesh golem costs 50,000 gp to create, which includes 500 gp for the construction of the body. Assembling the body requires a successful Craft (leatherworking) or Heal check (DC 13). The creator must be 14th level and able to cast arcane spells. Completing the ritual drains 1,000 XP from the creator and requires bull's strength, geas/quest, limited wish, polymorph any object, and protection from arrows.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Berserk
SpecialAbility.Text: When a flesh golem enters combat, there is a cumulative 1% chance each round that its elemental spirit breaks free and goes berserk. The uncontrolled golem goes on a rampage, attacking the nearest living creature or smashing some object smaller than itself if no creature is within reach, then moving on to spread more destruction. The golem's creator, if within 60 feet, can try to regain control by speaking firmly and persuasively to the golem, which requires a successful Charisma check (DC 19). It takes 1 minute of rest by the golem to reset the golem's berserk chance to 0%.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Flesh golems are immune to all spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural effects, except as follows. Fire- and cold-based effects slow them (as the spell) for 2d6 rounds, with no saving throw. An electricity effect breaks any slow effect on the golem and cures 1 point of damage for each 3 points of damage it would otherwise deal. For example, a flesh golem hit by a lightning bolt cast by a 5th-level wizard gains back 6 hit points if the damage total is 18. The golem rolls no saving throw against electricity effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Forest Gnome
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Short sword x1 melee (1d6)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Gnome Traits, Speak With Animals, Pass Without Trace
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Forest Gnomes speak Gnome as well as Elf, Sylvan, and a simple language that enables them to communicate on a very basic level with forest animals.
Description.Combat: Gnomes make heavy use of illusion magic and carefully prepared ambushes and traps whenever they can.
Description.Skills: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks, for their keen hearing, and to Alchemy checks, because their sensitive noses allow them to monitor alchemical processes by smell. Forest gnomes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks, which improves to +8 in a wooded area.
Description.Characters: A forest gnome's favored class is illusionist.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Gnomes with Intelligence scores of 10 or higher may cast dancing lights, ghost sound, and prestidigitation, each once per day as a 1st-level wizard (spell failure penalties for armor apply).

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Animals
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a gnome can use speak with animals as a 1st-level druid to communicate with a burrowing mammal (badger, fox, rabbit, etc.).

SpecialAbility.Name: Gnome Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Gnomes benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Gnomes gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • Forest gnomes have the innate ability to pass without trace (as the spell).
  • Low-light Vision. Gnomes can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, and similar conditions of poor illumination.
  • +2 racial bonus to saving throws against illusions.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against kobolds, goblinoids, orcs, and reptilian humanoids.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants.

StatsBlock.Name: Frost Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greataxe x2 +17/+12 melee (2d8+13)rock x2 +17/+12 melee (2d6+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 9, Con 21, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Sunder

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Description.Characters: Clerics have access to any two of the following domains: Chaos, Destruction, Evil, and War (most choose Destruction or War).

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Frost Worm
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +18 melee (2d6+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 10, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 11, Cha 5

Description.Combat: Frost worms lurk under the snow, waiting for prey to come near. They begin their attack with trilling and then attack helpless prey with their bite.
Description.Skills: *A frost worm, due to its coloration and its affinity for burying itself in the snow, receives a +10 racial bonus to Hide checks in its native environment.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trill
SpecialAbility.Text: The frost worm can emit a noise that forces its prey to stand motionless. This sonic, mind affecting compulsion affects all creatures other than frost worms within a 100-foot spread. Creatures must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or be stunned for as long as the worm trills, even if they are attacked. However, if attacked or violently shaken (a full-round action), a victim is allowed another saving throw. Once a creature has resisted or broken the effect, it cannot be affected again by that frost worm for one day. The effect's caster level is 14.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold
SpecialAbility.Text: Frost worms' bodies generate intense cold, dealing 1d8 points of damage with their touch. Creatures attacking a frost worm unarmed or with natural weapons take cold damage each time their attacks hit.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Death Throes
SpecialAbility.Text: When killed, a frost worm turns to ice and shatters in an explosion that deals 12d6 points of cold damage and 8d6 points of piercing damage to everything within 100 feet (Reflex half DC 22).

StatsBlock.Name: Gargantuan Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +15 melee (2d8+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 24, Dex 6, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Gargantuan Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (2d6+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Gargantuan Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +15 melee (2d8+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Gargantuan Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +15 melee (2d8+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Gargoyle
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 claws melee (1d4) or bite melee (1d6) or gore melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d6) or gore x1 +2 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 14, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 7

Description.General: Gargoyles speak Common and Terran.
Description.Combat: Gargoyles either remain still, then suddenly attack, or dive onto their prey.
Description.Skills: *Gargoyles receive a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks when concealed against a background of worked stone.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freeze
SpecialAbility.Text: A gargoyle can hold itself so still it appears to be a statue. An observer must succeed at a Spot check (DC 20) to notice the gargoyle is really alive.

StatsBlock.Name: Gelatinous Cube
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 1, Con 19, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Ooze
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: An ooze's entire body is a primitive sensory organ that can ascertain prey by scent and vibration within 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Engulf
SpecialAbility.Text: Although it moves slowly, a gelatinous cube can simply mow down Large or smaller creatures as a standard action. It cannot make a slam attack during a round in which it engulfs. The gelatinous cube merely has to move over the opponents, affecting as many as it can cover. Opponents can make opportunity attacks against the cube, but if they do so they are not entitled to a saving throw. Those who do not attempt opportunity attacks must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 13) or be engulfed; on a success, they are pushed back or aside (opponent's choice) as the cube moves forward. Engulfed creatures are subject to the cube's paralysis and acid, and are considered to be grappled and trapped within its body.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Gelatinous cubes secrete an anesthetizing slime. A target hit by a cube's melee or engulf attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 16) or be paralyzed for 3d6 rounds. The cube can automatically engulf a paralyzed opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: A gelatinous cube's acid does not harm metal or stone.

SpecialAbility.Name: Transparent
SpecialAbility.Text: Gelatinous cubes are hard to see, even under ideal conditions, and it takes a successful Spot check (DC 15) to notice one. Creatures who fail to notice a cube and walk into it are automatically engulfed.

StatsBlock.Name: Gelugon (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Longspear melee (1d8+9) or tail melee (1d8+6) or Unknown (2d4+1) or Unknown (3d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longspear x3 +17/+12/+7 melee (1d8+9) or tail x1 +12 melee (1d8+6) or Unknown (2d4+1) or Unknown (3d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Spell-Like Abilities, Fear Aura, Cold, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Baatezu Qualities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 22, Wis 22, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +16, Climb +20, Concentration +20, Disguise +17, Jump +19, Knowledge +20, Listen +22, Move Silently +16, Search +20, Sense Motive +20, Spellcraft +20, Spot +22

Description.General: Gelugons speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-animate dead, charm monster, cone of cold, desecrate, detect good, detect magic, fly, magic circle against good, major image, polymorph self, suggestion, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), unholy aura, and wall of ice. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 13th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, a gelugon can create an aura of fear in a 10-foot radius. It is otherwise identical with fear cast by a 13th-level sorcerer (save DC 19). If the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that gelugon's fear aura for one day. Other baatezu are immune to the aura.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold
SpecialAbility.Text: A hit from a gelugon's tail or spear attack induces numbing cold. The opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 21) or be affected as though by a slow spell for 1d6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a gelugon can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures or 1d6 barbazu with a 50% chance of success, 2d4 osyluths or 1d6 hamatulas with a 35% chance of success, or another gelugon with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Gelugons take normal damage from holy and blessed weapons of at least +2 enchantment.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Ghaele (Eladrin)
StatsBlock.Attacks: +4 greatsword +21/+16 mele melee (2d6+14)2 light rays melee (2d12+7)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +4 greatsword +21/+16 mele x1 +15 melee (2d6+14)2 light rays x1 +15 melee (2d12+7)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Spells, Gaze, Spell-Like Abilities, Positive Energy
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Electricity), Alternate Form, Protective Aura, Resistances, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 12, Con 15, Int 17, Wis 16, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +13, Concentration +12, Escape Artist +11, Hide +11, Listen +15, Move Silently +11, Sense Motive +13, Spot +15, +13

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: aid, alter self, charm monster, color spray, comprehend languages, continual flame, cure light wounds, dancing lights, detect evil, detect thoughts, dispel magic, hold monster, improved invisibility (self only), major image, see invisibility, and teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only); 1/day-chain lightning, prismatic spray, and wall of force. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Ghaeles in humanoid form can cast divine spells from the cleric list and the Air, Animal, Chaos, Good, and Plant domains as 14th-level clerics (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: In humanoid form-slay evil creatures of 5 or fewer HD, range 60 feet, Will negates DC 18. Even if the save succeeds, the creature is affected as though by a fear spell for 2d10 rounds. Nonevil creatures, and evil creatures with more than 5 HD, must succeed at a Will save (DC 18) or suffer the fear effect.

SpecialAbility.Name: Positive Energy
SpecialAbility.Text: The ghaele's incandescent sword deals an additional 2d6 points of positive energy damage to evil creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Ray
SpecialAbility.Text: A ghaele in globe form can project light rays with a range of 300 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text:
A ghaele can shift between its humanoid and globe forms as a standard action. In humanoid form, it cannot fly or use its light rays, but it can use its gaze attack and spell-like abilities, make physical attacks, and cast spells. In globe form, it can fly, use its light rays, and use spell-like abilities, but it cannot cast spells or use its gaze attack.
A ghaele remains in one form until it chooses to assume a new one. A change in form cannot be dispelled, nor does the ghaele revert to any particular form when killed. A true seeing spell, however, reveals both forms simultaneously.

SpecialAbility.Name: Protective Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, ghaeles can surround themselves with a nimbus of light having a radius of 20 feet. This acts as a double-strength magic circle against evil and as a minor globe of invulnerability, both as cast by a sorcerer whose level equal to the celestial's Hit Dice. The aura can be dispelled, but the celestial can create it again as a free action on its next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Eladrins have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Ghast
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d8+1)2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +6, Escape Artist +8, Hide +8, Intuit Direction +3, Jump +6, Listen +8, Move Silently +7, Search +6, Spot +8

Description.General: Ghasts speak the languages they spoke in life (usually Common).

SpecialAbility.Name: Stench
SpecialAbility.Text: The stink of death and corruption surrounding these creatures is sickening. Those within 10 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be wracked with nausea, suffering a -2 circumstance penalty to all attacks, saves, and skill checks for 1d6+4 minutes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Those hit by a ghast's bite or claw attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be paralyzed for 1d6+4 minutes. Even elves are vulnerable to this paralysis.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: In most cases, ghouls devour those they kill. From time to time, however, the bodies of their humanoid victims lie where they fell, to rise as ghouls themselves in 1d4 days. Casting protection from evil on a body before the end of that time averts the transformation. (The statistics above are for human ghouls and ghasts. Ghouls and ghasts may vary depending on their original race or kind.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Ghoul
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +6, Escape Artist +7, Hide +7, Intuit Direction +3, Jump +6, Listen +7, Move Silently +7, Search +6, Spot +7

Description.General: Ghouls speak the languages they spoke in life (usually Common).

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Those hit by a ghoul's bite or claw attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be paralyzed for 1d6+2 minutes. Elves are immune to this paralysis.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: In most cases, ghouls devour those they kill. From time to time, however, the bodies of their humanoid victims lie where they fell, to rise as ghouls themselves in 1d4 days. Casting protection from evil on a body before the end of that time averts the transformation. (The statistics above are for human ghouls and ghasts. Ghouls and ghasts may vary depending on their original race or kind.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Ant, Queen
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +5 melee (2d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 9, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant ant must hit with its bite attack. A giant ant soldier that gets a hold can sting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid Sting
SpecialAbility.Text: The giant ant soldier has a stinger and an acid-producing gland and in its abdomen. If it successfully grabs an opponent, it can attempt to sting each round using its full attack bonus. A hit with the sting attack deals 1d4+1 points of piercing damage and 1d4 points of acid damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Ant, Soldier
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (2d4+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant ant must hit with its bite attack. A giant ant soldier that gets a hold can sting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid Sting
SpecialAbility.Text: The giant ant soldier has a stinger and an acid-producing gland and in its abdomen. If it successfully grabs an opponent, it can attempt to sting each round using its full attack bonus. A hit with the sting attack deals 1d4+1 points of piercing damage and 1d4 points of acid damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Ant, Worker
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant ant must hit with its bite attack. A giant ant soldier that gets a hold can sting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid Sting
SpecialAbility.Text: The giant ant soldier has a stinger and an acid-producing gland and in its abdomen. If it successfully grabs an opponent, it can attempt to sting each round using its full attack bonus. A hit with the sting attack deals 1d4+1 points of piercing damage and 1d4 points of acid damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Bee
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 13); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution. A bee that successfully stings another creature pulls away, leaving its stinger in the creature. The bee then dies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Beetle, Bombardier
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 10, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid Spray
SpecialAbility.Text: When attacked or disturbed, a giant bombardier beetle can release a 10-foot cone of acidic vapor once per round. Those within the cone must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 13) or take 1d4+2 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Beetle, Fire
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (2d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 11, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 7

Description.General: They have two glands, one above each eye, that produce a red glow. The glands' luminosity persists for 1d6 days after removal from the beetle, illuminating a roughly circular area with a 10-foot radius

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Beetle, Stag
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +8 melee (4d6+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant stag beetle can trample Medium-size or smaller creatures for 2d8+3 points of damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the giant stag beetle can attempt a Reflex save (DC 19) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Eagle
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Knowledge +2, Listen +5, Sense Motive +8, Spot +11, Wilderness Lore +8

Description.General: Giant eagles speak Common and Auran.
Description.Combat: A giant eagle typically attacks from a great height, diving earthward at tremendous speed. When it cannot dive, it uses its powerful talons and slashing beak to strike at its target's head and eyes.
Description.Skills: *Giant eagles receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks during daylight hours.
Description.Training:
Training a giant eagle as an aerial mount requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 24 for a young creature, or DC 29 for an adult) and that the creature be willing.
Giant eagle eggs are worth 2,500 gp apiece on the open market, while chicks are worth 4,000 gp each. Professional trainers charge 1,000 gp to rear or train a giant eagle, and riding one requires an exotic saddle. A giant eagle can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a giant eagle is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Owl
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 10

Description.General: Giant owls speak Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: A giant owl attacks by gliding silently just a few feet above its prey and plunging to strike when directly overhead.
Description.Skills: Giant owls receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen checks. *They also receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks in dusk and darkness; when in flight, they gain a +8 bonus to Move Silently checks.
Description.Training:
Training a giant owl as an aerial mount requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 24 for a young creature, or DC 29 for an adult) and that the creature be willing.
Giant owl eggs are worth 2,500 gp apiece on the open market, while chicks are worth 4,000 gp each. Professional trainers charge 1,000 gp to rear or train a giant owl, and riding one requires an exotic saddle. A giant owl can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a giant owl is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Superior Low-Light Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant owl can see five times as far as a human can in dim light.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Praying Mantis
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Claws x1 +6 melee (1d8+4) or bite x1 +1 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 8, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 11

Description.Skills: *Because of its camouflage, a mantis surrounded by foliage receives an additional +8 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant praying mantis must hit an opponent of Medium-size or smaller with its claws attack. If it gets a hold, it squeezes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Squeeze
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant praying mantis that gets a hold on a Medium-size or smaller opponent automatically deals 1d8+4 points of claw damage and bites at its full attack value of +6 each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Giant Wasp
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +6 melee (1d3+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 12, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 18); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Dexterity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Gibbering Mouther
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 6 bites x1 +3 melee ()
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Gibbering, Spittle, Blood Drain, Engulf, Ground Manipulation
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 4, Wis 13, Cha 13

Description.General: Gibbering mouthers can speak Common, but seldom say anything other than gibbering.
Description.Combat: Gibbering mouthers attack by shooting out strings of protoplasmic flesh, each ending in one or more eyes and a mouth that bites at the enemy. A mouther can send out a total of six such members in any round.
Description.Skills: Thanks to their multiple eyes, gibbering mouthers receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Gibbering
SpecialAbility.Text: As soon as a mouther spots something edible, it begins a constant gibbering as a free action. All creatures (other than mouthers) within a 60-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 13) or be affected as though by a confusion spell for 1d2 rounds. This is a sonic, mind-affecting compulsion effect. Opponents who successfully save cannot be affected by the same gibbering mouther's gibbering for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spittle
SpecialAbility.Text: At the start of every combat, and every 2 rounds thereafter, a gibbering mouther looses a stream of spittle. This ignites on contact with the air, creating a blinding flash of light. All sighted creatures within 60 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 13) or be blinded for 1d3 rounds.
