SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the gibbering mouther must hit with a bite attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blood Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: On a second successful grapple check after grabbing, that mouth attaches to the opponent. It automatically deals bite damage and drains blood, dealing 1 point of temporary Constitution damage each round. A mouth can be ripped off (dealing 1 point of damage) with a successful Strength check (DC 12) or severed by a normal attack that deals at least 2 points of damage (AC 18). A severed mouth continues to bite and drain blood for 1d4 rounds after such an attack. A creature whose Constitution is reduced to 0 is killed and absorbed by the mouther, which gains 1 hit point and adds another mouth and pair of eyes to its body.

SpecialAbility.Name: Engulf
SpecialAbility.Text: A gibbering mouther can try to engulf a Medium-size or smaller opponent grabbed by three or more mouths. The opponent must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 14) or fall and be engulfed. On the next round, the mouther makes twelve bite attacks instead of six (each with a +4 attack bonus). An engulfed creature cannot attack the mouther from within. The previously attached mouths are now free to attack others.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ground Manipulation
SpecialAbility.Text: At will, as a standard action, a gibbering mouther can cause stone and earth within 5 feet of it to become a morass akin to quicksand. Softening earth, sand, or the like takes 1 round, while stone takes 2 rounds. Anyone other than the mouther in that area must take a move equivalent action to avoid becoming mired (treat as being pinned).

SpecialAbility.Name: Amorphous
SpecialAbility.Text: A gibbering mouther is not subject to critical hits. It has no clear front or back, so it cannot be flanked.

StatsBlock.Name: Girallon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 claws x1 +10 melee (1d4+8) or bite x1 +5 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 3, Wis 12, Cha 7

Description.Combat: A solitary girallon usually conceals itself in the branches of a tree or under a pile of leaves and brush, with only its nose showing. When it spots or scents prey, it charges to the attack. The girallon picks up prey that is small enough to carry and withdraws, often vanishing into the trees before the victim's companions can do anything to retaliate. Against larger foes, the girallon seeks to tear a single opponent to bits as quickly as it can.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: A girallon that hits with both claw attacks latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This attack automatically deals an additional 2d4+12 points of damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Glabrezu (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 pincers melee (2d6+7) or 2 claws melee (1d3+3) or bite melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 pincers x1 +13 melee (2d6+7) or 2 claws x1 +11 melee (1d3+3) or bite x1 +11 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Detect Magic, True Seeing
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 10, Con 19, Int 16, Wis 16, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +13, Concentration +14, Hide +2, Knowledge +13, Listen +21, Move Silently +10, Scry +13, Search +13, Sense Motive +13, Spellcraft +13, Spot +21

Description.General: Glabrezu speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Glabrezu receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will-burning hands, chaos hammer, charm person, confusion, death knell, deeper darkness, desecrate, detect good, dispel magic, enlarge, mirror image, reverse gravity, shatter, and unholy blight. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 10th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).
A glabrezu also can teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only) at will as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer. Seven times per day it can cast power word, stun as a 15th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the glabrezu must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with a pincer attack. If it gets a hold, it deals automatic pincer damage each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a glabrezu can attempt to summon 4d10 dretches or 1d2 vrocks with a 50% chance of success, or another glabrezu with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Magic
SpecialAbility.Text: Glabrezu continuously detect magic as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: True Seeing
SpecialAbility.Text: Glabrezu continuously use true seeing as the spell cast by a 12th-level cleric.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Glabrezu are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Glabrezu have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Glabrezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Gnoll
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Battleaxe x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)shortbow x1 +2 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 8, Wis 11, Cha 8

Description.General: Gnolls speak Gnoll and sometimes Goblin or Orc.
Description.Combat: Because of its armor and shield, a gnoll's Hide score is -6, which means gnolls always take special care to seek favorable conditions when laying ambushes (such as darkness, heavy cover, or some other form of concealment).
Description.Characters: A gnoll's favored class is ranger.

StatsBlock.Name: Goblin
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Morningstar x1 melee (1d8)javelin x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 8

Description.General: Goblins speak Goblin; those with Intelligence scores of 12 or above also speak Common.
Description.Combat: They favor ambushes, overwhelming odds, dirty tricks, and any other edge they can devise.
Description.Skills: Goblins gain a +4 racial bonus to Move Silently checks. Goblin cavalry (mounted on worgs) gain a +6 bonus to Ride checks and the Mounted Combat feat (neither of these benefits is included in the statistics block).
Description.Characters: A goblin's favored class is rogue. Goblin clerics can choose two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, and Trickery. Most goblin spellcasters are adepts. Goblin adepts favor spells that fool or confuse enemies.

StatsBlock.Name: Gorgon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +12 melee (1d8+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Turn to stone permanently, cone, 60 feet, every 1d4 rounds (but no more than five times per day); Fortitude save (DC 17).

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: A gorgon can trample Small or smaller creatures for 1d8+7 points of damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the gorgon can attempt a Reflex save (DC 23) to halve the damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Gray Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8)longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 11

Description.General: Gray elves speak Elven. Being reclusive, few learn Common or Sylvan, although there are exceptions.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: A gray elf's favored class is wizard.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Elves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Elves can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, etc.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Gray Ooze
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Acid, Corrosion, Constrict 1d6+1 And 1d6 Acid
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 1, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Ooze
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: An ooze's entire body is a primitive sensory organ that can ascertain prey by scent and vibration within 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the gray ooze must hit with its slam attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: A gray ooze secretes a digestive acid that quickly dissolves organic material and metal. Any melee hit deals acid damage. The ooze's acidic touch deals 40 points of damage per round to wood or metal objects. Armor or clothing dissolves and becomes useless immediately unless it succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 19). The acid cannot harm stone. A metal or wooden weapon that strikes a gray ooze also dissolves immediately unless it succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 19).

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A gray ooze deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check. The opponent's clothing and armor suffer a -4 penalty to Reflex saves against the acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Camouflage
SpecialAbility.Text: It takes a successful Spot check (DC 15) to recognize a motionless gray ooze for what it really is.

StatsBlock.Name: Gray Render
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (2d6+6) or 2 claws x1 +6 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 24, Int 3, Wis 12, Cha 8

Description.Combat: A gray render attacks to kill, whether to bring down prey or to protect itself or those it has adopted. When hunting, it sometimes attempts to hide and wait for prey to wander close.
Description.Skills: Gray renders receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks due to their six keen eyes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the gray render must hit with its bite attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: A gray render that gets a hold latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This attack automatically deals 3d6+9 points of damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Gray Slaad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +12 melee (2d4+4) or bite x1 +10 melee (2d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Damage Reduction 10/+1, Resistances, Alternate Form
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +15, Hide +14, Jump +17, Knowledge +13, Listen +15, Move Silently +14, Search +15, Spot +15

Description.Characters: Slaadi rarely have the focus to devote themselves to a character class. Grays sometimes become sorcerers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: animate objects, chaos hammer, deeper darkness, detect magic, dispel law, fly, identify, invisibility, lightning bolt, magic circle against law, see invisibility, shatter, and power word blind. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 15th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A gray slaad can shift between its natural and any humanoid form at will as a standard action. A gray slaad whose personal treasure includes useful equipment or magic items will use these when in humanoid form. A gray slaad remains in humanoid form indefinitely. The ability is otherwise similar to polymorph self cast by a 10th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Slaad
SpecialAbility.Text: Twice per day a gray slaad can attempt to summon 1-2 red slaadi or 1 blue slaad with a 40% chance of success, or 1 green slaad with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A slaad that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All slaadi have acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic resistance 5.

StatsBlock.Name: Greater Barghest
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (1d8+4) or 2 claws x1 +6 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Scent, Alternate Form
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +16, Concentration +14, Hide +10, Intimidate +18, Jump +16, Listen +16, Move Silently +14, Sense Motive +16, Spot +16
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Barghests speak Goblin, Worg, and Infernal.
Description.Combat:
Barghests can claw and bite, no matter what their form, and usually disdain weapons. Though they love killing, they have little stomach for direct combat and attack from ambush whenever possible. Once battle is joined, barghests hide and use project image to conceal their true numbers and locations, with emotion and charm person to keep opponents off balance. They try to pit as many of themselves against as few of the enemy as possible, and use their high speed to stay way from the enemy's main strength.
Occasionally, a greater barghest uses a magic two-handed weapon in combat, giving it multiple attacks (attack bonus +13/+8). It can also make one bite attack (attack bonus +8) each round. The save DC against a greater barghest's spell-like abilities is 14 + spell level.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-levitate, misdirection, and project image; 1/day-charm monster, charm person, dimension door, and emotion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the barghest's HD (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Feed
SpecialAbility.Text: When a barghest slays a humanoid opponent, it can feed on the corpse, devouring both flesh and life force, as a full-round action. For every 8 HD or levels a barghest consumes, it gains 1 Hit Die. Feeding destroys the victim's body and prevents any form of raising or resurrection that requires part of the corpse. A wish, miracle, or true resurrection spell can restore a devoured victim to life, but there is a 50% chance that even such powerful magic will fail.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A barghest can assume the form of a goblin or a large wolf as a standard action. This ability is similar to the polymorph self spell, except that it allows only goblin and wolf forms. *While in wolf form, a barghest gains the higher of the two listed speeds and a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pass Without Trace
SpecialAbility.Text: A barghest in wolf form can pass without trace (as the spell) as a free action.

StatsBlock.Name: Green Hag
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +10 melee (1d4+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Great Fortitude

Description.General: Green Hags speak Giant and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: change self, dancing lights, ghost sound, invisibility, pass without trace, tongues, and water breathing. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Weakness
SpecialAbility.Text: The green hag can weaken a foe by making a special touch attack. The affected opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 13) or take 2d4 points of temporary Strength damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mimicry
SpecialAbility.Text: Green hags can imitate the sounds of almost any animal found near their lairs.

StatsBlock.Name: Green Slaad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +11 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +9 melee (2d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +16, Hide +9, Jump +16, Listen +12, Move Silently +13, Spot +12

Description.Characters: Slaadi rarely have the focus to devote themselves to a character class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: chaos hammer, deeper darkness, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel law, fear, protection from law, see invisibility, and shatter. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A green slaad can shift between its natural form and any humanoid form at will as a standard action. A green slaad whose personal treasure includes useful equipment or magic items will employ these when in humanoid form. A green slaad remains in humanoid form indefinitely. The ability is otherwise similar to polymorph self cast by a 9th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Slaad
SpecialAbility.Text: Twice per day a green slaad can attempt to summon another green slaad with a 40% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A slaad that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All slaadi have acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic resistance 5.

StatsBlock.Name: Grick
StatsBlock.Attacks: 4 tentacle rakes melee (1d4+2) or bite melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 tentacle rakes x1 +2 melee (1d4+2) or bite x1 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 3, Wis 14, Cha 5

Description.Combat: They hunt by holing up near high-traffic areas, using their natural coloration to blend into convenient shadows. When prey (virtually anything that moves) ventures near, they lash out with their tentacles. A grick's rubbery body seems to shed blows of any kind. Its jaws are relatively small and weak compared to its body mass, so rather than consume its kill immediately, the grick normally drags its victim back to its lair to be eaten at its leisure.
Description.Skills: *Their coloration affords gricks a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks when in natural rocky areas.

StatsBlock.Name: Griffon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +6 melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 5, Wis 13, Cha 8

Description.Combat: Griffons prefer to pounce on their prey, either diving to the attack or leaping from above.
Description.Skills: Griffons receive a +4 racial bonus to Jump checks. *They also receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks in daylight.
Description.Training:
Training a griffon as an aerial mount requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 21 for a young creature, or DC 28 for an adult) and that the creature be willing. Griffons mature in about two years. Trainers can reduce the DC by 5 and the rearing time by one-half by using a magic bridle enchanted for this purpose.
Griffon eggs are worth 3,500 gp apiece on the open market, while young are worth 7,000 gp each. Professional trainers charge 1,500 gp to rear or train a griffon. Riding a trained griffon requires an exotic saddle. A griffon can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a griffon is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a griffon dives or leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A griffon that pounces on an opponent can make two rake attacks (+8 melee) with its hind legs for 1d6+2 slashing damage each.

StatsBlock.Name: Grig
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4)composite shortbow x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 5, Dex 18, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Craft +4, Escape Artist +8, Hide +16, Jump +9, Listen +7, Move Silently +8, Search +3, Spot +4, +6

Description.Skills: All sprites receive a +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. Grigs receive a +8 racial bonus to Jump checks. *They also receive a +5 racial bonus to Move Silently checks in a forest setting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-change self, entangle, invisibility (self only), pyrotechnics, and ventriloquism. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fiddle
SpecialAbility.Text: One grig in each band carries a tiny, grig-sized fiddle. When the fiddler plays, any nonsprite within 30 feet of the instrument must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or be affected as though by Otto's irresistible dance as long as the playing continues.

StatsBlock.Name: Grimlock
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Battleaxe x1 +2 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 6

Description.Skills: *A grimlock's dull gray skin helps it hide in its native terrain, conferring a +10 racial bonus to Hide checks when in mountains or underground.
Description.Characters: Grimlocks favor the barbarian class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Grimlocks can ascertain all foes within 40 feet as a sighted creature would. Beyond that range, they treat all targets as totally concealed. Grimlocks are susceptible to sound and scent based attacks, however, and are affected normally by loud noises and sonic spells (such as ghost sound or silence) and overpowering odors (such as stinking cloud or incense-heavy air). Negating a grimlock's sense of smell or hearing reduces this ability to normal Blind-Fight (as the feat). If both are negated, the grimlock is effectively blinded.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Grimlocks are immune to gaze attacks, visual effects, illusions, and other attack forms that rely on sight.

StatsBlock.Name: Guardian Naga
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +10 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 14, Con 19, Int 16, Wis 19, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +12, Concentration +15, Listen +13, Sense Motive +13, Spellcraft +11, Spot +13
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Lightning Reflexes, Spell Focus

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 19); initial and secondary damage 2d8 temporary Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spit
SpecialAbility.Text: A guardian naga can spit its venom up to 30 feet as a standard action. The attack ignores armor and has no range increment. Opponents hit by this attack must attempt saves against the naga's poison, as above.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Guardian nagas cast spells as 9th-level sorcerers, and can also cast cleric spells and spells from the Good and Law domains as arcane spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Gynosphinx
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +11 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 13, Int 18, Wis 19, Cha 19
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Iron Will

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a sphinx leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A sphinx that pounces onto a creature can make two rake attacks with its hind legs. Attack bonus +11 melee, damage 1d6+2.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
3/day-clairaudience/clairvoyance, detect magic, read magic, and see invisibility; 1/day-comprehend languages, locate object, dispel magic, remove curse, and legend lore. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 14th-level sorcerer (save DC 14 + spell level).
Once per week a gynosphinx can create a symbol of death, discord, insanity, pain, persuasion, sleep, and stunning (one of each) as the spell cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 22).

StatsBlock.Name: Half Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Half-elves speak Elven, and most also know Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: A half-elf can choose any class as his or her favored class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half-Elven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
These are in addition to the basic elf traits, except where noted here.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Half-elves can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, etc.
  • +1 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Half Orc
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Greataxe x1 +1 melee (1d12+1)javelin x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 10, Con 11, Int 9, Wis 8, Cha 8

Description.Characters: A half-orc's favored class is barbarian.

StatsBlock.Name: Halfblood
StatsBlock.Attacks: Unknown (1d6+2) or Unknown (1d6+1)masterwork mighty composite long melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Unknown (1d6+2) or Unknown (1d6+1)masterwork mighty composite long x1 +5 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Dodge, Expertise, Improved Initiative

Description.General:
Yuan-ti speak their own language, plus Common, Draconic, and Abyssal.
Yuan-Ti Halfblood Features
Description.Skills: *Yuan-ti using chameleon power receive a +8 circumstance bonus to Hide checks.
Description.Characters: The favored class for yuan-ti halfbloods is ranger. Yuan-ti clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, Destruction, and Plant.

SpecialAbility.Name: Halfblood Features
SpecialAbility.Text:
Yuanti halfbloods have certain snake-like features to their anatomy. Roll twice on the following list, ignoring duplicate or contradictory results:
  • 1 - Snake head: Bite damage 1d6 and poison (save DC 14; initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution)
  • 2 - Flexible torso: +1 racial bonus to Reflex saves
  • 3 - No legs, snake tail: Speed 20 ft., climb 15 ft., swim 15 ft; can constrict Medium-size or smaller creatures for 1d6+3 damage
  • 4 - Snakes instead of arms: Gains 2 bite attacks (1d4 arms damage and poison as above)
  • 5 - Scales instead of skin: +4 natural armor
  • 6 - Legs and snake tail: Speed 30 ft., swim 15 ft.; can constrict Small or smaller creatures for 1d4+3 damage

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: (If human-headed) 1/day-animal trance, cause fear, deeper darkness, entangle, neutralize poison, suggestion, and polymorph other. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text:
All yuan-ti can produce the following effects at will:
  • Detect Poison: As the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.
  • Alternate Form: The yuan-ti can assume the form of a Tiny to Large viper. This ability is similar to a shapchange spell cast by a 19th-level sorcerer but allows only viper forms. If the yuan-ti has a poisonous bite of its own, it uses its own or the viper's poison, whichever is more potent.
  • Chameleon Power: The yuan-ti can change the coloration of itself and its equipment to match its surroundings.
  • Produce Acid: The yuan-ti can exude acid from its body, dealing 1d6 points of damage to anything it touches. The acid becomes inert when it leaves the yuan-ti's body.
  • Aversion: The yuan-ti creates a compulsion effect targeting one creature within 30 feet. The subject must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or gain an aversion to snakes for 10 minutes. Affected subjects must stay at least 20 feet from any snake or yuan-ti, alive or dead; if already within 20 feet, they move away. A subject can overcome the compulsion by succeeding at another DC 17 Will save, but still suffers deep anxiety. This causes a -4 reduction to Dexterity until the effect wears off or the subject is no longer within 20 feet of a snake or yuan-ti. This ability is otherwise similar to antipathy as cast by a 16th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Halfbloods and abominations with snake heads only-bite, Fortitude save (DC 17); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Hamatula (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +11 melee (2d4+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Fear, Improved Grab, Impale 3d4+4, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Baatezu Qualities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 11, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 14, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +13, Hide +12, Listen +15, Move Silently +12, Search +13, Sense Motive +13, Spot +15

Description.General: Hamatulas speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: animate dead, charm person, desecrate, doom, hold person, major image, produce flame, pyrotechnics, and suggestion; 1/day-order's wrath or unholy blight. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level). A hamatula can teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only) at will as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear
SpecialAbility.Text: A creature hit by a hamatula must succeed at a Will save (DC 14) or be affected as though by fear cast by a 9th-level sorcerer. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that hamatula's fear ability for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the hamatula must hit with a claw attack. If it gets a hold, it can impale the opponent on its barbed body.

SpecialAbility.Name: Impale
SpecialAbility.Text: A hamatula deals 3d4+4 points of damage to a grabbed opponent with a successful grapple check.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a hamatula can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures with a 50% chance of success, or another hamatula with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Hamatula can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Harpy
StatsBlock.Attacks: Club melee (1d4) or or 2 claws melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Club x2 +3 melee (1d4) or or 2 claws x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 7, Wis 10, Cha 15

Description.Combat: When a harpy engages in battle, it prefers to use Flyby Attack and strike with a melee weapon.

SpecialAbility.Name: Captivating Song
SpecialAbility.Text: The most insidious ability of the harpy is its song. When a harpy sings, all creatures (other than harpies) within a 300-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or become utterly captivated. This is a sonic, mind-affecting charm. If the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that harpy's song for one day. A captivated victim walks toward the harpy, taking the most direct route available. If the path leads into a dangerous area, that creature gets a second saving throw. Captivated creatures can take no actions other than to defend themselves. A victim within 5 feet of the harpy stands there and offers no resistance to the monster's attacks. The effect continues for as long as the harpy sings. A bard's countersong ability allows the captivated creature to attempt a new Will save.

StatsBlock.Name: Hawk
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Claws x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

Description.Skills: *Hawks gain a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks in daylight.

StatsBlock.Name: Hell Hound
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +5 melee (1d8+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +11, Listen +5, Move Silently +13, Spot +7, Wilderness Lore +0

Description.General: Hell hounds do not speak but understand Infernal.
Description.Combat: Hell hounds are efficient hunters. A favorite pack tactic is to surround prey quietly, then attack with one or two hounds, driving it with their fiery breath toward the rest. If the prey doesn't run, the pack closes in. Hell hounds track fleeing prey relentlessly.
Description.Skills: Hell hounds receive a +5 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks. *They also receive a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks and Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent, due to their keen sense of smell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of fire, 30 feet, every 2d4 rounds; damage 1d4+1, Reflex half DC 13. The fiery breath also ignites any flammable materials within the cone. Hell hounds can use their breath weapon while biting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Hellcat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +9 melee (1d4+6) or bite x1 +4 melee (2d6+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Scent, Spell Resistance, Damage Reduction 20/+2, Resistance (), Invisible In Light
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +16, Jump +16, Listen +16, Move Silently +16, Spot +12, Swim +12

Description.General: Hellcats use a natural telepathy to communicate with one another and those they encounter.
Description.Skills: Hellcats receive a +4 racial bonus to Listen and Move Silently checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a hellcat leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the hellcat must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A hellcat can make two rake attacks (+12 melee) against a held creature with its hind legs for 1d4+3 damage each. If the hellcat pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Invisible in Light
SpecialAbility.Text: A hellcat is invisible in any area lit well enough for a human to see. In a darkened area, it shows up as a faintly glowing outline visible up to 30 feet away (60 feet if the viewer has low-light vision). Magical darkness smothers the glow and conceals the outline.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Hezrou (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (4d4+5) or 2 claws melee (1d6+2) or bite melee (+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (4d4+5) or 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+2) or bite x1 +7 melee (+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Spell-Like Abilities, Stench, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Half Damage
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +15, Hide +14, Listen +22, Move Silently +12, Search +14, Spellcraft +14, Spot +22

Description.General: Hezrous speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Hezrous receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-animate object, blasphemy, blink, chaos hammer, deeper darkness, desecrate, detect good, detect magic, dispel good, magic circle against good, produce flame, summon swarm, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), and unholy blight; 3/day-gaseous form. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 13th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Stench
SpecialAbility.Text: A hezrou's skin produces a foul-smelling, toxic liquid whenever it fights. All creatures (except other tanar'ri) within 10 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) or be overwhelmed by nausea. They are rendered helpless from gagging and vomiting for as long as they remain in the affected area and for 1d4 rounds afterward. Creatures who successfully save suffer a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls but cannot be affected again by the same hezrou's stench for one day. A delay poison or neutralize poison spell removes the effect from one creature.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the hezrou must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with both claw attacks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a hezrou can attempt to summon 4d10 dretches or another hezrou with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half Damage
SpecialAbility.Text: Any nonmagical attack against a hezrou, including hits from enchanted weapons, deals only half damage. This effect does not stack with the hezrou's damage reduction; apply either the damage reduction or the half damage, whichever results in the least amount of damage suffered.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Hezrous are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Hezrous have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Hezrous can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Hieracosphinx
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (1d10+5) or 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 14, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 15, Cha 10

Description.Skills: *Hieracosphinxes gain a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks in daylight.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a sphinx leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A sphinx that pounces onto a creature can make two rake attacks with its hind legs. Attack bonus +13 melee, damage 1d6+2.

StatsBlock.Name: High Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Elves speak Elven, and most also know Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: An elf's favored class is wizard.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Elves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Elves can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, etc.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Hill Dwarf
StatsBlock.Attacks: Dwarven waraxe melee (1d10) or shortbo melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dwarven waraxe x1 melee (1d10) or shortbo x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 8

Description.General: Dwarves speak Dwarven and Undercommon. Most who travel outside dwarven lands (as traders, mercenaries, or adventurers) know the Common tongue, while warriors in the dwarven cities usually learn Goblin to better interrogate and spy on those evil denizens of the deep caves.
Description.Skills: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft or Profession checks that are related to stone or metal.
Description.Characters: A dwarf's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dwarven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Dwarves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against orcs and goblinoids, through special combat training.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +2 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against all poisons.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants, through special defensive training.
  • Darkvision up to 60 feet.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A dwarf who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A dwarf can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Hill Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatclub x2 +15/+10 melee (2d6+10)rock x2 +15/+10 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 8, Con 19, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 17

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Hippogriff
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d4+4) or bite x1 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 4, Wis 13, Cha 8

Description.Combat: Hippogriffs dive at their prey and strike with their taloned forelegs. When they cannot dive, they slash with claws and beak.
Description.Skills: *Hippogriffs receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks during daylight hours.
Description.Training:
Training a hippogriff as an aerial mount requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 21 for a young creature, or DC 28 for an adult) and that the creature be willing. Hippogriffs mature at the same rate as horses. Trainers can reduce the DC by 5 and the rearing time by one-half by using a magic bridle enchanted for this purpose.
Hippogriff eggs are worth 2,000 gp apiece on the open market, while young are worth 3,000 gp each. Professional trainers charge 1,000 gp to rear or train a hippogriff. Riding a trained hippogriff requires an exotic saddle. A hippogriff can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a hippogriff is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Hobgoblin
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8)javelin x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 10

Description.General: Hobgoblins speak Goblin and Common.
Description.Combat: These creatures have a strong grasp of strategy and tactics and are capable of carrying out sophisticated battle plans. Under the leadership of a skilled strategist or tactician, their discipline can prove a deciding factor. Hobgoblins hate elves and attack them first, in preference to other opponents.
Description.Skills: Hobgoblins receive a +4 racial bonus to Move Silently checks.
Description.Characters: A hobgoblin's favored class is fighter. Hobgoblin clerics can choose two of the following domains: Evil, Destruction, and Trickery.

StatsBlock.Name: Homunculus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 7

Description.Combat: Homunculi land on their victims and bite with their venomous fangs.
Description.Construction:
A homunculus costs 100 gp to create, including 20 gp for the body. This cost includes all the materials and spell components that are consumed by or become a permanent part of the creation.
Creating the body requires a Craft (sculpture or masonry) check (DC of 12).
After the body is sculpted, it is animated through an extended magical ritual that requires a 7th-level character with the Craft Wondrous Item feat. This ritual requires a week to complete: The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom, similar to an alchemist's laboratory and costing 500 gp to establish. If the creator is personally constructing the creature's body, the building and ritual can be performed together.
A character not actively working on the ritual must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If he or she misses a day, the process fails, and the ritual must be started anew; any gp spent on the failed ritual is lost (but not XP). The previously crafted body can be reused, as can the laboratory.
Completing the ritual requires casting arcane eye, mirror image, and mending on the final day of the ritual and drains 25 XP from the creator. He or she must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11); initial damage sleep for 1 minute, secondary damage sleep for another 5d6 minutes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Horse, Heavy
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +1 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Carrying: A light load for a heavy horse is up to 200 pounds; a medium load, 201-400 pounds; a heavy load, 401-600 pounds. A heavy horse can drag 3,000 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Horse, Heavy War
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +6 melee (1d6+4)bite x1 +6 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

Description.General: These animals are similar to heavy horses but are trained and bred for strength and aggression. A heavy warhorse can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check (DC 10).
Description.Carrying: A light load for a heavy warhorse is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; a heavy load, 601-900 pounds. A heavy warhorse can drag 4,500 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Horse, Light
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.General: A light horse cannot fight while carrying a rider.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a light horse is up to 150 pounds; a medium load, 151-300 pounds; a heavy load, 301-450 pounds. A light horse can drag 2,250 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Horse, Light War
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +2 melee (1d4+3)bite x1 +2 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 6

Description.General: A light warhorse can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check (DC 10).
Description.Carrying: A light load for a light warhorse is up to 230 pounds; a medium load, 231-460 pounds; a heavy load, 461-690 pounds. A light warhorse can drag 3,450 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Hound Archon
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (1d8+2) or 2 slams melee (1d4+1)greatsword melee (2d6+2) or bite melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +6 melee (1d8+2) or 2 slams x1 +1 melee (1d4+1)greatsword x2 +6/+1 melee (2d6+2) or bite x1 +1 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Scent, Immunities (Petrification), Alternate Form, Magic Circle Against Evil, Teleport, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +8, Hide +7, Jump +9, Listen +8, Move Silently +7, Sense Motive +8, Spot +7, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: aid, continual flame, detect evil, and message. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: Hound archons can assume any canine form (except that of a werewolf or other lycanthrope) as a standard action. This ability is similar to the polymorph self spell but allows only canines. *While in canine form, a hound archon gains the higher of the two listed speeds and a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide and Wilderness Lore checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Aura of Menace
SpecialAbility.Text: A righteous aura surrounds a hound archon that fights or gets angry. Any hostile creature within a 20-foot radius of an archon must succeed at a Will save (DC 16) to resist its effects. Those who fail suffer a -2 morale penalty to attacks, AC, and saves for one day or until they successfully hit the archon that generated the aura. A creature that has resisted or broken the effect cannot be affected again by that archon's aura for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Circle against Evil
SpecialAbility.Text: A magic circle against evil effect always surrounds archons, identical with the spell cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the archon's Hit Dice. The effect can be dispelled, but the archon can create it again during its next turn as a free action. (The defensive benefits from the circle are not included in the statistics block.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Teleport
SpecialAbility.Text: Archons can teleport without error at will, as the spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer, except that the creature can transport only itself and up to 50 pounds of objects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Howler
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +8 melee (2d8+5) or 1d4 quills x1 +3 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 8
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +10, Hide +8, Listen +11, Move Silently +8, Search +1, Spot +11

Description.Combat: Howlers attack in groups, for they are cowardly and cruel. They prefer to charge into combat, race out, and then charge in again.
Description.Training:
Small and Medium-size infernal creatures such as quasits, abyssal orcs, or even succubi sometimes use howlers as mounts or pack animals. They are particularly useful underground. Larger and more powerful demons use them like hunting dogs.
Training a howler requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 23 for a young creature, or DC 30 for an adult) and that the creature be willing. Trainers can reduce the DC by 5 and the rearing time by one-half by using a magic harness enchanted for the purpose. Riding a howler requires an exotic saddle. A howler can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a howler is up to 460 pounds; a medium load, 461-920 pounds; and a heavy load, 921-1,380 pounds. A howler can drag 6,900 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Quills
SpecialAbility.Text: The howler's neck bristles with long quills. While biting, the creature thrashes about, striking with 1d4 of them. An opponent hit by the howler's quill attack must make a Reflex save (DC 16) or have the quill break off in his or her flesh. A lodged quill imposes a -1 circumstance penalty to attacks, saves, and checks. Removing the quill deals 1d6 additional points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Howl
SpecialAbility.Text: All beings other than outsiders that hear the creature's howling for an hour or more are subject to its effect, though it does not help the howler in combat. Those within a 100-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 12) or take 1 point of temporary Wisdom damage. The save must be repeated for each hour of exposure. This is a sonic, mind-affecting attack; deafened creatures are not subject to it.

StatsBlock.Name: Huge Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +9 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Huge Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Huge Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +7 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Ice Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +12, Listen +6, Move Silently +9, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of ice shards, 10 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by frostbitten skin and frozen eyes unless they are immune to or protected from cold. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/hour-magic missile as the spell cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer; 1/day-chill metal as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer. (save DC 12 + spell level)

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: An ice mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is touching a piece of ice of at least Tiny size or if the ambient temperature is freezing or below.

StatsBlock.Name: Imp
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +2 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Poison ), Resistance (), Regeneration, See In Darkness, Polymorph
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +15, Listen +5, Move Silently +5, Search +5, Spellcraft +5, Spot +5

Description.General: Imps speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: detect good, detect magic, and invisibility (self only); 1/day-suggestion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level).
Once per week an imp can use commune to ask six questions. The ability otherwise works as the spell cast by a 12th-level cleric.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 13); initial damage 1d4 temporary Dexterity, secondary damage 2d4 temporary Dexterity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Polymorph
SpecialAbility.Text: An imp can assume other forms at will as a standard action. This ability functions as polymorph self cast by a 12th-level sorcerer, except that an individual imp can assume only one or two forms no larger than Medium-size. Common forms include monstrous spider, raven, rat, and boar.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Imps take normal damage from acid, and from holy and blessed weapons (if silver or enchanted).

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Invisible Stalker
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Unknown (2d6+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 19, Con 14, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Improved Initiative, Weapon Focus

Description.General: These creatures speak only Auran but can understand Common.
Description.Combat:
An invisible stalker attacks by using the air itself as a weapon. It creates a sudden, intense vortex of wind that pounds a single target on the same plane as the creature.
Invisible stalkers can be killed only when on the Elemental Plane of Air. When performing tasks elsewhere, they automatically return to their home plane when they suffer sufficient damage to destroy them.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Natural Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability is constant, allowing the stalker to remain invisible even when attacking. This ability is inherent and not subject to the invisibility purge spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Tracking
SpecialAbility.Text: Invisible stalkers are consummate trackers and make Spot checks instead of the usual Wilderness Lore checks to trace a creature's passage.

StatsBlock.Name: Iron
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +22 melee (2d10+11)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 33, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 1

Description.General:
A golem's creator can command it if the golem is within 60 feet and can see and hear its creator. If uncommanded, the golem usually follows its last instruction to the best of its ability, though if attacked it returns the attack. The creator can give the golem a simple program to govern its actions in his or her absence.
Golems do not need to breathe and are immune to most forms of energy.
Description.Construction:
The cost listed for each golem includes that of the physical body and all the materials and spell components that are consumed or become a permanent part of it.
Understanding the rituals requires a character of the required level with the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats. The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom. The chamber is similar to an alchemist's laboratory and costs 500 gp to establish.
When not working on the rituals, the creator must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If personally constructing the golem's body, the creator can perform the building and rituals together. If the creator misses a day of rituals, the process fails and must be started again. Money spent is lost, but XP spent are not. The golem's body can be reused, as can the laboratory.
Completing the ritual drains the appropriate XP from the creator and requires casting any spells on the final day. The creator must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls.
The golem costs 100,000 gp to create, which includes 1,500 gp for the body. Assembling the body requires a successful Craft (armorsmithing or weaponsmithing) check (DC 20). The creator must be 16th level and able to cast arcane spells. Completing the ritual drains 2,000 XP from the creator and requires cloudkill, geas/quest, limited wish, and polymorph any object.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: First or second round of combat-cloud of poisonous gas, 10-foot cube directly in front of the golem lasting 1 round, free action every 1d4+1 rounds; Fortitude save (DC 17), initial damage 1d4 temporary Constitution, secondary damage death.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: An iron golem is immune to all spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural effects, except as follows. An electricity effect slows it (as the slow spell) for 3 rounds, with no saving throw. A fire effect breaks any slow effect on the golem and cures 1 point of damage for each 3 points of damage it would otherwise deal. For example, a flesh golem hit by a fireball cast by a 5th-level wizard gains back 6 hit points if the damage total is 18. The golem rolls no saving throw against fire effects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rust Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: An iron golem is affected normally by rust attacks, such as that of a rust monster or a rusting grasp spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Janni
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Scimitar x2 +7/+2 melee (1d8+4)longbow x2 +7/+2 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Telepathy, Resistance (), Plane Shift, Elemental Endurance
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +8, Concentration +7, Craft +7, Escape Artist +6, Listen +8, Move Silently +6, Ride +6, Sense Motive +6, Spot +8
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility

Description.General: Jann speak Common, plus Auran, Aquan, Ignan, or Terran, plus Celestial, Abyssal, or Infernal.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-invisibility; 2/day-enlarge or reduce and speak with animals. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 11 + spell level). Once per day a janni can create food and water as a 7th-level priest and can use ethereal jaunt for 1 hour as the spell cast by a 12th-level priest.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental Endurance
SpecialAbility.Text: Jann can survive on the Elemental Planes of Air, Earth, Fire, or Water for up to 48 hours. Failure to return to the Material Plane after that time deals 1 point of damage per additional hour to a janni, until it dies or returns to the Material Plane.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plane Shift
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can enter any of the elemental planes, the Astral Plane, or the Material Plane. This ability transports the genie and up to six other creatures, provided they all link hands with the genie. It is otherwise similar to the spell of the same name.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Arrowhawk - Juvenile
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Electricity ray x1 +2 melee (2d6+1)bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 21, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Intuit Direction +2, Listen +7, Search +7, Sense Motive +7, Spot +7

Description.General: Arrowhawks speak Auran, but they are not talkative creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Electricity Ray
SpecialAbility.Text: An arrowhawk can fire this ray once a round, with a range of 45 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Arrowhawks have acid, electricity, and poison immunity.

StatsBlock.Name: Kobold
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Halfspear x1 melee (1d6)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 13, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Craft +2, Hide +8, Listen +2, Move Silently +4, Search +2, Spot +2

Description.General: Kobolds speak Draconic with voices that sound like yapping dogs.
Description.Combat: They begin a fight by slinging bullets, closing only when they can see that their foes have been weakened. Whenever they can, kobolds set up ambushes near trapped areas. They aim to drive enemies into the traps, where other kobolds wait to pour flaming oil over them, shoot them, or drop poisonous vermin onto them.
Description.Skills: Kobolds receive a +2 racial bonus to Craft (trapmaking), Profession (mining), and Search checks.
Description.Characters: A kobold's favored class is sorcerer. Kobold clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Luck, and Trickery.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: Kobolds suffer a -1 penalty to attack rolls in bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Kraken
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 tentacle rakes melee (2d8+12) or 6 arms melee (1d6+6) or bite melee (4d6+3)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 tentacle rakes x1 +28 melee (2d8+12) or 6 arms x1 +23 melee (1d6+6) or bite x1 +23 melee (4d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 34, Dex 10, Con 29, Int 21, Wis 20, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +19, Knowledge +10, Knowledge +10, Listen +15, Search +15, Spot +15
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Expertise, Improved Initiative, Improved Trip, Iron Will, Improvedcritical

Description.General: Krakens speak Common and Aquan.
Description.Combat: Krakens strike their opponents with their barbed tentacles, then grab and crush with their arms or drag victims into their huge jaws.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the kraken must hit an opponent of up to Huge size with an arm or tentacle attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A kraken deals automatic arm or tentacle damage with a successful grapple check against Huge or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Jet
SpecialAbility.Text: A kraken can jet backward once per round as a double move action, at a speed of 280 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: A kraken can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 80 feet high by 80 feet wide by 120 feet long once per minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the kraken normally uses to escape a losing fight. Creatures within the cloud suffer the effects of total darkness.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/day-control weather, control winds, dominate animal, and resist elements. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level druid (save DC 15 + spell level).

StatsBlock.Name: Krenshar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d6) or 2 claws x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 13

Description.Combat:
Krenshars use solitary scouts to drive prey into the waiting clutches of the pack. The scout appears from hiding, uses its scare ability, then chases the fleeing target to join the attack.
Scare (Ex or Su): As a standard action, a krenshar can pull the skin back from its head, revealing the musculature and bony structures of its skull. This alone is usually sufficient to scare away foes (treat as a Bluff check with a +3 bonus). Combining this scare ability with a loud screech produces an unsettling effect that works like scare cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer (save DC 12). If the save is successful, that opponent cannot be affected again by that krenshar's scare ability for one day. The shriek does not affect other krenshars.

StatsBlock.Name: Kuo-Toa
StatsBlock.Attacks: Spear melee (1d8+1) or bite melee (1d4)spear melee (+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Spear x1 +1 melee (1d8+1) or bite x1 melee (1d4)spear x1 +1 melee (+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistance (), Keen Sight, Slippery, Adhesive, Light Blindness, Amphibious
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 8
StatsBlock.Skills: Escape Artist +18, Listen +9, Move Silently +3, Search +10, Spot +11, +6

Description.General: Kuotoas speak Kuo-Toan, Undercommon, and Aquan.
Description.Combat: Kuo-toan tactics and weapons vary greatly depending upon the training and skills of the individual encountered. A group of kuo-toa warriors usually fight in formation, throwing their spears before closing to melee range.
Description.Skills: Kuo-toas receive a +15 racial bonus to Escape Artist checks and a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Search checks.
Description.Characters: A kuo-toa's favored class is rogue. Whips can choose any two of the following domains: Destruction, Evil, and Water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Lightning Bolt
SpecialAbility.Text: Two or more kuo-toa clerics (known as "whips") operating together can generate a stroke of lightning every 1d4 rounds. The whips must join hands to launch the bolt but need merely remain within 30 feet of one another while it builds. The lightning bolt deals 1d6 points of damage per whip, but a successful Reflex save halves this amount (save DC 13 + number of whips).

SpecialAbility.Name: Pincer Staff
SpecialAbility.Text: Many kuo-toa fighters and all whips above 6th level carry this Large exotic weapon. A pincer staff deals 1d10 points of bludgeoning damage, threatens a critical hit on a 20, and deals double damage on a critical hit. It has a 10-foot reach and cannot be used against an adjacent opponent. A wielder that hits an opponent of at least Small but no larger than Large size attempts to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If the wielder gets a hold, the staff grabs the opponent and deals 1d10 points of damage each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Sight
SpecialAbility.Text: Kuo-toas have excellent vision thanks to their two independently focusing eyes. Their eyesight is so keen that they can spot a moving object or creature even if it is invisible, ethereal, or astral. Only by remaining perfectly still can such objects or creatures avoid their notice.

SpecialAbility.Name: Slippery
SpecialAbility.Text: All kuo-toas secrete an oily film that makes them difficult to grapple or snare. Webs, magic or otherwise, don't affect kuo-toas, and they usually can wriggle free from most other forms of confinement.

SpecialAbility.Name: Adhesive
SpecialAbility.Text: Kuo-toas use their own body oil and other materials to give their shields a finish almost like flypaper, holding fast any creatures or items touching them. Anyone who makes an unsuccessful melee attack against a kuo-toa must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 14), or the attacker's weapon sticks to the shield and is yanked out of the wielder's grip. Creatures using natural weapons are automatically grappled if they get stuck.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Kuo-toas are immune to poison and paralysis. The various hold spells also have no effect on them, and their keen sight automatically detects figments for what they are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Blindness
SpecialAbility.Text: Abrupt exposure to bright light (such as sunlight or a daylight spell) blinds kuo-toas for 1 round. In addition, they suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks while operating in bright light.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Text: Although kuo-toas breathe by means of gills, they can survive indefinitely on land.

StatsBlock.Name: Kyton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 chain rakes x1 +9 melee (1d8+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Cold ), Regeneration
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 11, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +12, Craft +10, Escape Artist +11, Listen +13, Spot +13

Description.General: Kytons speak Infernal and Common.
Description.Skills: Kytons receive a +8 racial bonus to Craft skills involving metalwork.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dancing Chains
SpecialAbility.Text: A kyton's most awesome attack is its ability to control all chains within 20 feet as a standard action, making them dance or move as it wishes. In addition, the kyton can increase the chains' length by up to 15 feet and cause them to sprout razor-edged barbs. These chains attack as effectively as the kyton itself. A kyton can climb chains it controls at its normal speed without a Climb check.

SpecialAbility.Name: Unnerving Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: A kyton can make its face resemble one of the opponent's departed loved ones or bitter enemies. Those subjected to the gaze must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or suffer a -1 morale penalty to all attack rolls for 1d3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Kytons take normal damage from fire, acid, and blessed weapons. A kyton that loses a piece of its body regrows it in 2d6x10 minutes. Holding the severed member against the stump enables it to reattach instantly.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Lacedon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +6, Escape Artist +7, Hide +7, Intuit Direction +3, Jump +6, Listen +7, Move Silently +7, Search +6, Spot +7

Description.General: Lacedons speak the languages they spoke in life (usually Common).

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Those hit by a ghoul's bite or claw attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be paralyzed for 1d6+2 minutes. Elves are immune to this paralysis.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: In most cases, ghouls devour those they kill. From time to time, however, the bodies of their humanoid victims lie where they fell, to rise as ghouls themselves in 1d4 days. Casting protection from evil on a body before the end of that time averts the transformation. (The statistics above are for human ghouls. Ghouls and ghasts may vary depending on their original race or kind.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Lamia
