StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Touch x1 +8 melee ()dagger x2 +8/+3 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 15, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Iron Will, Mobility, Weapon Finesse

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/day-charm person, major image, mirror image, and suggestion. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (save DC 11 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Wisdom Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: By making a successful touch attack, a lamia permanently drains 1 point of Wisdom. Lamias try to use this power early in an encounter to make foes more susceptible to charm person and suggestion.

StatsBlock.Name: Lammasu
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +9 melee (1d6+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 16, Wis 17, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +12, Knowledge +12, Listen +8, Sense Motive +12, Spot +8
StatsBlock.Feats: Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Flyby Attack, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes

Description.General: Lammasus speak Common, Draconic, and Celestial.
Description.Skills: *Lammasus gain a +2 racial bonus to Spot checks during daylight hours.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: A lammasu casts spells as a 7th-level cleric, choosing from any two of the following domains: Good, Healing, Knowledge, and Law. Save DC is 13 + spell level.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Circle against Evil
SpecialAbility.Text: A lammasu has a continuous magic circle against evil that affects a 20-foot radius. The aura can be dispelled, but the lammasu can create it again as a free action on its next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 2/day-improved invisibility; 1/day-dimension door. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 7th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a lammasu leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A lammasu that pounces on a creature can make two rake attacks (+12 melee) with its hind legs for 1d6+3 slashing damage each.

StatsBlock.Name: Lantern Archon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 light rays x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Immunities (Electricity), Magic Circle Against Evil, Teleport, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 1, Dex 11, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 10

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Ray
SpecialAbility.Text: A lantern archon's light rays have a range of 30 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: aid, detect evil, and continual flame. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Aura of Menace
SpecialAbility.Text: A righteous aura surrounds a lantern archon that fights or gets angry. Any hostile creature within a 20-foot radius of an archon must succeed at a Will save (DC 11) to resist its effects. Those who fail suffer a -2 morale penalty to attacks, AC, and saves for one day or until they successfully hit the archon that generated the aura. A creature that has resisted or broken the effect cannot be affected again by that archon's aura for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Circle against Evil
SpecialAbility.Text: A magic circle against evil effect always surrounds archons, identical with the spell cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the archon's Hit Dice. The effect can be dispelled, but the archon can create it again during its next turn as a free action. (The defensive benefits from the circle are not included in the statistics block.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Teleport
SpecialAbility.Text: Archons can teleport without error at will, as the spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer, except that the creature can transport only itself and up to 50 pounds of objects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Large Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +5 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Large Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Large Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +4 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Lemure (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Baatezu Qualities, Mindless
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 5

Description.General: Lemures speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mindless
SpecialAbility.Text: Lemures are immune to all mind-influencing effects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Leopard
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d6+3)2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 19, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Balance +12, Climb +11, Hide +9, Listen +6, Move Silently +9, Spot +6

Description.Skills: Leopards receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a leopard leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the leopard must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A leopard that gets a hold can make two rake attacks (+6 melee) with its hind legs for 1d3+1 damage each. If the leopard pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

StatsBlock.Name: Lightfoot
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) heavy crossbow x1 melee (1d10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +0, Hide +5, Jump +0, Listen +3, Move Silently +4

Description.General: Halflings speak Halfling and Common.
Description.Combat: Halflings prefer to fight defensively, usually hiding and launching ranged attacks as the foe approaches.
Description.Skills: Halflings are agile, surefooted, and athletic. They receive a +2 racial bonus to Climb, Jump, and Move Silently checks. Their keen hearing bestows a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks.
Description.Characters: A halfling's favored class is rogue.

SpecialAbility.Name: Halfling Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Halflings benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Halflings gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • +1 racial bonus to all saving throws.
  • +2 morale bonus to saving throws against fear. (This bonus stacks with the halfling's +1 bonus to saving throws in general.)
  • +1 racial attack bonus with a thrown weapon.

StatsBlock.Name: Lillend
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sword melee (1d8+5) or tail slap melee (2d6+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sword x2 +8/+3 melee (1d8+5) or tail slap x1 +3 melee (2d6+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Spells, Constrict 2d6+5, Spell-Like Abilities, Bardic Music
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 14, Wis 16, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +12, Concentration +12, Knowledge +12, Listen +13, Perform +14, Spellcraft +12, Wilderness Lore +17

Description.General: Lillends speak Celestial, Infernal, Abyssal, and Common.
Description.Skills: Lillends receive a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: A lillend casts arcane spells as a 6th-level bard. Save DC is 14 + spell level.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-darkness, hallucinatory terrain, knock, and light; 1/day-charm person, speak with animals, and speak with plants. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 10th-level bard (save DC 14 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Bardic Music
SpecialAbility.Text: A lillend also has the bardic music ability as a 6th-level bard.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the lillend must hit an opponent of up to Medium-size with its tail slap attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A lillend deals 2d6+5 points of damage with a successful grapple check against opponents of up to Medium-size. This uses the entire lower portion of its body, so it cannot take any move actions when constricting, though it can still attack with its sword.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Resistance
SpecialAbility.Text: A lillend is immune to nonmagical fire and has magic fire resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Lion
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d4+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Balance +7, Hide +4, Jump +5, Listen +5, Move Silently +11, Spot +5

Description.Skills: Lions receive a +4 racial bonus to Balance, Hide, and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a lion leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the lion must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A lion that gets a hold can make two rake attacks (+7 melee) with its hind legs for 1d4+2 damage each. If the lion pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

StatsBlock.Name: Lion
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +12 melee (1d6+7) or bite x1 +7 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +5, Jump +10, Listen +4, Move Silently +9, Spot +4

Description.Skills: Dire lions receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a dire lion leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the dire lion must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire lion can make two rake attacks (+12 melee) against a held creature with its hind legs for 1d6+3 damage each. If the dire lion pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

StatsBlock.Name: Lizard
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Lizards use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks and receive a +8 bonus to Balance checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Lizard, Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 2
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +9, Hide +7, Listen +4, Move Silently +6, Spot +4

Description.Skills: Giant lizards receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks. *In forested or overgrown areas, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

StatsBlock.Name: Lizardfolk
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 claws melee (1d4+1) or Unknown (1d10+1) or Unknown (1d4) or Unknown (1d6+1)or javelin melee (+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d4+1) or Unknown (1d10+1) or Unknown (1d4) or Unknown (1d6+1)or javelin x1 +1 melee (+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 9, Wis 10, Cha 10

Description.General: Lizardfolk speak Draconic.
Description.Skills: Thanks to their tails, lizardfolk receive a +4 racial bonus to Jump, Swim, and Balance checks (the numbers in the statistics block do not reflect check penalties for large shields).
Description.Characters: A lizardfolk's favored class is druid. Lizardfolk clerics (shamans) can choose any two of the following domains: Animal, Plant, and Water.

StatsBlock.Name: Locathah
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longspear x1 melee (1d8)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.Characters: A locathah's favored class is barbarian. Locathah clerics can choose two of the following domains: Animal, Protection, and Water.

StatsBlock.Name: Magma Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +5, Hide +11, Listen +6, Move Silently +7, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of magma, 10 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by burned skin and seared eyes unless they are immune to or protected from fire. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
Once per hour, a magma mephit can shapechange into a pool of lava 3 feet in diameter and 6 inches deep. The mephit's damage reduction improves to 20/+1. The mephit can't attack while in lava form but can use other spell-like abilities. It can move at a speed of 10 feet, but it can't "run." In this form the mephit can pass through small holes or narrow openings, even mere cracks. The pool's touch ignites flammable materials such as paper, straw, or dry wood.
Once per day a magma mephit can use pyrotechnics as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). It can use itself as the fire source without harm.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A magma mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is touching magma, lava, or a flame at least as large as a torch.

StatsBlock.Name: Magmin
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Burning touch x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 9, Dex 13, Con 11, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 10

Description.General: Magmins speak Ignan.

SpecialAbility.Name: Combustion
SpecialAbility.Text: Anyone a magmin touches must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 11) or take an additional 1d8 points of fire damage as clothes ignite or armor becomes searing hot. The damage continues for another 1d4+2 rounds after the magmin's last successful attack. Magmins can also ignite flammable materials with a touch.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fiery Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: Anyone within 30 feet of a magmin must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 11) or suffer 1d6 points of heat damage from the intense heat. Treat this effect as an emanation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Melt Weapons
SpecialAbility.Text: Any metal weapon that strikes a magmin must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 11) or melt away into slag.

StatsBlock.Name: Malenti
StatsBlock.Attacks: Trident melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes melee (1d4+2) or 2 claws melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Trident x1 +2 melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes x1 melee (1d4+2) or 2 claws x1 melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow x1 +2 melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Speak With Sharks, Underwater Sense, Light Sensitivity, Amphibious, Freshwater Sensitivity
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 13, Cha 9
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +2, Hide +6, Listen +7, Profession +2, Spot +7, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.General: If a community of aquatic elves is located within a hundred miles of a sahuagin community, about one in one hundred sahuagin looks just like an aquatic elf. These creatures are called malenti.
Description.Combat:
Malenti are savage fighters, asking for and giving no quarter. When swimming, a sahuagin rakes with its feet as it strikes with its claws or a weapon. About half of any group of sahuagin are also armed with nets.
Blood Frenzy: Once per day a malenti that takes damage in combat can fly into a frenzy the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +2 Constitution and +2 Strength, and suffers a -2 AC penalty. The malenti cannot end its frenzy voluntarily.
Description.Skills: Malenti receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks. *Underwater, the bonus improves to +8. They receive a +8 bonus to Wilderness Lore and Profession (hunt) checks within fifty miles of their homes.
Description.Characters: A male malenti's favored class is ranger. Female malenti favor the cleric class. Malenti clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Strength, and War.

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Sharks
SpecialAbility.Text: Malenti can communicate telepathically with sharks up to 150 feet away. The communication is limited to fairly simple concepts such as "food," "danger," and "enemy." Malenti can use Animal Empathy to befriend and train sharks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Sense
SpecialAbility.Text: A malenti can locate creatures underwater within a 30-foot radius. This ability negates the effects of invisibility and poor visibility. It is less effective against creatures without central nervous systems, such as undead, oozes, and constructs; a malenti can locate such creatures only within a 15-foot radius. Malenti are not fooled by figments when underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: Malenti suffer a -1 penalty to attack rolls in bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Text: Malenti can survive out of the water for 1 hour per point of Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freshwater Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: A malenti fully immersed in freshwater must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or leave the water immediately. If the malenti fails and cannot escape, it suffers a -1 morale penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks. Even on a success, it must repeat the save attempt every 10 minutes it remains immersed.

StatsBlock.Name: Manticore
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 claws melee (2d4+5) or bite melee (1d8+2)6 spikes melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (2d4+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)6 spikes x1 +7 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 7, Wis 12, Cha 9

Description.Combat: A manticore begins most attacks with a volley of spikes, then closes. In the outdoors, it often uses its powerful wings to stay aloft during battle.
Description.Skills: *Manticores receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks in daylight.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spikes
SpecialAbility.Text: With a snap of its tail, a manticore can loose a volley of six spikes as a standard action. This attack has a range of 180 feet with no range increment. A spike threatens a critical hit on a natural attack roll of 19 or 20. The creature can launch only twenty-four spikes in any one day.

StatsBlock.Name: Marilith (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Weapon melee (1d8+5) or 5 weapons melee (1d8+2) or tail slam melee (4d6+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Weapon x2 +12/+7 melee (1d8+5) or 5 weapons x1 +10 melee (1d8+2) or tail slam x1 +10 melee (4d6+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Spell-Like Abilities, Constrict 4d6+7, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 15, Con 21, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +14, Concentration +15, Hide +10, Listen +24, Move Silently +12, Scry +14, Search +14, Sense Motive +15, Spellcraft +14, Spot +24
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Multiattack, Multidexterity, Power Attack, Multiweapon Fighting

Description.General: Mariliths speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Mariliths receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.
Description.Feats: A marilith receives the Multidexteriry and Multiweapon Fighting feats as bonus feats. In combination with its natural abilities, these feats allow the marilith to attack with all its arms at no penalty.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-animate dead, bestow curse, chaos hammer, cloudkill, comprehend languages, darkness, desecrate, detect good, detect law, detect magic, inflict serious wounds, magic circle against good (self only), magic weapon, project image, polymorph self, pyrotechnics, see invisibility, shatter, telekinesis, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), unholy aura, and unholy blight. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 13th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the marilith must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with its tail slam attack. If it succeeds, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A marilith deals 4d6+7 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures. The constricted creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or lose consciousness for at long as it remains in the coils and for 2d4 rounds thereafter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a marilith can attempt to summon 4d10 dretches, 1d4 hezrou, or one nalfeshnee with a 50% chance of success, or one glabrezu or another marilith with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Mariliths are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Mariliths have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Mariliths can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Medium Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Medium-Size Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Medium-Size Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Medusa
StatsBlock.Attacks: Shortbow melee (1d6)dagger melee (1d4) or snakes melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Shortbow x2 +3 melee (1d6)dagger x2 +3 melee (1d4) or snakes x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Feats: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Weapon Finesse

SpecialAbility.Name: Petrifying Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Turn to stone permanently, 30 feet, Fortitude save (DC 15).

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Snakes, Fortitude save (DC 14); initial damage 1d6 temporary Strength, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

StatsBlock.Name: Megaraptor
StatsBlock.Attacks: Rake melee (2d8+5) or 2 claws melee (1d4+2) or bite melee (2d6+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Rake x1 +9 melee (2d8+5) or 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d4+2) or bite x1 +4 melee (2d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 15, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +5, Jump +14, Listen +12, Spot +12, Wilderness Lore +10

StatsBlock.Name: Merfolk
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Trident x1 melee (1d8)heavy crossbow x1 melee (1d10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 12, Con 12, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 13

Description.General: Merfolk speak Common and Aquan.
Description.Combat: Merfolk favor heavy crossbows of shell and coral that fire bolts fashioned from blowfish spines, with an underwater range of 30 yards. Merfolk often barrage their enemies before closing, when they resort to tridents.
Description.Characters: A merfolk's favored class is bard. Merfolk clerics can choose two of the following domains: Animal, Protection, and Water.

StatsBlock.Name: Merrow (Aquatic Ogre)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge longspear x1 +7 melee (1d8+7)Huge longspear x1 +7 melee (2d6+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 8, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 7

Description.General:
Merrows speak Giant, and those specimens who boast Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Apart from their habitat, speed (swim 40 ft.), and their penchant for longspears (attack +7 melee, damage 1d8+7), Merrows are identical with their landbound cousins.

StatsBlock.Name: Mimic
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +6 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 10

Description.General: Mimics speak Common.
Description.Combat: A mimic often surprises the unsuspecting adventurer, lashing out with a heavy pseudopod. Mimics are smart enough to avoid fights to the death by extorting treasure or food from a party.

SpecialAbility.Name: Adhesive
SpecialAbility.Text: A mimic exudes a thick slime that acts as a powerful adhesive, holding fast any creatures or items touching it. An adhesive-covered mimic automatically grapples any creature it hits with its slam attack. Opponents so grappled cannot get free while the mimic is alive without removing the adhesive first. A mimic makes one automatic slam attack each round against any creature stuck to it. A weapon that strikes an adhesive-coated mimic is also stuck fast unless the wielder succeeds at a Reflex save (DC 16). A successful Strength check (DC 16) is needed to pry it off. Strong alcohol dissolves the adhesive. A pint of wine or a similar liquid weakens it, but the mimic still has a +4 bonus to grapple checks. A mimic can dissolve its adhesive at will, and the substance breaks down 5 rounds after the creature dies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mimic Shape
SpecialAbility.Text: A mimic can assume the general shape of any object that fills roughly 150 cubic feet (5 feet by 5 feet by 6 feet), such as a massive chest, a stout bed, or a wide door frame. The creature cannot substantially alter its size, though. A mimic's body is hard and has a rough texture, no matter what appearance it might present. Anyone who examines the mimic can detect the ruse with a successful Spot check opposed by the mimic's Disguise check. Of course, by this time it is generally far too late.

StatsBlock.Name: Mind Flayer
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 tentacles x1 +7 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Psionics, Improved Grab, Mind Blast, Extract
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 19, Wis 17, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +8, Concentration +12, Hide +8, Intimidate +10, Knowledge +9, Listen +10, Move Silently +7, Spot +10
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Mind flayers speak Undercommon but prefer to communicate telepathically.
Description.Combat: Mind flayers like to fight from a distance, using their psionic abilities, particularly their mind blast. If pressed into melee combat, a mind flayer lashes its enemies with the tentacles ringing its mouth.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mind Blast
SpecialAbility.Text: This attack is a cone 60 feet long. Anyone caught in this cone must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or be stunned for 3d4 rounds. Mind flayers often hunt using this power and then drag off one or two of their stunned victims to feed upon.

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-astral projection, charm monster, detect thoughts, levitate, plane shift, and suggestion. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the mind flayer must hit a Small to Large creature with its tentacle attack. If it gets a hold, it attaches the tentacle to the opponent's head. A mind flayer can grab a Huge or larger creature, but only if it can somehow reach the foe's head. After a successful grab, the mind flayer can try to attach its remaining tentacles with a single grapple check. The opponent can escape with a single successful grapple check or Escape Artist check, but the mind flayer gets a +2 circumstance bonus for every tentacle that was attached at the beginning of the opponent's turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Extract
SpecialAbility.Text: A mind flayer that begins its turn with all four tentacles attached and successfully maintains its hold automatically extracts the opponent's brain, instantly killing that creature.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Mind flayers can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Minor Xorn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (2d8+2) or 3 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Cold), Resistance (), 360 Vision, Half Damage From Slashing, Tremorsense
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +10, Intuit Direction +3, Listen +6, Move Silently +3, Spot +8, +0

Description.General: Xorns speak Terran and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burrow
SpecialAbility.Text: A xorn can glide through stone, dirt, or almost any other sort of earth except metal as easily as a fish swims through water. Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other signs of its presence. A move earth spell cast on an area containing a burrowing xorn flings the xorn back 30 feet, stunning the creature for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half Damage from Slashing
SpecialAbility.Text: Slashing weapons deal only half damage to xorns, with a minimum of 1 point of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: All-Around Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns' symmetrically placed eyes allow them to look in any direction, bestowing a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Search checks. Xorns can't be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Xorns can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Minotaur
StatsBlock.Attacks: Huge greataxe melee (2d8+4) or gore melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greataxe x2 +6/+1 melee (2d8+4) or gore x1 +1 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 7, Wis 10, Cha 8

Description.General: Minotaurs speak Giant.
Description.Skills: Minotaurs receive a +4 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charge
SpecialAbility.Text: A minotaur typically begins a battle by charging at an opponent, lowering its head to bring its mighty horns into play. In addition to the normal benefits and hazards of a charge, this allows the beast to make a single gore attack that deals 4d6+6 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Natural Cunning
SpecialAbility.Text: Although minotaurs are not especially intelligent, they possess innate cunning and logical ability. This makes them immune to maze spells, prevents them from ever becoming lost, and enables them to track enemies. Further, they are never caught flat-footed.

StatsBlock.Name: Mohrg
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 slams melee (1d6+5) or tongue touch melee (+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +11 melee (1d6+5) or tongue touch x1 +6 melee (+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Paralyzing Touch, Create Spawn
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 10, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +11, Hide +15, Listen +12, Move Silently +15, Spot +12, Swim +10

Description.Combat: Like zombies, mohrgs attack by slamming enemies with their powerful fists. They often catch opponents flat-footed, for they move much faster than zombies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the mohrg must hit with its slam attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralyzing Touch
SpecialAbility.Text: A mohrg lashes out with its tongue in combat. An opponent the tongue touches must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) or become paralyzed for 1d4 minutes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: Creatures killed by a mohrg rise after 1d4 days as zombies under the morhg's control. They do not possess any of the abilities they had in life.

StatsBlock.Name: Monkey
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 5

Description.Skills: Monkeys use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks and receive a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Monstrous Scorpion, Colossal
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +57 melee (2d8+9) or sting x1 +52 melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 10, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 2

Description.General: Length 80 feet, Width 40 feet (including legs), Body Width 13 feet, Body Height 10 feet (not including stinger).
Description.Skills: A monstrous scorpion receives a +4 racial bonus to Climb, Hide, and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 54); initial and secondary damage 2d8 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the monstrous scorpion must hit with its claw attack. If it gets a hold, it hangs on and stings.

SpecialAbility.Name: Squeeze
SpecialAbility.Text: A monstrous scorpion that gets a hold on an opponent of its size or smaller automatically deals damage with both claws, biting and stinging at its full attack value.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 2

Description.General: Diameter 2 feet (including legs), Body Diameter 8 inches, Height 2 inches.
Description.Skills: Monstrous spiders receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Spot checks. *Monstrous spiders gain a +8 competence bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks when using their webs. *Hunting spiders receive a +6 racial bonus to Jump checks and a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11); initial and secondary damage 1d2 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Web
SpecialAbility.Text:
Escape DC 16, Break DC 22, Hit Points 2.
Both types of monstrous spiders often wait in their webs or in trees, then lower themselves silently on silk strands and leap onto prey passing beneath. A single strand is strong enough to support the spider and one creature of the same size. Web-spinning spiders can cast a web eight times per day. This is similar to an attack with a net but has a maximum range of 50 feet, with a range increment of 10 feet, and is effective against targets up to one size smaller that the spider. The web anchors the target in place, allowing no movement. An entangled creature can escape with a successful Escape Artist check or burst it with a Strength check. Both are standard actions whose DCs are given in the description for each size. Web-spinning spiders often create sheets of sticky webbing from 5 to 60 feet square, depending on the size of the spider. They usually position these sheets to snare flying creatures but can also try to trap prey on the ground. Approaching creatures must succeed at a Spot check (DC 20) to notice a web; otherwise they stumble into it and become trapped as though by a successful web attack. Attempts to escape or burst the webbing gain a +5 bonus if the trapped creature has something to walk on or grab while pulling free. Each 5-foot section has the hit points given in the description for each size, and sheet webs have damage reduction 5/fire. A monstrous spider can move across its own sheet web at its climb speed and can determine the exact location of any creature touching the web.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vermin
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Mountain Dwarf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dwarven waraxe x1 melee (1d10)shortbo x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 8

Description.General: Mountain dwarves speak Dwarven and Undercommon.
Description.Skills: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to Appraise checks and Craft or Profession checks that are related to stone or metal.
Description.Characters: A dwarf's favored class is fighter.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dwarven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Dwarves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against orcs and goblinoids, through special combat training.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against spells and spell-like abilities.
  • +2 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against all poisons.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants, through special defensive training.
  • Darkvision up to 60 feet.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A dwarf who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A dwarf can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Mule
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +2 melee (1d4+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 6

Description.Skills: Mules receive a +2 racial bonus to Dexterity checks to avoid slipping or falling.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a mule is up to 230 pounds; a medium load, 231-460 pounds; a heavy load, 461-690 pounds. A mule can drag 3,450 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Mummy
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +5 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 15

SpecialAbility.Name: Despair
SpecialAbility.Text: At the mere sight of a mummy, the viewer must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or be paralyzed with fear for 1d4 rounds. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that mummy's despair ability for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mummy Rot
SpecialAbility.Text: Supernatural disease [slam, Fortitude save (DC 20), incubation period 1 day; damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.] Unlike normal diseases, mummy rot continues until the victim reaches Constitution 0 (and dies) or receives a remove disease spell or similar magic. An afflicted creature that dies shrivels away into sand and dust that blow away into nothing at the first wind unless both a remove disease and raise dead are cast on the remains within 6 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistant to Blows
SpecialAbility.Text: Physical attacks deal only half damage to mummies. Apply this effect before damage reduction.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: A mummy takes double damage from fire attacks unless a save is allowed for half damage. A successful save halves the damage and a failure doubles it.

StatsBlock.Name: Myrmarch
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sting melee (2d4+4) or bite melee (2d6+2)javelin melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +15 melee (2d4+4) or bite x1 +13 melee (2d6+2)javelin x2 +15/+10 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Fast Healing, Spell Resistance, Resistances
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 16, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +18, Craft +9, Diplomacy +15, Hide +15, Knowledge +16, Listen +18, Move Silently +19, Search +17, Sense Motive +18, Spot +18

Description.General: Myrmarchs speak Formian and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 20); initial and secondary damage 2d6 temporary Dexterity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-charm monster, clairaudience/clairvoyance, detect chaos, detect thoughts, magic circle against chaos, and teleport without error; 1/day-dictum and order's wrath. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Hive Mind
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians within 50 miles of their queen are in constant communication. If one is aware of a particular danger, they all are. If one in a group is not flat-footed, none of them are. No formian in a group is considered flanked unless all of them are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Formians have poison, petrification, and cold immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians have fire, electricity, and sonic resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Nalfeshnee (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (2d4+6) or 2 claws x1 +10 melee (1d4+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Know Alignment, See Invisibility
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 22, Wis 22, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +17, Concentration +18, Diplomacy +17, Listen +26, Move Silently +15, Scry +19, Search +20, Sense Motive +19, Spellcraft +20, Spot +26, +16

Description.General: Nalfeshnees speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Nalfeshnees receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-alter self, call lightning, chaos hammer, chill touch, death knell, deeper darkness, desecrate, detect magic, feeblemind, forget, greater dispelling, invisibility (self only), magic circle against good (self only), mirror image, raise dead, slow, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), unholy aura, unholy blight, and web. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Smite
SpecialAbility.Text: Three times per day a nalfeshnee can create a nimbus of unholy light. When the demon triggers the ability, rainbow-colored beams play around its body. One round later they burst in a 60-foot radius. Affected creatures take 15 points of damage (Reflex half DC 18). They also must succeed at a Will save (DC 18) or be in a stupor for 1d10 rounds as visions of their worst fears hound them. They receive full Dexterity and shield bonuses to AC if attacked but can take no actions. Other tanar'ri are immune to this effect.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Twice per day a nalfeshnee can attempt to summon 1d4 vrocks, 1d4 hezrous, or one glabrezu with a 50% chance of success, or another nalfeshnee with a 20% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Know Alignment
SpecialAbility.Text: Nalfeshnees always know the alignment of any creature that they look upon.

SpecialAbility.Name: See Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: Nalfeshnees continuously see invisibility as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Nalfeshnees are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Nalfeshnees have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Nalfeshnees can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Night Hag
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (2d6+6)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Damage Reduction 20/+3
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 12, Int 15, Wis 15, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +11, Concentration +12, Intimidate +11, Listen +14, Ride +11, Sense Motive +12, Spellcraft +13, Spot +14

Description.General: Night hags speak Infernal, Abyssal, and Celestial.

SpecialAbility.Name: Disease
SpecialAbility.Text: Demon fever [bite, Fortitude save (DC 18), incubation period 1 day; damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.] Each day thereafter, on a failed save, the creature must immediately succeed at another Fortitude save or suffer 1 point of permanent Constitution drain.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will - detect chaos, detect evil, detect good, detect law, detect magic, magic missile, polymorph self, ray of enfeeblement, and sleep. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 11 + spell level). A night hag can use etherealness at will as a 16th-level sorcerer so long as it possesses its heartstone (see below).

SpecialAbility.Name: Dream Haunting
SpecialAbility.Text: Night hags can visit the dreams of chaotic or evil individuals by using a special periapt known as a heartstone to become ethereal, then hovering over the creature. Once the hag invades someone's dreams, it rides on the victim's back until dawn. The sleeper suffers from tormenting dreams and suffers 1 point of permanent Constitution drain upon awakening. A sleeper reduced to a Constitution score of 0 dies. Only another ethereal being can stop these nocturnal intrusions, by confronting and defeating the night hag.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Night hags are immune to fire and cold, and to charm, sleep, and fear effects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heartstone
SpecialAbility.Text: All night hags carry this periapt, which instantly cures any disease contracted by the holder. In addition, a heartstone imparts a +2 resistance bonus to all saving throws. A night hag that loses this charm can no longer use etherealness until it can manufacture another (which takes one month). Good-aligned creatures can also benefit from the heartstone's powers, but the periapt shatters after ten uses and does not bestow etherealness.

StatsBlock.Name: Nightcrawler
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +25 melee (4d6+17) or sting x1 +20 melee (2d8+8)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Swallow Whole, Energy Drain, Poison, Nightshade Abilities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 45, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +18, Intuit Direction +7, Listen +22, Move Silently +20, Spellcraft +17, Spot +22
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Improved Critical, Improved Critical, Improved Initiative, Iron Will Power Attack

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the nightcrawler must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage and can try to swallow the opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightcrawler can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Huge or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of crushing damage plus 1d8 points of acid damage per round from the nightcrawler's gizzard, and is subject to the creature's energy drain. A swallowed creature can climb out of the gizzard with a successful grapple check. This returns it to the nightcrawler's maw, where another successful grapple check is needed to get free. A swallowed creature can also cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 35 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 24). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. The nightcrawler's interior can hold two Huge, four Large, eight Medium-size, sixteen Small, or thirty-two Tiny or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures inside a nightcrawler's gizzard receive one negative level each round. The Fortitude save to remove a negative level has a DC of 24.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 22); initial and secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightcrawler can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Chill Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: All nightshades radiate a 60-foot-radius aura of utter cold. While this aura does not damage living things, it spoils any food and drink it touches. In addition, it ruins holy water and magic potions, oils, and ointments unless the items succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 22). Items that successfully save cannot be affected again by the same nightshade's aura for one day. This bone-numbing cold is so distinctive that anyone exposed to it once instantly recognizes it in the future, so it is difficult for a nightshade to surprise someone who has previously encountered such a beast.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-cause disease, charm person, cloudkill, confusion, darkness, dispel magic, haste, hold person, and invisibility; once per night: finger of death. These abilities are as the spells cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the nightshade's HD total (save DC 14 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightshade can summon undead creatures once every 4 hours: 2-5 shadows, 1-2 wraiths, 1 spectre, or 1 ghost. The undead arrive in 1d10 rounds and serve for 1 hour or until released.

SpecialAbility.Name: Aversion to Daylight
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades are creatures of utter darkness. While they loathe all light, if exposed to natural daylight (not merely a daylight spell), they suffer a -4 morale penalty to all attack rolls.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades suffer no damage from cold.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades have acid, fire, and electricity resistance 50.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades ignore the effects of spells and spell-like abilities of 6th level or lower, just as if the spellcaster had failed to overcome spell resistance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Magic
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightshade can continuously detect magic as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer. It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: See Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightshade can continuously see invisibility as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer. It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

SpecialAbility.Name: Damage Reduction
SpecialAbility.Text: All nightshades have damage reduction 25/+3.

StatsBlock.Name: Nightmare
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +7 melee (1d8+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Intuit Direction +10, Listen +12, Move Silently +11, Search +10, Sense Motive +10, Spot +12

Description.Combat: Nightmares do battle by biting with their viperish fangs and kicking with their powerful legs. A nightmare can fight while mounted, but the rider cannot also fight unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a nightmare is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flaming Hooves
SpecialAbility.Text: A blow from a nightmare's hooves sets combustible materials alight.

SpecialAbility.Name: Smoke
SpecialAbility.Text: During the excitement of battle, a nightmare often snorts and neighs with rage. This fills a 15-foot cone with a hot, sulfurous smoke that chokes and blinds opponents. Anyone in the cone must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 16) or suffer a -2 morale penalty to all attack and damage rolls until 1d6 minutes after they leave the cone. The nightmare gains one-half concealment against creatures 5 feet away and total concealment against creatures 10 feet away. The smoke does not obscure the nightmare's vision at all. The nightmare can suppress the smoke as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Astral Projection and Etherealness
SpecialAbility.Text: These function just like the spells of the same names as cast by a 20th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Nightwalker
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +20 melee (2d6+12)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Nightshade Abilities, Crush Item, Evil Gaze
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 35, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +19, Hide +12, Listen +22, Move Silently +19, Spellcraft +19, Spot +22
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Cleave, Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Great Cleave, Power Attack, Sunder, Improved Critical Improved Initi

Description.Skills: *When hiding in a dark area, a nightwalker receives a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades have acid, fire, and electricity resistance 50.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Immunity

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

SpecialAbility.Name: Damage Reduction
SpecialAbility.Text: All nightshades have damage reduction 25/+3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Crush Item
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightwalker can destroy any weapon or item of Large size or smaller (even magic ones, but not artifacts) by picking it up and crushing it between its hands. This is a standard action. The nightshade must make a successful disarm attack to grab an item held by an opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Evil Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Curse, 30 feet, Will save (DC 24). Cursed opponents suffer a -4 morale penalty to all attack rolls, checks, and saving throws. Dispel evil or remove curse eliminates the effect.

StatsBlock.Name: Nightwing
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +15 melee (2d6+13)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 18, Con 10, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +16, Intuit Direction +19, Listen +22, Move Silently +20, Spellcraft +19, Spot +22
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Flyby Attack, Improved Critical, Improved Initiative, Power Attack,

SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades ignore the effects of spells and spell-like abilities of 6th level or lower, just as if the spellcaster had failed to overcome spell resistance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Magic
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightshade can continuously detect magic as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer. It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: See Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightshade can continuously see invisibility as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer. It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Nightshades can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

SpecialAbility.Name: Damage Reduction
SpecialAbility.Text: All nightshades have damage reduction 25/+3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A nightwing can weaken magic armor, weapons, and shields by making a successful touch attack. The target item must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 20) or lose one "plus" (for example, a +2 sword becomes a +1 sword). An item that is completely drained becomes normal in all respects and loses any other powers (such as flame tongue) as well. Casting dispel evil upon the item reverses the effects of the magic drain, provided this occurs within a number of days after the attack equal to the caster's level.

StatsBlock.Name: Nine-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 9 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Nine-Headed Hydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 9 bites x1 +9 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

StatsBlock.Name: Nine-Headed Lernaean Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 9 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Nine-Headed Lernaean Pyrohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 9 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 9 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9
