SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Nixie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 7, Dex 16, Con 11, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +7, Bluff +8, Craft +5, Escape Artist +6, Listen +7, Perform +7, Search +3, Sense Motive +5, Spot +7, +10

Description.Skills: All sprites receive a +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. *Nixies receive a +5 racial bonus to Hide checks when in the water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a nixie can use water breathing as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer. (They usually bestow this effect on those they have charmed.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Charm Person
SpecialAbility.Text: A nixie can charm person three times per day as the spell cast by a 4th-level sorcerer. Those affected must succeed at a Will save (DC 15) or be charmed for 24 hours, performing heavy labor, guard duty, and other onerous tasks for the nixie community. Shortly before the effect wears off, the nixie escorts the charmed creature away and orders it to keep walking.

StatsBlock.Name: Noble Djinn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x2 +13/+8 melee (1d8+8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 19, Con 14, Int 14, Wis 15, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +9, Concentration +9, Craft +11, Escape Artist +11, Knowledge +9, Listen +9, Move Silently +9, Sense Motive +9, Spellcraft +9, Spot +9
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Some djinn (1% of the total population) are "noble" and can grant three wishes to any being (nongenies only) who captures them. Noble djinn perform no other services and, upon granting the third wish, are free of their servitude. Noble djinn are as strong as efreet (see below), with 10 HD.

SpecialAbility.Name: Air Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: Airborne creatures suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to attack and damage rolls against a djinni.

SpecialAbility.Name: Whirlwind
SpecialAbility.Text:
The djinni can transform itself into a whirlwind once every 10 minutes and remain in that form for up to 7 rounds. In this form, it can move through the air or along a surface at its fly speed. The whirlwind is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 30 feet wide at the top and up to 50 feet tall. The djinni controls the exact height, but it must be at least 10 feet. Medium-size or smaller creatures might take damage when caught in the whirlwind and be lifted into the air. An affected creature must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 20) when it comes into contact with the whirlwind or take 3d6 points of damage. It must also succeed at a second Reflex save or be picked up bodily and held suspended in the powerful winds, automatically taking 1d8 points of damage each round. A creature that can fly is allowed a Reflex save (DC 20) each round to escape the whirlwind. The creature still takes damage but can leave if the save is successful. The djinni can eject any carried creatures whenever it wishes, depositing them wherever the whirlwind happens to be.
If the whirlwind's base touches the ground, it creates a swirling cloud of debris. This cloud is centered on the djinni and has a diameter equal to half the whirlwind's height. The cloud obscures all vision, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. Creatures 5 feet away have one-half concealment, while those farther away have total concealment. Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check (DC 20) to cast a spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/round-invisibility (self only); 1/day-create food and water, create wine (as create water, but wine instead), major creation (created vegetable matter is permanent), persistent image, and wind walk. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). Once per day, a djinni can assume gaseous form (as the spell) for up to 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plane Shift
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can enter any of the elemental planes, the Astral Plane, or the Material Plane. This ability transports the genie and up to six other creatures, provided they all link hands with the genie. It is otherwise similar to the spell of the same name.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A genie can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Noble Salamander
StatsBlock.Attacks: +3 Huge longspear +23/+18/+13 m melee (2d8+9) or tail slap melee (2d8+3)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +3 Huge longspear +23/+18/+13 m x1 +17 melee (2d8+9) or tail slap x1 +15 melee (2d8+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Heat, Constrict 2d8+3 And 1d8 Fire, Spell-Like Abilities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 13, Con 16, Int 15, Wis 15, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +11, Craft +24, Diplomacy +13, Escape Artist +19, Hide +15, Listen +20, Move Silently +17, Search +20, Sense Motive +12, Spot +20
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Multiattack, Power Attack

Description.General: All noble salamanders speak Ignan and Common.
Description.Skills: Salamanders receive a +4 racial bonus to Craft (metalworking) skill checks.
Description.Feats: Salamanders have the Multiattack feat even without the requisite three natural weapons.
Description.Characters: Noble salamanders may be clerics, sorcerers, or fighters (their favored class).

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander generates so much heat that its mere touch deals additional fire damage. Salamanders' metallic weapons also conduct this heat.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A salamander deals automatic tail slap damage (including fire damage) with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. A noble salamander can constrict multiple creatures simultaneously, provided they are all at least two sizes smaller than it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 3/day-burning hands, fireball, flaming sphere, and wall of fire; 1/day-dispel magic and summon monster VII (huge fire elemental). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 15th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Nymph
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 16, Wis 17, Cha 19
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +10, Escape Artist +7, Heal +9, Hide +7, Listen +11, Move Silently +7, Sense Motive +9, Spot +11, +7

Description.General: Nymphs speak Sylvan and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blinding Beauty
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability operates continuously, affecting all humanoids within 60 feet of the nymph. Those who look directly at the nymph must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be blinded permanently as though by the blindness spell. The nymph can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Unearthly Beauty
SpecialAbility.Text: The nymph can evoke this ability once every 10 minutes. Those within 30 feet of the nymph who look directly at it must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or die.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Nymphs can use dimension door once per day as cast by a 7th-level sorcerer. They can also replicate druid spells as 7th-level casters (save DC 13+ spell level).

StatsBlock.Name: Ochre Jelly
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +4 melee (2d4+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Acid, Constrict 2d4+3 And 1d4 Acid
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 1, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Ooze
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: An ooze's entire body is a primitive sensory organ that can ascertain prey by scent and vibration within 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the ochre jelly must hit with its slam attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Acid
SpecialAbility.Text: An ochre jelly secretes a digestive acid that dissolves only flesh. Any melee hit deals acid damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: An ochre jelly deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check.

SpecialAbility.Name: Split
SpecialAbility.Text: Weapons and electricity attacks deal no damage to an ochre jelly. Instead the creature splits into two identical jellies, each with half the original's hit points (round down). A jelly with only 1 hit point cannot be further split.

StatsBlock.Name: Octopus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 arms x1 +2 melee (+1) or bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 3

Description.Skills: An octopus can change colors, giving it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the octopus must hit with its arms attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: An octopus can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 10 feet high by 10 feet wide by 10 feet long once a minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the octopus normally uses to escape a losing fight. Creatures within the cloud suffer the effects of total darkness.

SpecialAbility.Name: Jet
SpecialAbility.Text: An octopus can jet backward once a round as a double move action, at a speed of 200 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Octopus, Giant
StatsBlock.Attacks: 8 tentacle rakes melee (1d4+5) or bite melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 8 tentacle rakes x1 +10 melee (1d4+5) or bite x1 +5 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 3

Description.Skills: A giant octopus can change colors, giving it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant octopus must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with a tentacle rake attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant octopus deals 2d8+6 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant octopus can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 20 feet high by 20 feet wide by 20 feet long once a minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the octopus normally uses to escape a losing fight. Creatures within the cloud suffer the effects of total darkness.

SpecialAbility.Name: Jet
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant octopus can jet backward once a round as a double move action, at a speed of 200 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Ogre
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatclub x1 +7 melee (2d6+7)Huge longspear x1 +7 melee (2d6+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 8, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 7

Description.General: Ogres speak Giant, and those specimens who boast Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.

StatsBlock.Name: Ogre Mage
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatsword x1 +7 melee (2d8+7)Huge longbow x1 +7 melee (2d6+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 17

Description.General: Ogre mages speak Giant and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-darkness and invisibility; 1/day-charm person, cone of cold, gaseous form, polymorph self, and sleep. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 9th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Flight
SpecialAbility.Text: An ogre mage can cease or resume flight as a free action. While in gaseous form it can fly at normal speed and has perfect maneuverability.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Ogre mages take normal damage from fire and acid. An ogre mage that loses a limb or body part can reattach it by holding the severed member to the stump. Reattachment takes 1 minute. If the head or other vital organ is severed, it must be reattached within 10 minutes or the creature dies. Ogre mages cannot regrow lost body parts.

StatsBlock.Name: Ooze Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +9, Listen +6, Move Silently +6, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of caustic liquid, 10 feet, once every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by itching skin and burning eyes. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour an ooze mephit can hurl an acidic blob that functions like Melf's acid arrow cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). Once per day it can create a mass of smelly fog that duplicates the effect of stinking cloud as cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: An ooze mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is in a wet or muddy environment.

StatsBlock.Name: Orc
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Greataxe x1 +2 melee (1d12+3)javelin x1 +2 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 10, Con 11, Int 9, Wis 8, Cha 8

Description.Characters: An orc's favored class is barbarian. Orc clerics can choose two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, Strength, and War.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: Orcs suffer a -1 penalty to attack rolls in bright sunlight or within the radius of a daylight spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Osyluth (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (1d8+5) or 2 claws melee (1d4+2) or sting melee (3d4+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +8 melee (1d8+5) or 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d4+2) or sting x1 +3 melee (3d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Poison, Spell-Like Abilities, Fear Aura, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Baatezu Qualities, Know Alignment
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +8, Hide +3, Listen +11, Move Silently +8, Search +8, Sense Motive +10, Spot +12

Description.General: Osyluths speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will-animate dead, charm person, dimensional anchor, doom, fly, invisibility (self only), major image, suggestion, and wall of ice. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 7th-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level).
An osyluth can also teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only) at will as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: Osyluths can radiate a 5-foot-radius fear aura as a free action. Affected creatures must succeed at a Will save (DC 14) or be affected as though by a fear spell cast by a 7th-level sorcerer. A creature that successfully saves cannot be affected again by the same osyluth's aura for one day. Other baatezu are immune to the aura.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 14); initial damage 1d6 temporary Strength, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day an osyluth can attempt to summon 2d10 lemures with a 50% chance of success, or another osyluth with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Know Alignment
SpecialAbility.Text: Osyluths always know the alignment of any creature they look upon.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Otyugh
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 tentacle rakes melee (1d6) or bite melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 tentacle rakes x1 +2 melee (1d6) or bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.General: Otyughs speak Common.
Description.Skills: *An otyugh receives a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks when in its lair, due to its natural coloration.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the otyugh must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with a tentacle attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: An otyugh deals automatic tentacle damage to a Medium-size or smaller opponent with a successful grapple check.

SpecialAbility.Name: Disease
SpecialAbility.Text: Filth fever [bite, Fortitude save (DC 12), incubation period 1d3 days; damage 1d3 temporary Dexterity and 1d3 temporary Constitution.]

StatsBlock.Name: Owl
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Claws x1 melee (1d2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 4

Description.Skills: Owls receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen checks, and a +14 to Move Silently checks. *They receive a +8 racial bonus to Spot checks in dusk and darkness.

StatsBlock.Name: Owlbear
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +7 melee (1d6+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 19, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.General: A lair usually has 1d6 young, fetching a price of 3,000 gp each in many civilized areas. While owlbears cannot be domesticated, they can still be placed in strategically important areas as free-roaming guardians. A professional trainer charges 2,000 gp to rear or train an owlbear (DC 23 for a young creature, DC 30 for an adult).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the owlbear must hit with a claw attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Pegasus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +7 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 16, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Listen +12, Sense Motive +7, Spot +12, Wilderness Lore +3

Description.Combat: Pegasi attack with their sharp hooves and powerful bite. Mated pairs and herds attack as a team, fighting to the death to defend their eggs and young, which fetch a handsome price in many civilized areas.
Description.Skills: Pegasi receive a +4 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.
Description.Training:
Pegasus eggs are worth 2,000 gp each on the open market, while young are worth 3,000 gp per head. Pegasi mature at the same rate as horses. Professional trainers charge 1,000 gp to rear or train a pegasus, which serves its master with absolute faithfulness for life.
Training a pegasus requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 22 for a young creature, DC 29 for an adult) and that the creature be willing. Trainers can reduce the DC by 5 and the training time by half by using a magic bridle enchanted for the purpose. A pegasus can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a pegasus is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301-600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601-900 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Pegasi can detect good and detect evil at will within a 60-yard radius, as the spells cast by a 5th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Phantom Fungus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 10, Con 16, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 9

Description.Skills: Phantom fungus has a +5 racial bonus to Move Silently checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability is constant, allowing the phantom fungus to remain invisible even when attacking. This works just like improved invisibility cast by a 12th-level sorcerer, and lasts as long as the phantom fungus is alive. This ability is not subject to the invisibility purge spell. Once killed, a phantom fungus becomes visible after 1 minute.

StatsBlock.Name: Phase Spider
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +6 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 17, Con 16, Int 7, Wis 13, Cha 10

Description.Combat: Phase spiders dwell and hunt on the Material Plane. Once a spider locates prey, however, it shifts to the Ethereal Plane to attack, attempting to catch its victim flat-footed. The spider shifts in, bites its victim, and retreats quickly back to the Ethereal Plane.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ethereal Jaunt
SpecialAbility.Text: A phase spider can shift from the Ethereal to the Material Plane as a free action, and shift back again as a move-equivalent action (or during a move-equivalent action). The ability is otherwise identical with ethereal jaunt cast by a 15th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 15); initial and secondary damage 2d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Phasm
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +10 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Scent, Telepathy, Amorphous, Alternate Form, Tremorsense
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 16, Wis 15, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +15, Climb +7, Craft +7, Disguise +7, Knowledge +7, Listen +10, Spot +10, Wilderness Lore +6
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Mobility, Skill Focus, Improvedinitiative

Description.General: Phasms can speak Common but prefer telepathic communication.
Description.Combat: If pursued or harassed, a phasm transforms into the most fearsome creature it knows, such as an adult white dragon or a fire giant, and attacks. When seriously hurt, it changes to some fast or agile form and tries to escape.
Description.Skills: *When using alternate form, a phasm receives a +10 circumstance bonus to Disguise checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amorphous
SpecialAbility.Text: A phasm in its natural form is immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, stun, and polymorph. It is not subject to critical hits and, having no clear front or back, cannot be flanked.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: Phasms can assume the form of any corporeal creature or object from Diminutive to Large size as a standard action. This ability is otherwise similar to shapechange as cast by a 20th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Phasms can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: A phasm can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground, so long as it is touching the ground itself.

StatsBlock.Name: Pit Fiend (Baatezu)
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 claws melee (1d6+7) or 2 wings melee (1d4+3) or bite melee (2d6+1) or tail slap melee (2d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +18 melee (1d6+7) or 2 wings x1 +13 melee (1d4+3) or bite x1 +13 melee (2d6+1) or tail slap x1 +13 melee (2d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Spell-Like Abilities, Fear Aura, Constrict 2d4+10, Summon Baatezu
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Baatezu Qualities
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +17, Climb +20, Concentration +19, Disguise +17, Hide +4, Jump +19, Knowledge +20, Listen +21, Move Silently +17, Search +21, Spellcraft +21, Spot +21
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Initiative, Power Attack

Description.General: Pit fiends speak Infernal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: animate dead, blasphemy, charm person, create undead, desecrate, detect good, detect magic, dispel magic, fireball, hold person, improved invisibility, magic circle against good, major image, produce flame, polymorph self, pyrotechnics, suggestion, teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), unholy aura, unhallow, and wall of fire; 1/day-meteor swarm (any) and symbol (any). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 17th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).
Once per year a pit fiend can use wish as the spell cast by a 20th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fear Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, a pit fiend can create an aura of fear in a 20-foot radius. It is otherwise identical with fear cast by a 15th-level sorcerer (save DC 19). If the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by that pit fiend's fear aura for one day. Other baatezu are immune to the aura.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 21); initial damage 1d6 temporary Constitution, secondary damage death.

SpecialAbility.Name: Disease
SpecialAbility.Text: Even if an affected creature saves against the poison, it must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be infected with a vile disease called devil chills (incubation period 1d4 days, damage 1d4 points of temporary Strength).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the pit fiend must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with its tail slap attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A pit fiend deals 2d4+10 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Baatezu
SpecialAbility.Text: Twice per day a pit fiend can automatically summon two lemures, osyluths, or barbazu, or one erinyes, cornugon, or gelugon. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A baatezu that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Pit fiends take normal damage from holy and blessed weapons of at least +3 enchantment.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu are immune to fire and poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu have cold and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: See in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: All devils can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, even that created by deeper darkness spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Baatezu can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Pixie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Dagger x1 melee (1d4)composite shortbow x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 7, Dex 18, Con 11, Int 16, Wis 15, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +7, Concentration +4, Craft +7, Escape Artist +8, Heal +6, Hide +12, Listen +8, Ride +8, Search +9, Sense Motive +6, Spot +8, +8
StatsBlock.Feats: Dodge, Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus

Description.Skills: All sprites receive a +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Natural Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: A pixie remains invisible even when it attacks. This ability is constant, but the pixie can suppress or resume it as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
1/day-confusion (the pixie must touch the target), dancing lights, detect chaos, detect good, detect evil, detect law, detect thoughts, dispel magic, entangle, permanent image (visual and auditory elements only), and polymorph self. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).
One pixie in ten can use Otto's irresistible dance once per day as cast by an 8th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Special Arrows
SpecialAbility.Text:
Pixies sometimes employ arrows that deal no damage but can erase memory or put a creature to sleep.
  • Memory Loss: An opponent struck by the arrow must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or lose all memory. The subject retains skills, languages, and class abilities but forgets everything else until he or she receives a heal spell or memory restoration with limited wish, wish, or miracle.
  • Sleep: Any opponent struck by the arrow, regardless of Hit Dice, must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or be affected as though by a sleep spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Planetar
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +3 greatsword +23/+18/+13 mele x1 +18 melee (2d6+13)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistance (), Protective Aura, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 19, Con 20, Int 22, Wis 23, Cha 22
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +16, Escape Artist +20, Hide +17, Listen +23, Move Silently +17, Sense Motive +23, Search +19, Spot +23, +21
StatsBlock.Feats: Blind-Fight, Cleave, Improved Initiative, Power Attack

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: continual flame, dispel magic, holy smite, improved invisibility (self only), lesser restoration, remove curse, remove disease, remove fear, and speak with dead; 3/day-blade barrier, flame strike, and raise dead; 1/day-earthquake, greater restoration, shapechange, and symbol (any). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 17th-level sorcerer (save DC 16 + spell level).
The following abilities are always active on the planetar's person, as the spells cast by a 17th-level sorcerer: detect evil, detect snares and pits, discern lies, see invisibility, and true seeing. They can be dispelled, but the planetar can reactivate them as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Planetars can cast divine spells from the cleric list and from the Air, Destruction, Good, Law, and War domains as 17th-level clerics (save DC 16 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Protective Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, planetars can surround themselves with a nimbus of light having a radius of 20 feet. This acts as a double-strength magic circle against evil and as a minor globe of invulnerability, both as cast by a sorcerer whose level equal to the celestial's Hit Dice. The aura can be dispelled, but the celestial can create it again as a free action on its next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Planetars are immune to electricity, petrification, cold, and acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Pony
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +1 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

StatsBlock.Name: Pony, War
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 hooves x1 +2 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 4

Description.General: A warpony can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a warpony is up to 100 pounds; a medium load, 101-200 pounds; and a heavy load, 201-300 pounds. A warpony can drag 1,500 pounds.

StatsBlock.Name: Porpoise
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Butt x1 melee (2d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Skills: Porpoises gain a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. *These bonuses are lost if blindsight is negated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Porpoises can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the porpoise to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

StatsBlock.Name: Pseudodragon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +2 melee (1d3) or bite x1 melee ()
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Telepathy, Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, See Invisibility
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 11, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +16, Intuit Direction +3, Listen +5, Search +2, Spot +5

Description.General: A pseudodragon egg can fetch a price of up to 10,000 gp, and a hatchling as much as 20,000 gp.
Description.Skills: Pseudodragons have a chameleonlike ability that grants them a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks. *In forests or overgrown areas, this bonus improves to +8.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 12); initial damage sleep for 1 minute, secondary damage sleep for 1d3 days.

SpecialAbility.Name: See Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: Pseudodragons continuously see invisibility as the spell, with a range of 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Pseudodragons can communicate telepathically with creatures that speak Common or Sylvan, provided they are within 60 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Pseudodragons are immune to sleep and paralysis effects.

StatsBlock.Name: Pureblood
StatsBlock.Attacks: Masterwork scimitar melee (1d6)masterwork longbow with masterw melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Masterwork scimitar x2 +3 melee (1d6)masterwork longbow with masterw x2 +3 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 13, Con 11, Int 18, Wis 18, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Dodge, Expertise, Improved Initiative

Description.General: Yuan-ti speak their own language, plus Common, Draconic, and Abyssal.
Description.Skills: *Yuan-ti using chameleon power receive a +8 circumstance bonus to Hide checks.
Description.Characters: The favored class for yuan-ti purebloods is ranger. Yuan-ti clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Chaos, Evil, Destruction, and Plant.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: 1/day-animal trance, cause fear, deeper darkness, entangle, neutralize poison, suggestion, and polymorph other. These abilities are as the spells cast by an 8th-level sorcerer (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Psionics
SpecialAbility.Text:
All yuan-ti can produce the following effects at will:
  • Detect Poison: As the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer.
  • Alternate Form: The yuan-ti can assume the form of a Tiny to Large viper. This ability is similar to a shapchange spell cast by a 19th-level sorcerer but allows only viper forms. If the yuan-ti has a poisonous bite of its own, it uses its own or the viper's poison, whichever is more potent.
  • Chameleon Power: The yuan-ti can change the coloration of itself and its equipment to match its surroundings.
  • Produce Acid: The yuan-ti can exude acid from its body, dealing 1d6 points of damage to anything it touches. The acid becomes inert when it leaves the yuan-ti's body.
  • Aversion: The yuan-ti creates a compulsion effect targeting one creature within 30 feet. The subject must succeed at a Will save (DC 17) or gain an aversion to snakes for 10 minutes. Affected subjects must stay at least 20 feet from any snake or yuan-ti, alive or dead; if already within 20 feet, they move away. A subject can overcome the compulsion by succeeding at another DC 17 Will save, but still suffers deep anxiety. This causes a -4 reduction to Dexterity until the effect wears off or the subject is no longer within 20 feet of a snake or yuan-ti. This ability is otherwise similar to antipathy as cast by a 16th-level sorcerer.

StatsBlock.Name: Purple Worm
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 10 ft., Burrow 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 10 ft., Burrow 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +20 melee (2d8+12) or sting x1 +15 melee (2d6+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 35, Dex 6, Con 25, Int 1, Wis 8, Cha 8

Description.Combat: In battle, a purple worm forms into a coil 15 feet across, biting and stinging anything within reach.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the purple worm must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage and can attempt to swallow the foe.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A purple worm can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Large or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of crushing damage plus 1d8 points of acid damage per round from the worm's gizzard. A swallowed creature can climb out of the gizzard with a successful grapple check. This returns it to the worm's maw, where another successful grapple check is needed to get free. A swallowed creature can also cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. The worm's interior can hold two Large, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 24); initial damage 1d6 temporary Strength, secondary damage 2d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: A purple worm can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Quasit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3) or bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Poison ), Resistance (), Regeneration, Alternate Form
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +14, Listen +6, Move Silently +6, Search +4, Spellcraft +4, Spot +6

Description.General: Quasits speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-detect good, detect magic, and invisibility (self only); 1/day-cause fear (as the spell, except that its area is a 30-foot radius from the quasit). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 6th-level sorcerer (save DC 10 + spell level). Once per week a quasit can use commune to ask six questions (this is otherwise as the spell cast by a 12th-level cleric).

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Claw, Fortitude save (DC 13); initial damage 1d4 temporary Dexterity, secondary damage 2d4 temporary Dexterity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A quasit can assume other forms at will as a standard action. This ability functions as polymorph self cast by a 12th-level sorcerer, except that any individual quasit can assume only one or two forms no larger than Medium-size. Common forms include bat, monstrous centipede, toad, and wolf.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Quasits take normal damage from acid, and from holy and blessed weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Queen
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sting melee (2d4+4) or bite melee (2d6+2)javelin melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +19 melee (2d4+4) or bite x1 +14 melee (2d6+2)javelin x2 +19/+14 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Fast Healing, Telepathy, Spell Resistance, Resistances
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 20, Int 20, Wis 20, Cha 21
StatsBlock.Skills: Appraise +22, Bluff +28, Concentration +22, Diplomacy +28, Knowledge +28, Listen +30, Scry +28, Sense Motive +28, Spellcraft +28, Spot +30
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Quicken Spell, Spell Focus, Item Creation Feat

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: The queen casts arcane spells as a 17th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: calm emotions, charm monster, clairaudience/clairvoyance, detect chaos, detect thoughts, dictum, divination, hold monster, magic circle against chaos, order's wrath, shield of law, and true seeing. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 17th-level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: The queen can communicate telepathically with any intelligent creature within fifty miles whose presence she is aware of.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hive Mind
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians within 50 miles of their queen are in constant communication. If one is aware of a particular danger, they all are. If one in a group is not flat-footed, none of them are. No formian in a group is considered flanked unless all of them are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Formians have poison, petrification, and cold immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians have fire, electricity, and sonic resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Rakshasa
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +5 melee (1d4+1) or bite x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Spell ), Damage Reduction 20/+3, Alternate Form, Vulnerable Toblessed Crossbow Bolts
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 14, Con 16, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 17
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +16, Disguise +17, Listen +11, Move Silently +11, Perform +12, Sense Motive +10, Spot +12

Description.General: Rakshasas speak Common, Infernal, and Undercommon.
Description.Skills: A rakshasa receives a +4 racial bonus to Bluff and Disguise checks. *When using alternate form, it gains an additional +10 circumstance bonus to Disguise checks. If reading an opponent's mind, its circumstance bonus to Bluff and Disguise checks increases by a further +4.

SpecialAbility.Name: Detect Thoughts
SpecialAbility.Text: A rakshasa can continuously detect thoughts as the spell cast by an 18th-level sorcerer (save DC 15). It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: A rakshasa casts spells as a 7th-level sorcerer, and can also cast 1st-level cleric spells as arcane spells.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: A rakshasa can assume any humanoid form, or revert to its own form, as a standard action. This ability is similar to the alter self spell cast by an 18th-level sorcerer, but the rakshasa can remain in the new form indefinitely.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Rakshasas ignore the effects of spells and spell-like abilities of 8th level or less, just as if the spellcaster had failed to overcome spell resistance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vulnerable to Blessed Crossbow Bolts
SpecialAbility.Text: Any hit scored with a blessed crossbow bolt instantly slays a rakshasa.

StatsBlock.Name: Rast
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 claws x1 +6 melee (1d4+2)bite x1 +6 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Paralyzing Gaze, Blood Drain
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 12, Con 13, Int 3, Wis 13, Cha 12

Description.Combat: Rasts attack in swarms, with a frightening, brutal cunning. The creatures paralyze as many of their foes as possible, then attack any that are still moving. A rast can claw or bite, but cannot do both during the same round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralyzing Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Paralysis for 1d6 rounds, 30 feet, Fortitude save (DC 13).

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the rast must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blood Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A rast drains blood from a grabbed opponent, dealing 1 point of temporary Constitution damage each round it maintains the hold.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flight
SpecialAbility.Text: A rast can fly as the spell cast by an 11th-level sorcerer, as a free action. A rast that loses this ability falls and can perform only partial actions.

StatsBlock.Name: Rat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 2, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Rats receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Rat
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 4

SpecialAbility.Name: Disease
SpecialAbility.Text: Filth fever-bite, Fortitude save (DC 12), incubation period 1d3 days; damage 1d3 temporary Dexterity and 1d3 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Raven
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Claws x1 melee (1d2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 1, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

StatsBlock.Name: Ravid
StatsBlock.Attacks: Tail slap melee (1d6+1) or claw melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Tail slap x1 +1 melee (1d6+1) or claw x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 7, Wis 12, Cha 14

Description.Combat: Ravids fight only in self-defense. A ravid itself is not very powerful but is always accompanied by at least one animated object that defends it.
Description.Feats: *Ravids have the Multiattack feat even through they do not have the requisite three natural weapons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Positive Energy Lash
SpecialAbility.Text: A ravid can make a touch attack or hit with a claw or tail slap attack to infuse a target with positive energy. The energy produces an unpleasant tingle in living creatures, and against undead foes (even incorporeal ones) it deals 2d10 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Animate Objects
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per round, a random object within 20 feet of the ravid animates as though by the spell animate objects cast by a 20th-level cleric. These objects defend the ravid to the best of their ability, but the ravid isn't intelligent enough to give them specific commands.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flight
SpecialAbility.Text: A ravid can fly as the spell cast by an 11th-level sorcerer, as a free action. A ravid that loses this ability falls and can perform only partial actions.

StatsBlock.Name: Red Slaad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (2d8+4) or 2 claws x1 +5 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Pounce, Implant, Stunning Croak, Summon Slaad
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 6, Cha 8
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +14, Jump +14, Listen +6, Move Silently +5, Spot +8

Description.Characters: Slaadi rarely have the focus to devote themselves to a character class.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a red slaad leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Implant
SpecialAbility.Text: A red slaad that hits with a claw attack can inject an egg pellet into the opponent's body. The affected creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) to avoid implantation. Often the slaad implants an unconscious or otherwise helpless creature (which gets no saving throw). The egg gestates for one week before hatching into a blue slaad that eats its way out, killing the host. Twenty-four hours before the egg fully matures, the victim falls extremely ill (-10 to all ability scores). A remove disease spell rids a victim of the pellet, as does a successful Heal check (DC 20) by someone with that skill. If the check fails, the healer can try again, but each attempt (successful or not) deals 1d4 points of damage to the patient. If the host is an arcane spellcaster, the egg pellet instead hatches into a green slaad.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stunning Croak
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a red slaad can emit a loud croak. Every creature within 20 feet must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 16) or be stunned for 1d3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Slaad
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a red slaad can attempt to summon another red slaad with a 40% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A slaad that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All slaadi have acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic resistance 5.

StatsBlock.Name: Remorhaz
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +10 melee (2d8+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.Combat: Remorhazes hide under the snow and ice until they hear movement above them, then attack from below and surprise prey.
Description.Skills: Remorhazes receive a +4 racial bonus to Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the remorhaz must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage and can attempt to swallow the opponent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A remorhaz can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Large or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of crushing damage plus 10d10 points of fire damage per round from the creature's blazing gut. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the remorhaz's gut (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. The remorhaz's interior can hold two Large, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: An enraged remorhaz generates heat so intense that anything touching its body takes 10d10 points of fire damage. This is usually enough to melt nonmagical weapons, but magic weapons get a Fortitude save (DC 18).

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: A remorhaz can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Retriever
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 claws x1 +11 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Eye Rays +6 Ranged Touch, Find Target
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 1

Description.General: Retrievers speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Eye Rays
SpecialAbility.Text:
A retriever's eyes can produce four different magical rays with a range of 100 feet. Each round, it can fire two rays, but an individual ray is usable only once every 6 rounds. It cannot fire rays in the same round as it makes physical attacks. Each effect follows the rules for a ray. Save DC is 16. The four eye effects are:
  • Fire: Deals 12d6 fire damage to the target and to all those within 5 feet (those nearby are allowed Reflex saves to halve the damage).
  • Cold: Deals 12d6 cold damage to the target.
  • Electricity: Deals 12d6 electricity damage to the target.
  • Petrification: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or turn to stone permanently.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the retriever must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it holds the opponent fast in its mouth. This is how it usually "retrieves" things.

SpecialAbility.Name: Find Target
SpecialAbility.Text: When ordered to find an item or being, a retriever does so unerringly, as though guided by discern location.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text:
Blessed and holy weapons deal normal damage to retrievers.
A retriever that loses a limb or body part can reattach it by holding the severed member to the stump. Reattachment takes 1 minute. A retriever regrows lost body parts in one day (lost parts become inert).

StatsBlock.Name: Rhinoceros
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +13 melee (2d6+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 2

StatsBlock.Name: Roc
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +20 melee (2d6+12) or bite x1 +15 melee (2d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 34, Dex 15, Con 24, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.Combat: A roc attacks from the air, swooping earthward to snatch prey in its powerful talons and carry it off for itself and its young to devour. A solitary roc is typically hunting and will attack any Medium-size or larger creature that appears edible. A mated pair of rocs attack in concert, fighting to the death to defend their nests or hatchlings.
Description.Skills: *Rocs receive a +4 racial bonus to Spot checks during daylight hours.

SpecialAbility.Name: Snatch
SpecialAbility.Text: A roc that hits a creature of at least Small size, but no larger than Huge, with a claw attack attempts to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If the roc achieves a hold, it can fly off with its prey and automatically make a bite attack each round in lieu of a claw attack. It can drop a snatched creature as a free action or use a standard action to fling it aside. A flung creature travels 90 feet and takes 9d6 points of damage. If the roc flings it while flying, the creature suffers this amount of damage or falling damage, whichever is greater.

StatsBlock.Name: Rock Gnome
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Short sword x1 melee (1d6)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11

Description.General: Gnomes speak their own language, Gnome. Most gnomes who travel outside gnome lands (as traders, tinkers, or adventurers) know Common, while warriors in gnome settlements usually learn Goblin or Kobold.
Description.Combat: Gnomes make heavy use of illusion magic and carefully prepared ambushes and traps whenever they can.
Description.Skills: Gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks, for their keen hearing, and to Alchemy checks, because their sensitive noses allow them to monitor alchemical processes by smell.
Description.Characters: A gnome's favored class is illusionist.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Gnomes with Intelligence scores of 10 or higher may cast dancing lights, ghost sound, and prestidigitation, each once per day as a 1st-level wizard (spell failure penalties for armor apply).

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Animals
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a gnome can use speak with animals as a 1st-level druid to communicate with a burrowing mammal (badger, fox, rabbit, etc.).

SpecialAbility.Name: Gnome Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Gnomes benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Gnomes gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • Low-light Vision. Gnomes can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, and similar conditions of poor illumination.
  • +2 racial bonus to saving throws against illusions.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against kobolds and goblinoids.
  • +4 dodge bonus against giants.

StatsBlock.Name: Roper
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 6 strands x1 +11 melee (+4) or bite x1 +6 melee (2d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 12, Wis 16, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Weapon Focus

Description.Combat: A roper hunts by standing very still and imitating a bit of rock. This usually allows it to attack with surprise. When it notices prey, it lashes out with its strands and bites adjacent opponents with its powerful maw.
Description.Skills: *Ropers receive a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks in stony or icy areas.

SpecialAbility.Name: Strands
SpecialAbility.Text: Most encounters with a roper begin when it fires its strong, sticky strands. The creature has six such members that can strike up to 50 feet away (no range increment). A single attack with a slashing weapon that deals at least 10 points of damage severs a strand (AC 20).

SpecialAbility.Name: Attach
SpecialAbility.Text: If a roper hits with a strand attack, the strand latches onto the opponent's body. This deals no damage but draws the stuck opponent 10 feet closer each subsequent round (no attack of opportunity) unless that creature breaks free, which requires a successful Escape Artist check (DC 23) or Strength check (DC 19). The roper can draw in a creature within 10 feet of itself and bite with a +4 attack bonus, in that round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Weakness
SpecialAbility.Text: A roper's strands can sap an opponent's strength. Anyone caught by a strand must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 18) or take 2d8 points of temporary Strength damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: A roper takes double damage from fire attacks unless a save is allowed for half damage. A successful save halves the damage and a failure doubles it.

StatsBlock.Name: Rust Monster
StatsBlock.Attacks: Antennae touch melee () or bite melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Antennae touch x1 +3 melee () or bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 8

Description.Combat:
A rust monster can scent a metal object up to 90 feet away, dashing toward the source and attempting to strike it with its antennae. The creature is relentless, chasing adventurers over long distances if they still possess intact metal objects but usually ceasing its attacks to devour a freshly rusted meal. A clever (or desperate) adventurer can often distract a hungry rust monster by tossing it some metal objects, then fleeing while it consumes them.
The creature targets the largest metal object available, striking first at armor, then shields and smaller items. It prefers ferrous metals (steel or iron) over precious metals (such as gold or silver) but will devour the latter if given the opportunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rust
SpecialAbility.Text: A rust monster that makes a successful touch attack with its antennae causes the target metal to corrode, falling to pieces and becoming useless immediately. The size of the object is immaterial-a full suit of armor rusts away as quickly as a sword. Magic armor and weapons, and other enchanted items made of metal, must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 20) or be dissolved. A metal weapon that deals damage to a rust monster also corrodes immediately. Wooden, stone, and other nonmetallic weapons are unaffected.

StatsBlock.Name: Sahuagin
StatsBlock.Attacks: Trident melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes melee (1d4+2) or 2 claws melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Trident x1 +2 melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes x1 melee (1d4+2) or 2 claws x1 melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow x1 +2 melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Speak With Sharks, Underwater Sense, Lightblindness, Amphibious, Freshwater Sensitivity
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 13, Cha 9
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +2, Hide +6, Listen +7, Profession +2, Spot +7, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.Combat:
Sahuagin are savage fighters, asking for and giving no quarter. When swimming, a sahuagin rakes with its feet as it strikes with its claws or a weapon. About half of any group of sahuagin are also armed with nets.
Blood Frenzy: Once per day a sahuagin that takes damage in combat can fly into a frenzy the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +2 Constitution and +2 Strength, and suffers a -2 AC penalty. The sahuagin cannot end its frenzy voluntarily.
Description.Skills: Sahuagin receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks. *Underwater, the bonus improves to +8. They receive a +8 bonus to Wilderness Lore and Profession (hunt) checks within fifty miles of their homes.
Description.Characters: A male sahuagin's favored class is ranger. Female sahuagin favor the cleric class. Sahuagin clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Strength, and War.

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Sharks
SpecialAbility.Text: Sahuagin can communicate telepathically with sharks up to 150 feet away. The communication is limited to fairly simple concepts such as "food," "danger," and "enemy." Sahuagin can use Animal Empathy to befriend and train sharks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Sense
SpecialAbility.Text: A sahuagin can locate creatures underwater within a 30-foot radius. This ability negates the effects of invisibility and poor visibility. It is less effective against creatures without central nervous systems, such as undead, oozes, and constructs; a sahuagin can locate such creatures only within a 15-foot radius. Sahuagin are not fooled by figments when underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Blindness
SpecialAbility.Text: Abrupt exposure to bright light (such as sunlight or a daylight spell) blinds sahuagin for 1 round. In addition to temporary blindness, they suffer a -1 morale penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks while operating in bright light.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Text: Sahuagin can survive out of the water for 1 hour per 2 points of Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freshwater Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: A sahuagin fully immersed in freshwater must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or leave the water immediately. If the sahuagin fails and cannot escape, it suffers a -4 morale penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks. Even on a success, it must repeat the save attempt every 10 minutes it remains immersed.

StatsBlock.Name: Sahuagin Mutant
StatsBlock.Attacks: Trident melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes melee (1d4+2) or 4 claws melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Trident x1 +2 melee (1d8+2) or 2 rakes x1 melee (1d4+2) or 4 claws x1 melee (1d2) or Unknown (1d4)heavy crossbow x1 +2 melee (1d10+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Speak With Sharks, Underwater Sense, Lightblindness, Amphibious, Freshwater Sensitivity
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 13, Cha 9
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +2, Hide +6, Listen +7, Profession +2, Spot +7, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.General: About one in two hundred sahuagin has four arms.
Description.Combat:
Sahuagin mutants are savage fighters like regular sahuagin. When swimming, a sahuagin rakes with its feet as it strikes with its four claws or uses extra weapons.
Blood Frenzy: Once per day a sahuagin that takes damage in combat can fly into a frenzy the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +2 Constitution and +2 Strength, and suffers a -2 AC penalty. The sahuagin cannot end its frenzy voluntarily.
Description.Skills: Sahuagin receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks. *Underwater, the bonus improves to +8. They receive a +8 bonus to Wilderness Lore and Profession (hunt) checks within fifty miles of their homes.
Description.Characters: A male sahuagin's favored class is ranger. Female sahuagin favor the cleric class. Sahuagin clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Strength, and War.

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Sharks
SpecialAbility.Text: Sahuagin can communicate telepathically with sharks up to 150 feet away. The communication is limited to fairly simple concepts such as "food," "danger," and "enemy." Sahuagin can use Animal Empathy to befriend and train sharks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Sense
SpecialAbility.Text: A sahuagin can locate creatures underwater within a 30-foot radius. This ability negates the effects of invisibility and poor visibility. It is less effective against creatures without central nervous systems, such as undead, oozes, and constructs; a sahuagin can locate such creatures only within a 15-foot radius. Sahuagin are not fooled by figments when underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Blindness
SpecialAbility.Text: Abrupt exposure to bright light (such as sunlight or a daylight spell) blinds sahuagin for 1 round. In addition to temporary blindness, they suffer a -1 morale penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks while operating in bright light.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Text: Sahuagin can survive out of the water for 1 hour per 2 points of Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freshwater Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Text: A sahuagin fully immersed in freshwater must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 15) or leave the water immediately. If the sahuagin fails and cannot escape, it suffers a -4 morale penalty to all attack rolls, saves, and checks. Even on a success, it must repeat the save attempt every 10 minutes it remains immersed.

StatsBlock.Name: Salt Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +4 melee (1d3+3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 8, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +8, Listen +6, Move Silently +5, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of salt crystals, 10 feet, every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by itching skin and burning eyes. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour a salt mephit can use glitterdust as the spell cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). Once per day it can draw the moisture from an area in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Living creatures within range take 2d8 points of damage (Fortitude half DC 15). This is especially devastating to aquatic creatures and plants, which receive a -2 racial penalty to their saving throws.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A salt mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is in an arid environment.

StatsBlock.Name: Satyr
StatsBlock.Attacks: Gore melee (1d6) or dagger melee (1d4)shortbow melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +2 melee (1d6) or dagger x1 melee (1d4)shortbow x1 +2 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +9, Hide +13, Listen +15, Move Silently +13, Perform +9, Spot +15

Description.Combat: Once engaged in battle, an unarmed satyr attacks with a powerful head butt. A satyr expecting trouble is likely to be armed with a bow and a dagger and typically looses arrows from hiding, weakening an enemy before closing.
Description.Skills: Satyrs receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, Move Silently, Perform, and Spot checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Satyr, with pipes
StatsBlock.Attacks: Gore melee (1d6) or dagger melee (1d4)shortbow melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +2 melee (1d6) or dagger x1 melee (1d4)shortbow x1 +2 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 13
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +9, Hide +13, Listen +15, Move Silently +13, Perform +9, Spot +15

Description.Combat: Once engaged in battle, an unarmed satyr attacks with a powerful head butt. A satyr expecting trouble is likely to be armed with a bow and a dagger and typically looses arrows from hiding, weakening an enemy before closing.
Description.Skills: Satyrs receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, Move Silently, Perform, and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pipes
SpecialAbility.Text: Satyrs can play a variety of magical tunes on their pan pipes. Usually, only one satyr in a group carries pipes. When it plays, all creatures within a 60-foot spread (except satyrs) must succeed at a Will save (DC 14) or be affected by charm person, sleep, or fear, as the spells cast by a 10th-level sorcerer (the satyr chooses the tune and its effect). In the hands of other beings, these pipes have no special powers. A creature that successfully saves against any of the pipe's effects cannot be affected by the same set of pipes again for one day. A satyr often uses its pipes to charm and seduce especially comely women or to put a party of adventurers to sleep and then steal their valuables.

StatsBlock.Name: Scrag
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d6+6) or bite x1 +3 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 14, Con 23, Int 6, Wis 9, Cha 6

Description.General: Scrags speak Giant.
Description.Combat: Scrags have no fear of death: They launch themselves into combat without hesitation, flailing wildly at the closest opponent. Even when confronted with fire, they try to get around the flames and attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: If a scrag hits with both claw attacks, it latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This attack automatically deals an additional 2d6+9 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: A scrag regenerates only if mostly immersed in water. Fire and acid deal normal damage to a scrag. If a scrag loses a limb or body part, the lost portion regrows in 3d6 minutes. The creature can reattach the severed member instantly by holding it to the stump.

StatsBlock.Name: Sea Hag
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d4+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 10

Description.General: Sea hags speak Giant and Common.

SpecialAbility.Name: Horrific Appearance
SpecialAbility.Text: The sight of a sea hag is so revolting that anyone who sets eyes upon one must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 11) or instantly be weakened, taking 2d8 points of temporary Strength damage. This cannot reduce a victim to a negative Strength score, but anyone reduced to Strength 0 is helpless. Creatures who successfully save cannot be affected again by the same hag's horrific appearance for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Evil Eye
SpecialAbility.Text: Three times per day a sea hag can cast its dire gaze upon any single creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 11). Creatures who fail have a 25% chance of dying instantly from fright; even if they survive, they fall into a whimpering catatonia for three days, although remove curse or dispel evil can restore sanity sooner.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: Sea hags can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use their abilities while submerged.

StatsBlock.Name: Sea Lion
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +6 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +1 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 17, Int 4, Wis 13, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: A sea lion that hits with both claw attacks latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This automatically deals an additional 2d6+6 points of damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Seven-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 7 bites x1 +6 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Seven-Headed Hydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 7 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

StatsBlock.Name: Seven-Headed Lernaean Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 7 bites x1 +6 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 7 bites x1 +6 melee (1d10+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9
