SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Shadow
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Incorporeal touch x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 13

SpecialAbility.Name: Strength Damage
SpecialAbility.Text: The touch of a shadow deals 1d6 points of temporary Strength damage to a living foe. A creature reduced to Strength 0 by a shadow dies.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: Any humanoid reduced to Strength 0 by a shadow becomes a shadow under the control of its killer within 1d4 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Incorporeal
SpecialAbility.Text: Can be harmed only by other incorporeal creatures, +1 or better magic weapons, or magic, with a 50% chance to ignore any damage from a corporeal source. Can pass through solid objects at will, and own attacks pass through armor. Always moves silently.

StatsBlock.Name: Shadow Mastiff
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 4, Wis 12, Cha 13

Description.Skills: A shadow mastiff receives a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Bay
SpecialAbility.Text: When a shadow mastiff howls or barks, all creatures except evil outsiders within a 300-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 13) or become panicked for 2d4 rounds. This is a sonic, mind-affecting fear effect. Whether or not the save is successful, an affected creature is immune to that mastiff's bay for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A shadow mastiff that hits with its bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the shadow mastiff.

SpecialAbility.Name: Shadow Blend
SpecialAbility.Text: During any conditions other than full daylight, a shadow mastiff can disappear into the shadows, giving it nine-tenths concealment. Artificial illumination, even a light or continual flame spell, does not negate this ability. A daylight spell, however, will.

StatsBlock.Name: Shambling Mound
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +10 melee (2d6+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 17, Int 7, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Skills: Shamblers receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Move Silently checks. *They receive a +12 bonus to Hide checks when in a swampy or forested area.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the shambler must hit an opponent of up to Large size with both arm attacks. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A shambler deals 2d6+7 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Large or smaller creatures. The shambler can still move but cannot take any attack actions when constricting.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Electricity Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: Shamblers take no damage from electricity. Instead, any electrical attack (such as shocking grasp or lightning bolt) used against a shambler grants it 1d4 points of temporary Constitution. The shambler loses these points at the rate of 1 per hour.

StatsBlock.Name: Shark
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +16 melee (2d6+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the dire shark must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can try to swallow the foe.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire shark can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Large or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d6+6 points of crushing damage plus 1d8+4 points of acid damage per round from the shark's digestive juices. A swallowed creature can cut its way out using claws or a light slashing weapon by dealing 25 points of damage to the shark's digestive tract (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. The shark's gullet can hold two Large, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Scent
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire shark can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot radius and detect blood in the water at ranges of up to a mile.

StatsBlock.Name: Shark, Huge
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +9 melee (2d6+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Scent
SpecialAbility.Text: A shark can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot radius and detect blood in the water at ranges of up to a mile.

StatsBlock.Name: Shark, Large
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +5 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Scent
SpecialAbility.Text: A shark can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot radius and detect blood in the water at ranges of up to a mile.

StatsBlock.Name: Shark, Medium-Size
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Scent
SpecialAbility.Text: A shark can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot radius and detect blood in the water at ranges of up to a mile.

StatsBlock.Name: Shield Guardian
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x3 +14/+9/+4 melee (1d8+9)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Construct, Fast Healing, Shield Other, Guard, Find Master
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

Description.General: A shield guardian when fashioned is keyed to a particular amulet. Henceforth, it regards the wearer of that amulet to be its master, protecting and following that person everywhere (unless specifically commanded not to do so).
Description.Construction: A shield guardian costs 100,000 gp to create. This cost includes the construct's physical body, the keyed amulet, and all the materials and spell components that are consumed or become a permanent part of them. This cost includes 1,000 gp for the body and 500 gp for the amulet. Creating the body requires a successful Profession (engineering) or Craft (sculpture) check (DC 16). The second requirement is creating the keyed amulet from bronze, which requires a successful Craft (metalworking) check (DC 12). After the body and amulet are fashioned, the creature must be animated through an extended magical ritual that requires a week to complete. Understanding the ritual requires a 12th-level character with the Craft Wondrous Item feat. The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom. The chamber is similar to both an alchemist's laboratory and a smithy and costs 1,000 gp to establish. When not working on the ritual, the character must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If personally constructing the creature's body, the creator can perform the building and ritual together. If the creator misses a day of the ritual, the process fails and must be started again. Money spent is lost, but XP spent are not. The shield guardian's body can be reused, as can the chamber. Completing the ritual drains 2,000 XP from the creator and requires limited wish, locate object, make whole, shield, and shield other, which must be cast on the final day of the ritual. The creator must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls. Amulet If the keyed amulet is destroyed, the guardian ceases to function until a new one is created. If the wearer dies but the amulet is intact, the shield guardian carries out the last command given.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Storing
SpecialAbility.Text: The shield guardian can store one spell of 4th level or lower that is cast into it by another creature. It "casts" this spell when commanded or when a predetermined situation arises. Once this is used, it can store another spell (or the same spell).

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Shield Other
SpecialAbility.Text: The wearer of the keyed amulet can activate this defensive ability if within 100 feet of the shield guardian. Just as the spell of the same name, this transfers to the guardian half the damage that would be dealt to the amulet wearer (this ability does not provide the spell's AC or save bonuses, but see below).

SpecialAbility.Name: Guard
SpecialAbility.Text: The shield guardian moves swiftly to defend the amulet wearer by its side, blocking blows and disrupting foes. All attacks against the amulet wearer suffer a -2 deflection penalty.

SpecialAbility.Name: Find Master
SpecialAbility.Text: No matter the distance, as long as they are on the same plane, the shield guardian can find the amulet wearer (or just the amulet, if it is removed after the guardian is called).

StatsBlock.Name: Shocker Lizard
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 40 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 40 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 13, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Combat: A shocker lizard relies on its electrical abilities in combat. A lizard tends to bite only after its shock has rendered an opponent unconscious or when the shock seems to have no effect at all. Lone lizards flee once they deliver their shocks, but if others are nearby, they all home in on their comrade's discharges and administer deadly shocks to the foe.
Description.Skills: Shocker lizards receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks due to their coloration.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stunning Shock
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per round, a shocker lizard can deliver an electrical shock to a single opponent within 5 feet. This attack deals 2d8 points of subdual damage to living opponents (Reflex half DC 12).

SpecialAbility.Name: Lethal Shock
SpecialAbility.Text: Whenever two or more shocker lizards are within 25 feet of each other, they can work together to create a lethal shock. This effect has a radius of 25 feet, centered on any one contributing lizard. The shock deals 2d8 points of damage for each lizard contributing to it (Reflex half DC 10 + number of lizards contributing).

SpecialAbility.Name: Electricity Sense
SpecialAbility.Text: Shocker lizards automatically detect any electrical discharges within 100 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Shrieker
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sting melee (2d4+4) or bite melee (2d6+2)javelin melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 melee (2d4+4) or bite x1 melee (2d6+2)javelin x2 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 2, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Shriek
SpecialAbility.Text: Movement or a light source within 10 feet of a shrieker causes the fungus to emit a piercing sound that lasts for 1d3 rounds. The sound attracts nearby creatures that are disposed to investigate it. Some creatures that live near shriekers learn that the fungus's noise means there is food nearby.

StatsBlock.Name: Six-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 6 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

StatsBlock.Name: Six-Headed Pyrohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 6 bites x1 +5 melee (1d10+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These reddish hydras can breathe jets of fire 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Skum
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws melee (1d4+2) or 2 rakes melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +4 melee (2d6+4) or 2 claws x1 melee (1d4+2) or 2 rakes x1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +9, Hide +6, Listen +7, Move Silently +3, Spot +7

Description.General: Skum can breathe both air and water. They speak Aquan.
Description.Combat: In the water, skum are dangerous enemies who attack by biting, clawing, and raking with their rear legs. On land they are less dangerous, for they cannot rake and suffer a -2 circumstance penalty to all attack rolls. Skum serving an aboleth are sometimes trained to fight with weapons, usually two-handed melee weapons with reach (such as longspears) and simple ranged weapons such as javelins, tridents, or slings.
Description.Skills: *Skum receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks underwater.

StatsBlock.Name: Small Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Small Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Small Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 11, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Constrictor
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d3+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the constrictor snake must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A constrictor snake deals 1d3+4 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures.

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Giant Constrictor
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +11 melee (1d8+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the constrictor snake must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant constrictor snake deals 1d8+10 points of damage with a successful grapple check against Large size or smaller creatures.

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Huge Viper
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 19, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11 for all sizes Large and smaller, DC 13 for a Huge viper); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Large Viper
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11 for all sizes Large and smaller, DC 13 for a Huge viper); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Medium-Size Viper
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11 for all sizes Large and smaller, DC 13 for a Huge viper); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Snake, Small Viper
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 20 ft., Swim 20 ft., Climb 20 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11 for all sizes Large and smaller, DC 13 for a Huge viper); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Speed: Run 15 ft., Swim 15 ft., Climb 15 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 15 ft., Swim 15 ft., Climb 15 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee ()
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

Description.Skills: Snakes receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide, Listen, and Spot checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They can use either their Strength or Dexterity modifier for Climb checks, whichever is better.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 11 for all sizes Large and smaller, DC 13 for a Huge viper); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Solar
StatsBlock.Attacks: +5 dancing, vorpal greatsword +3 melee (+9) or Unknown (2d6+18)+2 mighty composite longbow (+5) melee (1d8+7)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +5 dancing, vorpal greatsword +3 x1 +28 melee (+9) or Unknown (2d6+18)+2 mighty composite longbow (+5) x1 +28 melee (1d8+7)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Regeneration, Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistance (), Protective Aura, Poison Saves, Tongues, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 20, Con 20, Int 23, Wis 25, Cha 25
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +16, Escape Artist +30, Hide +26, Listen +32, Move Silently +30, Search +30, Sense Motive +32, Spellcraft +19, Spot +32, +28
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Dodge, Great Cleave, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Power Attack

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text:
At will: aid, animate objects, commune, continual flame, dimensional anchor, greater dispelling, holy smite, imprisonment, improved invisibility (self only), lesser restoration, remove curse, remove disease, remove fear, resist elements, summon monster VII, and speak with dead; 3/day-blade barrier, earthquake, heal, permanency, resurrection, and shapechange; 1/day-greater restoration, mass charm, power word blind, power word kill, power word stun, prismatic spray, symbol (any), and wish. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer (save DC 17 + spell level).
The following abilities are always active on the solar's person, as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer: detect evil, detect snares and pits, discern lies, see invisibility, and true seeing. They can be dispelled, but the solar can reactivate them as a free action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Solars can cast divine spells from the cleric list and from the Air, Destruction, Good, Law, and War domains as 20th-level clerics (save DC 17 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Protective Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: As a free action, solars can surround themselves with a nimbus of light having a radius of 20 feet. This acts as a double-strength magic circle against evil and as a minor globe of invulnerability, both as cast by a sorcerer whose level equal to the celestial's Hit Dice. The aura can be dispelled, but the celestial can create it again as a free action on its next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Solars are immune to electricity, petrification, cold, and acid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Spectre
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Incorporeal touch x1 +2 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Undead, Turn Resistance, Incorporeal, Unnatural Aura, Sunlight Powerlessness
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 16, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +13, Intimidate +12, Intuit Direction +10, Listen +13, Search +10, Spot +13

Description.Combat: In close combat a spectre attacks with its numbing, life-draining touch. It makes full use of its incorporeal nature, moving through walls, ceilings, and floors as it attacks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures hit by a spectre's incorporeal touch attack receive two negative levels. The Fortitude save to remove a negative level has a DC of 15.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: Any humanoid slain by a spectre becomes a spectre in 1d4 rounds. Spawn are under the command of the spectre that created them and remain enslaved until its death. They do not possess any of the abilities they had in life.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Incorporeal
SpecialAbility.Text: Can be harmed only by other incorporeal creatures, +1 or better magic weapons, or magic, with a 50% chance to ignore any damage from a corporeal source. Can pass through solid objects at will, and own attacks pass through armor. Always moves silently.

SpecialAbility.Name: Unnatural Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: Both wild and domesticated animals can sense the unnatural presence of a spectre at a distance of 30 feet. They do not willingly approach nearer than that and panic if forced to do so; they remain panicked as long as they are within that range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sunlight Powerlessness
SpecialAbility.Text: Spectres are utterly powerless in natural sunlight (not merely a daylight spell) and flee from it. A spectre caught in sunlight cannot attack and can take only partial actions.

StatsBlock.Name: Spider Eater
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +7 melee (1d8+5) or bite x1 +2 melee (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 13, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

Description.Combat: A spider eater attacks with its venomous sting and powerful mandibles. Its usual tactic is to deliver a sting, then back off, hovering out of reach until the venom takes effect. Spider eaters do not like to give up their prey, and foes who harry them with spells or ranged attacks provoke a determined counterattack.
Description.Skills: Spider eaters receive a +4 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.
Description.Training:
Training a spider eater as an aerial mount requires a successful Handle Animal check (DC 24 for a young creature, or DC 29 for an adult). A spider eater matures in six months.
Spider eater eggs are worth 2,000 gp apiece on the open market, while young are worth 3,000 gp each. Professional trainers charge 3,000 gp to rear or train a spider eater. Riding a trained spider eater requires an exotic saddle. A spider eater can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also attack unless he or she succeeds at a Ride check.
Description.Carrying: A light load for a spider eater is up to 612 pounds; a medium load, 613-1,224 pounds; and a heavy load, 1,225-1,840 pounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 17); initial damage none, secondary damage paralysis for 1d8+5 weeks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Implant
SpecialAbility.Text: Female spider eaters lay their eggs inside paralyzed creatures of Huge or larger size. The young emerge about six weeks later, literally devouring the host from inside.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freedom of Movement
SpecialAbility.Text: Spider eaters have freedom of movement as though from the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer. The effect can be dispelled, but the spider eater can create it again the next round as a free action. When the spider eater serves as a mount, this effect does not extend to its rider.

StatsBlock.Name: Spirit Naga
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +9 melee (2d6+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 18, Int 12, Wis 17, Cha 17

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 18); initial and secondary damage 1d8 temporary Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charming Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: As charm person, 30 feet, Will save (DC 17).

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Spirit nagas cast spells as 7th-level sorcerers, and can also cast cleric spells and spells from the domains of Chaos and Evil as arcane spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Squid
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 arms x1 +2 melee (+2) or bite x1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the squid must hit with its arms attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage each round the hold is maintained.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: A squid can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 10 feet high by 10 feet wide by 10 feet long once a minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the squid normally uses to escape a losing fight. Creatures within the cloud suffer the effects of total darkness.

SpecialAbility.Name: Jet
SpecialAbility.Text: A squid can jet backward once a round as a double move action, at a speed of 240 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Squid, Giant
StatsBlock.Attacks: 10 tentacle rakes melee (1d6+8) or bite melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 tentacle rakes x1 +15 melee (1d6+8) or bite x1 +10 melee (2d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the giant squid must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with a tentacle rake attack. If it gets a hold, it can constrict.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant squid deals automatic tentacle rake damage with a successful grapple check against Medium-size or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Cloud
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant squid can emit a cloud of jet-black ink 20 feet high by 20 feet wide by 40 feet long once a minute as a free action. The cloud provides total concealment, which the squid normally uses to escape a losing fight. Creatures within the cloud suffer the effects of total darkness.

SpecialAbility.Name: Jet
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant squid can jet backward once a round as a double move action, at a speed of 320 feet.

StatsBlock.Name: Steam Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +11, Listen +6, Move Silently +6, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of steam, 10 feet, once every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d4, Reflex half DC 12. Living creatures that fail their saves are tormented by burned skin and seared eyes unless they are immune to or protected from fire. This imposes a -4 morale penalty to AC and a -2 morale penalty to attack rolls for 3 rounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour a steam mephit can surround itself with a plume of vapor, duplicating the effects of a blur spell cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer (save DC 12 + spell level). Once per day it can create a rainstorm of boiling water that affects an area 20 feet square. Living creatures caught in the storm take 2d6 points of damage (Reflex half DC 15).

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A steam mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is touching boiling water or is in a hot, humid area.

StatsBlock.Name: Stirge
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Unknown (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 19, Con 10, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Combat: A stirge attacks by landing on a victim, finding a vulnerable spot, and plunging its proboscis into the flesh. This is a touch attack and can target only Small or larger creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Attach
SpecialAbility.Text: If a stirge hits with a touch attack, it uses its eight pincers to latch onto the opponent's body. An attached stirge has an AC of 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blood Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A stirge drains blood, dealing 1d4 points of temporary Constitution damage each round it remains attached. Once it has drained 4 points of Constitution, it detaches and flies off to digest the meal.

StatsBlock.Name: Stone
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +17 melee (2d10+9)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 11, Cha 1

Description.General:
A golem's creator can command it if the golem is within 60 feet and can see and hear its creator. If uncommanded, the golem usually follows its last instruction to the best of its ability, though if attacked it returns the attack. The creator can give the golem a simple program to govern its actions in his or her absence.
Golems do not need to breathe and are immune to most forms of energy.
Description.Construction:
The cost listed for each golem includes that of the physical body and all the materials and spell components that are consumed or become a permanent part of it.
Understanding the rituals requires a character of the required level with the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats. The creator must labor for at least 8 hours each day in a specially prepared laboratory or workroom. The chamber is similar to an alchemist's laboratory and costs 500 gp to establish.
When not working on the rituals, the creator must rest and can perform no other activities except eating, sleeping, or talking. If personally constructing the golem's body, the creator can perform the building and rituals together. If the creator misses a day of rituals, the process fails and must be started again. Money spent is lost, but XP spent are not. The golem's body can be reused, as can the laboratory.
Completing the ritual drains the appropriate XP from the creator and requires casting any spells on the final day. The creator must cast the spells personally, but they can come from outside sources, such as scrolls.
The stone golem costs 80,000 gp to create, which includes 1,000 gp for the body. Assembling the body requires a successful Craft (sculpting or masonry) check (DC 17). The creator must be 16th level and able to cast arcane spells. Completing the ritual drains 1,600 XP from the creator and requires geas/quest, limited wish, polymorph any object, and slow.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Slow
SpecialAbility.Text: A stone golem can use slow as a free action once every 2 rounds. The effect has a range of 10 feet and a duration of 7 rounds, requiring a successful Will save (DC 13) to negate. The ability is otherwise the same as the spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: A stone golem is immune to all spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural effects, except as follows. A transmute rock to mud spell slows it (as the slow spell) for 2d6 rounds, with no saving throw, while transmute mud to rock heals all of its lost hit points. A stone to flesh spell does not actually change the golem's structure but makes it vulnerable to any normal attack for the following round (this does not include spells, except those that cause damage).

StatsBlock.Name: Stone Giant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatclub x2 +16/+11 melee (2d6+12)rock x2 +16/+11 melee (2d8+8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Point Blank Shot, Power Attack, Precise Shot

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Description.Skills: *A stone giant gains a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks in rocky terrain.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Stone Giant Elder
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Huge greatclub x2 +16/+11 melee (2d6+12)rock x2 +16/+11 melee (2d8+8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Point Blank Shot, Power Attack, Precise Shot

Description.General:
Some stone giants develop special abilities related to their environment. These giant elders have Charisma scores of at least 15 and spell-like abilities. One in ten elders is a sorcerer, usually of 3rd to 6th level.
All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Spell-like Abilities: 1/day- stone shape, stone tell; 1/day- transmute rock to mud or transmute mud to rock. These are used as the spells cast by a 10th-level sorcerer.
Description.Skills: *A stone giant gains a +8 racial bonus to Hide checks in rocky terrain.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Storm Giant
StatsBlock.Attacks: Gargantuan greatsword melee (4d6+21)Gargantuan mighty composite lon melee (2d8+14)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gargantuan greatsword x3 +24/+19/+14 melee (4d6+21)Gargantuan mighty composite lon x1 +24 melee (2d8+14)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Electricity ), Water Breathing, Rock Catching, Freedom Of Movement
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 39, Dex 14, Con 23, Int 16, Wis 16, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Combat Reflexes, Power Attack, Sunder, Great Cleave

Description.General: All giants speak Giant. Those with Intelligence scores of at least 10 also speak Common.
Description.Skills: Storm giants have EHD as though they were large creatures. Storm giants ignore all weight penalties for gear carried when swimming.
Description.Feats: Storm giants have EHD as though they were large creatures.
Description.Characters: Storm giant clerics can choose two of the following domains: Chaos, Good, Protection, and War.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a storm giant can call lightning as a 15th-level druid and use chain lighting as a 15th-level sorcerer. Twice per day a storm giant can control weather as a 20th-level druid and levitate as a 20th-level sorcerer. Save DC is 12 + spell level.

SpecialAbility.Name: Freedom of Movement
SpecialAbility.Text: Storm giants continuously have freedom of movement as the spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Breathing
SpecialAbility.Text: Storm giants can breathe underwater indefinitely and can freely use their spell-like abilities while submerged.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Throwing
SpecialAbility.Text: Adult giants are accomplished rock throwers and receive a +1 racial bonus to attack rolls when throwing rocks. A giant of at least Large size can hurl rocks weighing 40 to 50 pounds each (Small objects) up to 5 range increments. The size of the range increment varies with the giant's variety. A Huge giant can hurl rocks of 60 to 80 pounds (Medium-size objects).

SpecialAbility.Name: Rock Catching
SpecialAbility.Text: A giant of at least Large size can catch Small, Medium-size, or Large rocks (or projectiles of similar shape). Once per round, a giant that would normally be hit by a rock can make a Reflex save to catch it as a free action. The DC is 15 for a Small rock, 20 for a Medium-size one, and 25 for a Large one. (If the projectile has a magical bonus to attack, the DC increases by that amount.) The giant must be ready for and aware of the attack.

StatsBlock.Name: Succubus (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +5 melee (1d3+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Energy Drain, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Alternate Form, Tongues
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 20
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +11, Concentration +7, Disguise +11, Escape Artist +7, Hide +7, Knowledge +9, Listen +16, Move Silently +7, Ride +7, Search +9, Spot +16

Description.General: Succubi speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Succubi receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks. *When using alternate form, a succubus receives an additional +10 circumstance bonus to Disguise checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will-charm monster, clairaudience/ clairvoyance, darkness, desecrate, detect good, detect thoughts, doom, ethereal jaunt (self plus 50 pounds of objects only), suggestion, and teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only); 1/day unholy blight. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 15 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A succubus drains energy from a mortal it lures into some act of passion, or by simply planting a kiss on the victim. If the target is not willing to be kissed, the succubus must start a grapple, which provokes an attack of opportunity. The succubus's kiss or embrace inflicts one negative level; the victim must succeed at a Wisdom check (DC 15) to even notice. The Fortitude save to remove the negative level has a DC of 18.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a succubus can attempt to summon one balor with a 10% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Alternate Form
SpecialAbility.Text: Succubi can assume any humanoid form of Small to Large size as a standard action. This ability is similar to the polymorph self spell but allows only humanoid forms. *While using this ability, a succubus gains a +10 circumstance bonus to Disguise checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: A succubus has a permanent tongues ability as the spell cast by a 12th-level sorcerer. Succubi usually use verbal communication with mortals and save telepathic communication for conversing with other fiends.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: A succubus is immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: A succubus has cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: A succubus can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Svirfneblin
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Short sword x1 melee (1d6)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 12, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.General: Speak Gnome, Common, Terran, and Undercommon. Most also speak the language of drow or kuo-toa.
Description.Combat: Svirfneblin make heavy use of illusion magic and carefully prepared ambushes and traps whenever they can.
Description.Skills: All gnomes receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks, for their keen hearing, and to Alchemy checks, because their sensitive noses allow them to monitor alchemical processes by smell. Svirfneblin receive a +2 racial bonus to Hide checks, which improves to +4 in darkened areas underground.
Description.Characters: A svirfneblin's favored class is illusionist.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Svirfneblin can use blindness, blur, and change self each once per day. These abilities are as the spells cast by a wizard of the svirfneblin's character level (save DC 10 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Nondetection
SpecialAbility.Text: Svirfneblin have a continuous nondetection ability as the spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Speak with Animals
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a gnome can use speak with animals as a 1st-level druid to communicate with a burrowing mammal (badger, fox, rabbit, etc.).

SpecialAbility.Name: Svirfneblin Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Svirfneblin benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Gnomes gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • Low-light Vision. Gnomes can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, and similar conditions of poor illumination.
  • +1 racial bonus to attack rolls against kobolds and goblinoids.
  • Darkvision up to 120 feet.
  • Spell resistance of 11 + character level.
  • +2 racial bonus to all saving throws.
  • +4 dodge bonus against all creatures.
  • Stonecunning: Like dwarves, svirfneblin receive a +2 racial bonus to checks to notice unusual stonework. Something that isn't stone but that is disguised as stone also counts as unusual stonework. A deep gnome who merely comes within 10 feet of unusual stonework can make a check as though actively searching and can use the Search skill to find stonework traps as a rogue can. A svirfneblin can also intuit depth, sensing the approximate distance underground as naturally as a human can sense which way is up.

StatsBlock.Name: Tallfellow
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) heavy crossbow x1 melee (1d10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +0, Hide +5, Jump +0, Listen +3, Move Silently +2, Search +2, Spot +2

Description.General: Tallfellows speak Halfling and Common, and generally speak Elven as well.
Description.Combat: Halflings prefer to fight defensively, usually hiding and launching ranged attacks as the foe approaches.
Description.Skills: Tallfellows's keen hearing bestows a +2 racial bonus to Listen checks.
Description.Characters: A halfling's favored class is rogue.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tallfellow Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Tallfellows benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Small: Halflings gain a +1 size bonus to AC and attack rolls and a +4 size bonus to Hide checks, but they must use smaller weapons than humans use, and their lifting and carrying limits are three-quarters of those of Medium-size creatures.
  • +1 racial bonus to all saving throws.
  • +2 morale bonus to saving throws against fear. (This bonus stacks with the halfling's +1 bonus to saving throws in general.)
  • +1 racial attack bonus with a thrown weapon.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. Like an elf, a tallfellow who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Tarrasque
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (4d8+17) or 2 horns melee (1d10+8) or 2 claws melee (1d12+4) or tail slap melee (3d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +65 melee (4d8+17) or 2 horns x1 +60 melee (1d10+8) or 2 claws x1 +60 melee (1d12+4) or tail slap x1 +60 melee (3d8+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Improved Grab, Swallow Whole, Frightful Presence, Rush, Augmented Criticals
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Immunities (Other, See Below), Regeneration, Scent, Spell Resistance, Carapace
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 45, Dex 16, Con 35, Int 3, Wis 14, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Feats: Blind-Fight, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Iron Will

Description.Skills: The tarrasque receives a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Frightful Presence
SpecialAbility.Text: The tarrasque can inspire terror by charging or attacking. Affected creatures must succeed at a Will save (DC 26) or become shaken, remaining shaken until they leave the area of effect.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rush
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per minute, the normally slow-moving tarrasque can move at a speed of 150 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the tarrasque must hit a Huge or smaller opponent with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can try to swallow the foe.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: The tarrasque can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Huge or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+8 points of crushing damage plus 2d8+6 points of acid damage per round from the tarrasque's digestive juices. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by dealing 50 points of damage to the tarrasque's digestive tract (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. The tarrasque's gullet can hold two Huge, four Large, eight Medium-size, or sixteen Small or smaller creatures.

SpecialAbility.Name: Augmented Criticals
SpecialAbility.Text: The tarrasque threatens a critical hit on a natural attack roll of 18-20, dealing triple damage on a successful critical hit.

SpecialAbility.Name: Carapace
SpecialAbility.Text: The tarrasque's armorlike carapace is exceptionally tough and highly reflective, deflecting all rays, lines, cones, and even magic missile spells. There is a 30% chance of reflecting any such effect back at the caster; otherwise, it is merely negated. Check for reflection before rolling to overcome the creature's spell resistance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: The tarrasque has fire, poison, and disease immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: No form of attack deals normal damage to the tarrasque. The tarrasque regenerates even if disintegrated or slain with death magic: These attack forms merely reduce it to -10 hit points. It is immune to effects that produce incurable or bleeding wounds, such as a sword of wounding, mummy rot, or a clay golem's wound ability. The tarrasque can be permanently slain only by reducing it to -30 hit points and using a wish or miracle spell to keep it dead. If the tarrasque loses a limb or body part, the lost portion regrows in 1d6 minutes (the detached piece dies and decays normally). The creature can reattach the severed member instantly by holding it to the stump.

StatsBlock.Name: Taskmaster
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +8 melee (2d4+4) or 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Poison, Hive Mind, Dominate Person, Dominated Creature
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Telepathy, Spell Resistance, Resistances
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 14, Wis 16, Cha 19
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +13, Hide +12, Listen +12, Move Silently +12, Search +8, Sense Motive +12, Spot +12

SpecialAbility.Name: Dominate Person
SpecialAbility.Text: Taskmasters can use dominate person on any creature as the spell cast by a 10th-level sorcerer (save DC 19), although the subject may be of any type and may be up to Large size. A single taskmaster can dominate up to four subjects at a time.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dominated Creature
SpecialAbility.Text: A taskmaster is never encountered alone: One dominated nonformian creature always accompanies it (choose or determine randomly any creature of CR 4).

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 15); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Taskmasters can communicate telepathically with any intelligent creature within 100 feet.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hive Mind
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians within 50 miles of their queen are in constant communication. If one is aware of a particular danger, they all are. If one in a group is not flat-footed, none of them are. No formian in a group is considered flanked unless all of them are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Formians have poison, petrification, and cold immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians have fire, electricity, and sonic resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Ten-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Ten-Headed Hydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 bites x1 +9 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

StatsBlock.Name: Ten-Headed Lernaean Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Ten-Headed Lernaean Pyrohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

StatsBlock.Name: Ten-Headed Pyrohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 10 bites x1 +11 melee (1d10+5)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 21, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These reddish hydras can breathe jets of fire 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
