Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Tendriculos
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +13 melee (2d8+9) or 2 tendrils x1 +8 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 9, Con 22, Int 3, Wis 8, Cha 3

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the tendriculos must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it automatically deals bite damage and can try to swallow the opponent. A tendriculos that hits with a tendril attack grabs as above. If it gets a hold, it picks up the opponent and transfers it to the mouth as a partial action, automatically dealing bite damage as above.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole/Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: A tendriculos can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Large or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside the plant's mass, the opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or be paralyzed for 3d6 rounds by the tendriculos's digestive juices, taking 2d6 points of acid damage per round. A new save is required each round inside the plant. A swallowed creature that avoids paralysis can climb out of the mass with a successful grapple check. This returns it to the plant's maw, where another successful grapple check is needed to get free. A swallowed creature can also cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the tendriculos's interior (AC 15). Once the creature exits, the plant's amazing regenerative capacity closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must again cut its own way out. The tendriculos's interior can hold two Large, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Bludgeoning weapons and acid deal normal damage to a tendriculos. A tendriculos that loses part of its body mass can regrow it in 1d6 minutes. Holding the severed portion against the mass enables it to reattach instantly.

StatsBlock.Name: Thoqqua
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +2 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Intuit Direction +4, Jump +6, Listen +6, Move Silently +5

Description.Combat: When a thoqqua is disturbed, its first instinct is to attack. Its favored tactic is to spring directly at a foe, either by bursting out of the rock or by coiling up its body and launching itself like a spring. In either case, treat the maneuver as a charge.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heat
SpecialAbility.Text: Merely touching or being touched by a thoqqua automatically deals 2d6 fire damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Burn
SpecialAbility.Text: When a thoqqua hits with its slam attack, the opponent must succeed at a Reflex save (DC 13) or catch fire. The flame burns for 1d4 rounds if not extinguished sooner. The burning creature can use a full-round action to put out the flame.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity, double damage from cold except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Thoqquas can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiefling
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Rapier x1 melee (1d6)light crossbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 11, Cha 8

Description.Skills: Tieflings receive a +2 racial bonus to Bluff and Hide checks.
Description.Characters: A tiefling's favored class is rogue.

SpecialAbility.Name: Darkness
SpecialAbility.Text: Tieflings can use darkness once per day as cast by a sorcerer of 1st level or their character level, whichever is higher.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiger
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d8+6) or bite x1 +3 melee (2d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Balance +6, Hide +5, Listen +3, Move Silently +9, Spot +3, Swim +11

Description.Skills: Tigers receive a +4 racial bonus to Balance, Hide, and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a tiger leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the tiger must hit with a claw or bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A tiger that gets a hold can make two rake attacks (+9 melee) with its hind legs for 1d8+3 damage each. If the tiger pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiger
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +18 melee (2d4+8) or bite x1 +13 melee (2d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +0, Jump +11, Listen +3, Move Silently +9, Spot +3, Swim +11

Description.Skills: Dire tigers receive a +4 racial bonus to Hide and Move Silently checks. *In areas of tall grass or heavy undergrowth, the Hide bonus improves to +8.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pounce
SpecialAbility.Text: If a dire tiger leaps upon a foe during the first round of combat, it can make a full attack even if it has already taken a move action.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the dire tiger must hit with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can rake.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rake
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire tiger can make two rake attacks (+18 melee) against a held creature with its hind legs for 2d4+4 damage each. If the dire tiger pounces on an opponent, it can also rake.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiny Animated Object
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 8, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 1, Cha 1

Description.Combat: An animated object's abilities vary depending on its form. It always has the construct qualities, and can have one or more of the following special abilities.

SpecialAbility.Name: Construct
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, disease, and similar effects. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blind
SpecialAbility.Text: A sheetlike animated object such as a carpet or tapestry can grapple an opponent up to three sizes larger. The object makes a normal grapple check. If it gets a hold, it wraps itself around the opponent's head, blinding that creature until removed. The blinded creature cannot make Spot, Search, or Track checks and suffers a -6 circumstance penalty to other checks related to perception, such as Listen.

SpecialAbility.Name: Constrict
SpecialAbility.Text: A flexible animated object such as a rope, vine, or rug deals automatic slam damage with a successful grapple check against creatures up to one size larger than itself. An object of at least Large size can make constrict attacks against multiple creatures at once, if they all are at least two sizes smaller than the object and fit under it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object of at least Large size and with a hardness of at least 10 can trample creatures two or more sizes smaller for the object's slam damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the object can attempt Reflex saves (DC 10 + 1/2 object's HD) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardness
SpecialAbility.Text: An animated object has the same hardness it had before it was animated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Speed
SpecialAbility.Text: The base speeds given in the statistics block assume that animated objects lurch, rock, or slither along. Objects with two legs (statues, ladders) or a similar shape that allows faster movement have a speed bonus of 10 feet. Objects with multiple legs (tables, chairs) have a speed bonus of 20 feet. Wheeled objects gain a speed bonus of 40 feet. Objects might have additional modes of movement. A wooden object can float and has a swim speed equal to half its land speed. A rope or similar sinuous object has a climb speed equal to half its land speed. A sheetlike object can fly (clumsy maneuverability) at half its normal speed.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiny Skeleton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 6, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Skeletons have cold immunity. Because they lack flesh or internal organs, they take only half damage from piercing or slashing weapons.

StatsBlock.Name: Tiny Zombie
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 9, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 1

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Partial Actions Only
SpecialAbility.Text: Zombies have poor reflexes and can perform only partial actions. Thus they can move or attack, but can only do both if they charge (a partial charge).

StatsBlock.Name: Titan
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gargantuan warhammer x4 +31/+26/+21/+16 melee (4d6+19)Huge javelin x4 +31/+26/+21/+16 melee (2d6+13)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 37, Dex 12, Con 23, Int 21, Wis 20, Cha 18
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +27, Climb +21, Concentration +29, Craft +27, Jump +36, Knowledge +28, Knowledge +28, Listen +30, Perform +27, Sense Motive +28, Spot +30, Swim +36
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Cleave, Expertise, Great Cleave, Power Attack

Description.General: Titans speak Common, Celestial, Draconic, Giant, and Sylvan.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: alter self, bless, charm person or animal, commune with nature, cure light wounds, eyebite, fire storm, halt undead, hold monster, invisibility, levitate, light, magic circle against evil, mirror image, pass without trace, persistent image, produce flame, summon nature's ally II, remove curse, remove fear, shield, speak with plants, summon swarm, and whispering wind; 2/day-astral projection and etherealness. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 20th-level sorcerer (save DC 14 + spell level). Once every other round, a titan can use holy smite as a 20th-level cleric.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: A titan can use arcane spells as a 20th-level wizard or divine spells as a 20th-level cleric, from the cleric list and from the Chaos and Good domains.

StatsBlock.Name: Toad
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 melee (1d8+1) or bite x1 melee (2d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 1, Dex 12, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 14, Cha 4

Description.Skills: A toad's coloration gives it a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks.

StatsBlock.Name: Treant
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 slams x1 +10 melee (2d6+9)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Trample, Animate Trees, Double Damage Againstobjects
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 29, Dex 8, Con 21, Int 12, Wis 15, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +0, Intimidate +8, Knowledge +8, Listen +9, Sense Motive +9, Spot +9, Wilderness Lore +9

Description.General: Treants speak their own language, plus Common and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Treants prefer to watch potential foes carefully before attacking. They often charge suddenly from cover to trample the despoilers of forests. If sorely pressed, they animate trees as reinforcements.
Description.Skills: Treants receive skills as though they were fey*. They have a +16 racial bonus to Hide checks made in forested areas.

SpecialAbility.Name: Animate Trees
SpecialAbility.Text: A treant can animate trees within 180 feet at will, controlling up to two trees at a time. It takes a full round for a normal tree to uproot itself. Thereafter it moves at a speed of 10 and fights as a treant in all respects. Animated trees lose their ability to move if the treant who animated them is incapacitated or moves out of range. The ability is otherwise similar to liveoak as cast by a 12th-level druid.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: A treant or animated tree can trample Medium-size or smaller creatures for 2d12+5 points of damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the treant or animated tree can attempt a Reflex save (DC 20) to halve the damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Double Damage against Objects
SpecialAbility.Text: A treant or animated tree that makes a full attack against an object or structure deals double damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: A treant or animated tree takes double damage from fire attacks unless the attack allows a save, in which case it takes double damage on a failure and no damage on a success.

SpecialAbility.Name: Half Damage from Piercing
SpecialAbility.Text: Piercing weapons deal only half damage to treants, with a minimum of 1 point of damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Triceratops
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Gore x1 +15 melee (2d8+7)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 9, Con 25, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 7

SpecialAbility.Name: Trample
SpecialAbility.Text: A triceratops can trample Medium-size or smaller creatures for 2d12+5 points of damage. Opponents who do not make attacks of opportunity against the triceratops can attempt a Reflex save (DC 23) to halve the damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Triton
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Trident x1 +1 melee (1d8+1)heavy crossbow x1 +1 melee (1d10+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.General: Tritons speak Common and Aquan.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: A triton can use summon nature's ally III once per day as the spell cast by a 5th-level sorcerer, often choosing water elementals for their companions.

StatsBlock.Name: Troglodyte
StatsBlock.Attacks: Longspear melee (1d8) or Unknown (1d4) or Unknown (1d4)or javelin melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longspear x1 melee (1d8) or Unknown (1d4) or Unknown (1d4)or javelin x1 melee (1d6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 9, Con 14, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 10

Description.General: Troglodytes speak Draconic.
Description.Combat: Half of a group of troglodytes are armed only with claws and teeth; the rest carry one or two javelins and longspears. They normally conceal themselves, launch a volley of javelins, then close to attack. If the battle goes against them, they retreat and attempt to hide.
Description.Skills: The skin of a troglodyte changes color somewhat, allowing it to blend in with surroundings like a chameleon and conferring a +4 racial bonus to Hide checks. *In rocky or subterranean settings, this bonus improves to +8.
Description.Characters: A troglodyte's favored class is cleric. Troglodyte clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Chaos, Death, Destruction, and Evil.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stench
SpecialAbility.Text: When a troglodyte is angry or frightened, it secretes an oily, musklike chemical that nearly every form of animal life finds offensive. All creatures (except troglodytes) within 30 feet of the trog must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 13) or be overcome with nausea. This lasts for 10 rounds and deals 1d6 points of temporary Strength damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Troll
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d6+6) or bite x1 +3 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 14, Con 23, Int 6, Wis 9, Cha 6

Description.General: Trolls speak Giant.
Description.Combat: Trolls have no fear of death: They launch themselves into combat without hesitation, flailing wildly at the closest opponent. Even when confronted with fire, they try to get around the flames and attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Rend
SpecialAbility.Text: If a troll hits with both claw attacks, it latches onto the opponent's body and tears the flesh. This attack automatically deals an additional 2d6+9 points of damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire and acid deal normal damage to a troll. If a troll loses a limb or body part, the lost portion regrows in 3d6 minutes. The creature can reattach the severed member instantly by holding it to the stump.

StatsBlock.Name: Trumpet Archon
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: +4 greatsword +21/+16/+11 mele x1 +17 melee (2d6+11)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Spells, Spell-Like Abilities, Trumpet, Aura Of Menace
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Immunities (Petrification), Magic Circle Against Evil, Teleport, Tongues, Poison Saves, Keen Vision
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 16, Wis 16, Cha 16
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +15, Concentration +13, Escape Artist +15, Hide +15, Knowledge +15, Listen +15, Move Silently +15, Sense Motive +15, Spot +15
StatsBlock.Feats: Blind-Fight, Cleave, Improved Initiative, Power Attack

Description.General: Celestials speak Celestial, Infernal, and Draconic.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: detect evil, continual flame, and message. These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Trumpet archons can cast divine spells from the cleric list and from the Air, Destruction, Good, Law, and War domains as 14th-level clerics (save DC 13 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Trumpet
SpecialAbility.Text:
The archon's trumpet produces music of utter clarity, piercing beauty, and, if the trumpet archon wills it, paralyzing awe. All creatures except archons within 100 feet of the blast must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or be paralyzed for 1d4 rounds. The archon can also command its trumpet to become a +4 greatsword as a free action.
If the trumpet is ever stolen, it becomes a chunk of useless lead until the archon can recover it. Woe betide any thief caught with it.

SpecialAbility.Name: Aura of Menace
SpecialAbility.Text: A righteous aura surrounds a trumpet archon that fights or gets angry. Any hostile creature within a 20-foot radius of the archon must succeed at a Will save (DC 19) to resist its effects. Those who fail suffer a -2 morale penalty to attacks, AC, and saves for one day or until they successfully hit the archon that generated the aura. A creature that has resisted or broken the effect cannot be affected again by that archon's aura for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Circle against Evil
SpecialAbility.Text: A magic circle against evil effect always surrounds archons, identical with the spell cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the archon's Hit Dice. The effect can be dispelled, but the archon can create it again during its next turn as a free action. (The defensive benefits from the circle are not included in the statistics block.)

SpecialAbility.Name: Teleport
SpecialAbility.Text: Archons can teleport without error at will, as the spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer, except that the creature can transport only itself and up to 50 pounds of objects.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tongues
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials can speak with any creature that has a language, as though using a tongues spell cast by a 14th-level sorcerer. This ability is always active.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison Saves
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials receive a +4 racial bonus to Fortitude saves against poison.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Vision
SpecialAbility.Text: All celestials have low-light vision and 60-foot darkvision.

StatsBlock.Name: Twelve-Headed Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 12 bites x1 +16 melee (1d10+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Twelve-Headed Hydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 12 bites x1 +13 melee (1d10+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties. A severed head regrows in about a month.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

StatsBlock.Name: Twelve-Headed Lernaean Cryohydra
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 12 bites x1 +16 melee (1d10+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 3, Wis 10, Cha 9

Description.Combat:
These purplish hydras can breathe jets of frost 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 20 feet long. All heads breathe once every 1d4 rounds. Each jet deals 3d6 damage per head. A successful Reflex save halves the damage. The save DC is 10 + 1/2 hydra's original number of heads + the hydra's Constitution modifier.
Hydras can attack with all their heads at no penalty, even if they move or charge during the round.
A hydra can be killed either by severing all its heads or by slaying its body. To sever a head, an opponent must hit the monster's neck with a slashing weapon and deal damage equal to the hydra's original hit point total, divided by its original number of heads, in one blow. (The player says where the attack is aimed just before making the attack roll.) For example, if a five-headed hydra has 52 hp, a single blow dealing 10 or more points of damage severs a head (52 / 5 = 10.4, rounded down to 10). Any excess damage is lost. A severed head dies, and a natural reflex seals the neck shut to prevent further blood loss. The hydra can no longer attack with the severed head but suffers no other penalties.
The only way to slay a Lernaean hydra normally is to sever all its heads. However, each time a head is severed, two new heads spring from the stump in 1d4 rounds. A Lernaean hydra can never have more than twice its original number of heads at any one time, and any extra heads it gains beyond its original number wither and die within a day.
To prevent a severed head from growing back into two, at least 5 points of fire or acid damage must be dealt to the stump (AC 19) before the new heads appear.
Spells such as disintegrate, finger of death, and slay living kill a Lernaean hydra outright if they succeed. If the spell deals damage on a successful save, that damage is directed against one of the hydra's heads.
Description.Skills: Hydras receive a +2 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks, thanks to their multiple heads.
Description.Feats: A hydra's Combat Reflexes feat allows it to use all its heads for attacks of opportunity each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fire Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Fire immunity; double damage from cold except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Tyrannosaurus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +19 melee (5d8+13)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 12, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 15, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the tyrannosaurus must hit a Medium-size or smaller opponent with its bite attack. If it gets a hold, it can try to swallow the foe.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swallow Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: A tyrannosaurus can try to swallow a Medium-size or smaller opponent by making a successful grapple check. The swallowed creature takes 2d8+8 points of crushing damage per round plus 8 points of acid damage from the tyrannosaurus's gizzard. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by using claws or a Small or Tiny slashing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 20). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must again cut its own way out. The tyrannosaurus's gizzard can hold two Medium-size, four Small, eight Tiny, sixteen Diminutive, or thirty-two Fine or smaller opponents.

StatsBlock.Name: Umber Hulk
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +11 melee (2d4+6) or bite x1 +9 melee (2d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 23, Dex 13, Con 19, Int 9, Wis 11, Cha 13

Description.General: Umber hulks speak their own language.
Description.Combat: Despite its great bulk, the umber hulk is intelligent. When brute force won't overcome an enemy, it is more than capable of outthinking those who assume it to be a stupid beast. Umber hulks often use their tunneling ability to create deadfalls and pits for the unwary.

SpecialAbility.Name: Confusing Gaze
SpecialAbility.Text: Confusion as cast by an 8th-level sorcerer, 30 feet, Will negates DC 15.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tremorsense
SpecialAbility.Text: Umber hulks can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground.

StatsBlock.Name: Unicorn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Horn x1 +8 melee (1d8+8) or 2 hooves x1 +3 melee (1d4+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Magic Circle Against Evil
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 17, Con 21, Int 10, Wis 21, Cha 24
StatsBlock.Skills: Animal Empathy +11, Listen +11, Move Silently +9, Spot +11, Wilderness Lore +9

Description.General:
Evil and unscrupulous beings sometimes hunt a unicorn for its horn, which can fetch up to 2,000 gp, for use in various healing potions and devices.
Unicorns speak Sylvan and Common.
Description.Combat: They either charge, impaling foes with their horns like lances, or strike with their hooves. The horn is a +3 magic weapon, though its power fades if removed from the unicorn.
Description.Skills: *Unicorns receive a +3 competence bonus to Wilderness Lore checks within the boundaries of their forest.

SpecialAbility.Name: Magic Circle against Evil
SpecialAbility.Text: This ability continuously duplicates the effects of the spell. The unicorn cannot suppress this ability.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Unicorns can detect evil at will as a free action. Once per day a unicorn can use teleport without error to move anywhere within its home. It cannot teleport beyond the forest boundaries nor back from outside. A unicorn can use cure light wounds three times per day and cure moderate wounds once per day, as cast by a 5th-level druid, by touching a wounded creature with its horn. Once per day it can use neutralize poison, as cast by an 8th-level druid, with a touch of its horn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Unicorns are immune to all poisons and to charm and hold spells or abilities.

StatsBlock.Name: Vampire Spawn
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +5 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Undead, Turn Resistance, Damage Reduction 10/SILVER, Resistance (Cold), Gaseous Form, Spider Climb, Fast Healing
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 14
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +8, Climb +8, Hide +10, Jump +8, Listen +11, Move Silently +11, Search +8, Sense Motive +11, Spot +11, +10
StatsBlock.Feats: Alertness, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Skill Focus

Description.General: Vampire spawn speak Common.
Description.Combat: Vampire spawn use their inhuman strength when engaging mortals, hammering their foes with powerful blows and dashing them against rocks or walls. They also use their gaseous form and flight abilities to strike where opponents are most vulnerable.
Description.Skills: Vampire spawn receive a +4 racial bonus to Bluff, Hide, Listen, Move Silently, Search, Sense Motive, and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Charm
SpecialAbility.Text: This is similar to the vampire's domination ability, but the save DC is 14, and the effect is similar to charm person as cast by a 5th-level sorcerer. A charmed subject allows the vampire spawn to drain his or her blood (see below).

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures hit by a vampire spawn's slam attack receive one negative level. The Fortitude save to remove the negative level has a DC of 14.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blood Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A vampire spawn can suck blood from a living victim with its fangs by making a successful grapple check. If it pins the foe, it drains blood, inflicting 1d4 points of permanent Constitution drain each round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Gaseous Form
SpecialAbility.Text: As a standard action, a vampire spawn can assume gaseous form at will, as the spell cast by a 6th-level sorcerer, but it can remain gaseous indefinitely and has a fly speed of 20 feet with perfect maneuverability.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spider Climb
SpecialAbility.Text: A vampire spawn can climb sheer surfaces as though with a spider climb spell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A vampire spawn heals 2 points of damage each round so long as it has at least 1 hit point. If reduced to 0 hit points in combat, it automatically assumes gaseous form and attempts to escape. It must reach its coffin home within 2 hours or be utterly destroyed. Once at rest in its coffin, it regains 1 hit point after 1 hour, then resumes healing at the rate of 2 hit points per round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Slaying
SpecialAbility.Text: Vampire spawn are equally vulnerable to attacks which slay vampires. Exposing a vampire spawn to direct sunlight disorients it: It can take only partial actions and is destroyed utterly on the next round if it cannot escape. Similarly, immersing a vampire spawn in running water robs it of one-third of its hit points each round until it is destroyed at the end of the third round.

StatsBlock.Name: Vargouille
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 8

SpecialAbility.Name: Shriek
SpecialAbility.Text: Instead of biting, a vargouille can open its distended mouth and let out a terrible shriek. Those within 60 feet (except other vargouilles) who both hear the shriek and can clearly see the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 12) or be paralyzed with fear until the monster attacks them, goes out of range, or leaves their sight. A paralyzed creature is susceptible to the vargouille's kiss. If the save is successful, that opponent cannot be affected again by that vargouille's shriek for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 12) or be unable to heal the bite damage naturally or magically. A neutralize poison or heal spell removes the effect, while delay poison allows magical healing.

SpecialAbility.Name: Kiss
SpecialAbility.Text: A vargouille can kiss a paralyzed target with a successful melee touch attack, beginning a terrible transformation. The affected opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 19) or begin to transform, losing all his or her hair 1d6 hours later. After another 1d6 hours, the ears grow into leathery wings, tentacles sprout on the chin and scalp, and the teeth become long, pointed fangs. During the next 1d6 hours, the victim suffers 1d6 points of permanent Intelligence and Charisma drain. The transformation is complete 1d6 hours later, when the head breaks free of the body (which promptly dies) and becomes a vargouille. This transformation is interrupted by sunlight, and even a daylight spell can delay death, but to reverse the transformation requires remove disease.

StatsBlock.Name: Violet Fungus
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 4 tentacles x1 +2 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 8, Con 16, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Plant
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and polymorphing. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Tentacle, Fortitude save (DC 14); initial and secondary damage 1d4 temporary Strength and 1d4 temporary Constitution.

StatsBlock.Name: Vrock (Tanar'ri)
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 claws melee (1d8+4) or bite melee (1d6+2) or 2 rakes melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +11 melee (1d8+4) or bite x1 +9 melee (1d6+2) or 2 rakes x1 +9 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Spell-Like Abilities, Spores, Screech, Dance Of Ruin, Summon Tanar'ri
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 12
StatsBlock.Skills: Concentration +14, Hide +9, Knowledge +12, Listen +13, Move Silently +13, Search +13, Sense Motive +13, Spellcraft +12, Spot +12

Description.General: Vrocks speak Abyssal, Celestial, and Draconic.
Description.Skills: Vrocks receive a +8 racial bonus to Listen and Spot checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: At will: darkness, desecrate, detect good, detect magic, mass charm, mirror image, telekinesis, and teleport without error (self plus 50 pounds of objects only). These abilities are as the spells cast by a 12th-level sorcerer (save DC 11 + spell level).

SpecialAbility.Name: Spores
SpecialAbility.Text: A vrock can release masses of spores from its body once every 3 rounds. The spores automatically deal 1d8 points of damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the vrock. They then penetrate the skin and grow, dealing an additional 1d2 points of damage each round for 10 rounds. At the end of this time, the victim is covered with a tangle of viny growths. A delay poison spell stops the spores' growth for its duration. Bless, neutralize poison, or remove disease kills the spores, as does sprinkling the victim with a vial of holy water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Stunning Screech
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour a vrock can emit a piercing screech. Every creature within a 30-foot radius must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 17) or be stunned for 1 round.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dance of Ruin
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, a group of five or more vrocks join hands in a circle, dancing wildly and chanting. If they dance for 3 rounds, a wave of crackling energy flashes outward in a 100-foot radius. All nondemon creatures within the radius take 2d20 points of damage (Reflex half DC 15). Forcing the vrocks to break the circle stops the dance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Tanar'ri
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day a vrock can attempt to summon 2d10 dretches or another vrock with a 35% chance of success. This is much as though casting a summon monster spell. Summoned creatures automatically return whence they came after 1 hour. A tanar'ri that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Vrocks are immune to poison and electricity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: Vrocks have cold, fire, and acid resistance 20.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Text: Vrocks can communicate telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that has a language.

StatsBlock.Name: Warrior
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sting melee (2d4+3) or 2 claws melee (1d6+1) or bite melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +7 melee (2d4+3) or 2 claws x1 +5 melee (1d6+1) or bite x1 +5 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Spell Resistance, Resistances
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +10, Hide +10, Listen +7, Move Silently +10, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 14); initial and secondary damage 1d6 temporary Strength.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hive Mind
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians within 50 miles of their queen are in constant communication. If one is aware of a particular danger, they all are. If one in a group is not flat-footed, none of them are. No formian in a group is considered flanked unless all of them are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Formians have poison, petrification, and cold immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians have fire, electricity, and sonic resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Water Elemental, Elder
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 28, Dex 22, Con 21, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical, Power Attack, Sunder

Description.General:
A greater water elemental is 36 feet high and weighs 21,000 lbs.
Water elementals speak Aquan but rarely choose to do so.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elemental
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to poison, sleep, paralysis, and stunning. Not subject to critical hits.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Mastery
SpecialAbility.Text: A water elemental gains a +1 attack and damage bonus if both it and its opponent touch water. If the opponent or elemental is landbound, the elemental suffers a -4 penalty to attack and damage. (These modifiers are not included in the statistics block.) A water elemental can be a serious threat to a ship that crosses its path. The elemental can easily overturn small craft (5 feet of length per Hit Die of the elemental) and stop larger vessels (10 feet long per HD). Even large ships (20 feet long per HD) can be slowed to half speed.

SpecialAbility.Name: Drench
SpecialAbility.Text: The elemental's touch puts out torches, campfires, exposed lanterns, and other open flames of nonmagical origin if these are of Large size or smaller. The creature can dispel magical fire it touches as dispel magic cast by a sorcerer whose level equals the elemental's HD total.

SpecialAbility.Name: Vortex
SpecialAbility.Text:
The elemental can transform itself into a whirlpool once every 10 minutes, provided it is underwater, and remain in that form for up to 1 round for every 2 HD it has. In vortex form, the elemental can move through the water or along the bottom at its swim speed. The vortex is DC 29, damage 2d8, and up to 60 feet high.
The vortex is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 30 feet wide at the top, and 10 feet or more tall, depending on the elemental's size. The elemental controls the exact height, but it must be at least 10 feet.
Creatures one or more sizes smaller than the elemental might take damage when caught in the vortex (see the table below for details) and may be swept up by it. An affected creature must succeed at a Reflex save when it comes into contact with the vortex or take the listed damage. It must also succeed at a second Reflex save or be picked up bodily and held suspended in the powerful currents, automatically taking damage each round. A creature that can swim is allowed a Reflex save each round to escape the vortex. The creature still takes damage, but can leave if the save is successful. The DC for saves against the vortex's effects varies with the elemental's size.
The elemental can eject any carried creatures whenever it wishes, depositing them wherever the vortex happens to be. A summoned elemental always ejects trapped creatures before returning to its home plane.
If the vortex's base touches the bottom, it creates a swirling cloud of debris. This cloud is centered on the elemental and has a diameter equal to half the vortex's height. The cloud obscures all vision, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. Creatures 5 feet away have one-half concealment, while those farther away have total concealment. Those caught in the cloud must succeed at a Concentration check to cast a spell (DC equal to the Reflex save DC).

StatsBlock.Name: Water Elemental, Greater
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 26, Dex 20, Con 21, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical, Power Attack, Sunder

StatsBlock.Name: Water Mephit
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +3 melee (1d3+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Breath Weapon, Spell-Like Abilities, Summon Mephit
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 10, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 11, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Bluff +6, Hide +9, Listen +6, Move Silently +6, Spot +6

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
SpecialAbility.Text: Cone of caustic liquid, 15 feet, once every 1d4 rounds as a standard action; damage 1d8, Reflex half DC 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell-Like Abilities
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per hour a water mephit can hurl an acidic blob that functions like Melf's acid arrow cast by a 3rd-level sorcerer. Once per day it can create a mass of smelly fog that duplicates the effect of stinking cloud as cast by a 6th-level sorcerer. Both have save DC 12 + spell level.

SpecialAbility.Name: Summon Mephit
SpecialAbility.Text: Once per day, all mephits can summon other mephits much as though casting a summon monster spell, but they have only a 25% chance of success to summon one mephit of the same type. Roll d%: On a failure, no creature answers the summons. A mephit that has just been summoned cannot use its own summon ability for 1 hour.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fast Healing
SpecialAbility.Text: A water mephit heals 2 points of damage each round, provided it is still alive and it is exposed to rain or submerged up to its waist in water.

StatsBlock.Name: Water Naga
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +5 melee (2d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 18, Int 10, Wis 17, Cha 15

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Bite, Fortitude save (DC 17); initial and secondary damage 1d8 temporary Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Spells
SpecialAbility.Text: Water nagas cast spells as 7th-level sorcerers but never use fire spells.

StatsBlock.Name: Weasel
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 melee (1d3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 3, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 5
StatsBlock.Skills: Balance +10, Climb +11, Hide +13, Move Silently +9, Spot +4

Description.Skills: Weasels receive a +4 racial bonus to Move Silently checks and a +8 racial bonus to Balance checks. They use their Dexterity modifier for Climb checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Attach
SpecialAbility.Text: If a weasel hits with a bite attack, it uses its powerful jaws to latch onto the opponent's body and automatically deals bite damage each round it remains attached. An attached weasel has an AC of 12.

StatsBlock.Name: Weasel
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 19, Con 10, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 11

SpecialAbility.Name: Attach
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire weasel that hits with its bite attack latches onto the opponent's body with its powerful jaws. An attached dire weasel loses its Dex bonus to AC and thus has an AC of 12.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blood Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire weasel drains blood for 2d4 points of temporary Constitution damage each round it remains attached.

StatsBlock.Name: Whale, Baleen
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Tail slap x1 +17 melee (1d8+18)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 35, Dex 13, Con 22, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6

Description.Skills: Whales gain a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. *These bonuses are lost if Blindsight is negated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Whales can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the whale to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

StatsBlock.Name: Whale, Cachalot
StatsBlock.Attacks: Bite melee (4d6+12) or tail slap melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +17 melee (4d6+12) or tail slap x1 +12 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 35, Dex 13, Con 24, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

Description.Skills: Whales gain a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. *These bonuses are lost if Blindsight is negated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Whales can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the whale to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

StatsBlock.Name: Whale, Orca
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +12 melee (2d6+12)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 27, Dex 15, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6

Description.Skills: Whales gain a +4 racial bonus to Spot and Listen checks. *These bonuses are lost if Blindsight is negated.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: Whales can "see" by emitting high-frequency sounds, inaudible to most other creatures, that allow them to locate objects and creatures within 120 feet. A silence spell negates this and forces the whale to rely on its vision, which is approximately as good as a human's.

StatsBlock.Name: Wight
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Slam x1 +3 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 13, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Climb +5, Hide +8, Listen +8, Move Silently +16, Search +7, Spot +8

Description.Skills: Wights receive a +8 racial bonus to Move Silently checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures hit by a wight's slam attack receive one negative level. The Fortitude save to remove the negative level has a DC of 14.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: Any humanoid slain by a wight becomes a wight in 1d4 rounds. Spawn are under the command of the wight that created them and remain enslaved until its death. They do not possess any of the abilities they had in life.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

StatsBlock.Name: Wild Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 melee (1d8) longbow x1 melee (1d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 9, Wis 10, Cha 11

Description.General: Wild elves speak Elven and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: A wild elf's favored class is sorcerer, although many are barbarians as well.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Elves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Elves can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, etc.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Will-o'-wisp
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Shock x1 +7 melee (2d8)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 29, Con 10, Int 15, Wis 16, Cha 12

SpecialAbility.Name: Spell Immunity
SpecialAbility.Text: The only spells that can affect will-o'-wisps are magic circle against chaos, magic circle against evil, magic missile, maze, protection from chaos, and protection from evil.

SpecialAbility.Name: Natural Invisibility
SpecialAbility.Text: A startled or frightened will-o'-wisp can extinguish its glow, effectively becoming invisible as the spell.

StatsBlock.Name: Winter Wolf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (1d8+6)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 16, Int 9, Wis 13, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +6, Listen +9, Move Silently +7, Spot +9, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.General: Winter wolves can speak Giant and Common.
Description.Combat: Winter wolves typically hunt in packs. Their size, cunning, and formidable breath weapon allow them to hunt and kill creatures much larger than themselves. A pack usually circles an opponent, each wolf attacking in turn to exhaust it. If they're in a hurry, white wolves try to pin their foes.
Description.Skills: Winter wolves receive a +1 racial bonus to Listen, Move Silently, and Spot checks, and a +2 racial bonus to Hide checks. *Their natural coloration grants winter wolves a +7 racial bonus to Hide checks in areas of snow and ice. A winter wolf has a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Breath Weapon
Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A winter wolf that hits with a bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the winter wolf.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Subtype
SpecialAbility.Text: Cold immunity; double damage from fire except on a successful save.

StatsBlock.Name: Wolf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +1 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +3, Listen +6, Move Silently +4, Spot +4, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.Skills: *Wolves receive a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A wolf that hits with a bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the wolf.

StatsBlock.Name: Wolf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +9 melee (1d8+10)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 25, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +5, Listen +6, Move Silently +5, Spot +6, Wilderness Lore +1

Description.Skills: A dire wolf receives a +1 racial bonus to Listen, Move Silently, and Spot checks and a +2 racial bonus to Hide checks. *It also receives a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire wolf that hits with a bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the dire wolf.

StatsBlock.Name: Wolverine
StatsBlock.Speed: Run 30 ft., Climb 10 ft., Burrow 10 ft.
StatsBlock.ArmorClass: Run 30 ft., Climb 10 ft., Burrow 10 ft.
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +2 melee (1d4+2)bite x1 +2 melee (1d6+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 14, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Rage
SpecialAbility.Text: A wolverine that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. An enraged wolverine gains +4 Strength, +4 Constitution, and -2 AC. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

StatsBlock.Name: Wolverine
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 claws x1 +8 melee (1d6+6) or bite x1 +3 melee (1d8+3)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 22, Dex 17, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10

SpecialAbility.Name: Rage
SpecialAbility.Text: A dire wolverine that takes damage in combat flies into a berserk rage on its next turn, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. An enraged dire wolverine gains +4 Strength, +4 Constitution, and -2 AC. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

StatsBlock.Name: Wood Elf
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Longsword x1 +1 melee (1d8+1)longbow x1 +1 melee (1d8+1)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 12, Dex 13, Con 8, Int 9, Wis 11, Cha 9

Description.General: Wood elves speak Elven and Sylvan.
Description.Combat: Elves are cautious warriors and take time to analyze their opponents and the location of the fight if at all possible, maximizing their advantage by using ambushes, snipers, and camouflage. They prefer to fire from cover and retreat before they are found, repeating this maneuver until all of their enemies are dead. Their wizards often use sleep spells during combat because these won't affect other elves.
Description.Characters: A wood elf's favored class is ranger.

SpecialAbility.Name: Elven Traits
SpecialAbility.Text:
Elves benefit from a number of racial traits.
  • Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, composite longbow, shortbow, and composite shortbow, regardless of character class.
  • Immunity to magic sleep spells and effects.
  • +2 racial bonus to Will saves against enchantment spells or effects.
  • Low-Light Vision: Elves can see twice as far as a human in starlight, moonlight, torchlight, etc.
  • +2 racial bonus to Search, Spot, and Listen checks. An elf who merely passes within 5 feet of a secret or concealed door is entitled to a Search check as though actively looking for it.

StatsBlock.Name: Worg
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +7 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +7, Listen +9, Move Silently +7, Spot +9, Wilderness Lore +2

Description.General: More intelligent than their smaller cousins, worgs speak their own language. Some can also speak Common and Goblin.
Description.Combat: Mated pairs work together to bring down large game, while lone worgs usually chase down creatures smaller than themselves. Both often use hit-and-run tactics to exhaust their quarry. A pack usually circles a larger opponent: Each wolf attacks in turn, biting and retreating, until the creature is exhausted, at which point the pack moves in for the kill. If they get impatient or heavily outnumber the opponent, worgs attempt to pin it.
Description.Skills: A worg receives a +1 racial bonus to Listen, Move Silently, and Spot checks, and a +2 racial bonus to Hide checks. A worg has a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A worg that hits with a bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the worg.

StatsBlock.Name: Worker
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +2 melee (1d4+1)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Immunities (Other, See Below), Resistances, Make Whole, Heal
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 13, Dex 14, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 9

SpecialAbility.Name: Make Whole
SpecialAbility.Text: Three workers together can repair an object as though with make whole cast by a 7th-level cleric. This is a full-round action for all three workers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heal
SpecialAbility.Text: Eight workers together can heal a creature's wounds as though with cure serious wounds cast by a 7th-level cleric. This is a full-round action for all eight workers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hive Mind
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians within 50 miles of their queen are in constant communication. If one is aware of a particular danger, they all are. If one in a group is not flat-footed, none of them are. No formian in a group is considered flanked unless all of them are.

SpecialAbility.Name: Immunities
SpecialAbility.Text: Formians have poison, petrification, and cold immunity.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resistances
SpecialAbility.Text: All formians have fire, electricity, and sonic resistance 20.

StatsBlock.Name: Wraith
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Incorporeal touch x1 +2 melee (1d4)
StatsBlock.SpecialQualities: Undead, Turn Resistance, Daylight Powerlessness, Unnatural Aura, Incorporeal
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 10, Dex 16, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 15
StatsBlock.Skills: Hide +11, Intuit Direction +6, Spot +12, Search +10, Sense Motive +8, Listen +12, Intimidate +10
StatsBlock.Feats: Improved Initiative, Combat Reflexes, Blind-Fight, Alertness

SpecialAbility.Name: Constitution Drain
SpecialAbility.Text: Living creatures hit by a wraith's incorporeal touch attack must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or suffer 1d6 points of permanent Constitution drain.

SpecialAbility.Name: Create Spawn
SpecialAbility.Text: Any humanoid slain by a wraith becomes a wight in 1d4 rounds. Spawn are under the command of the wraith that created them and remain enslaved until its death. They do not possess any of the abilities they had in life.

SpecialAbility.Name: Unnatural Aura
SpecialAbility.Text: Both wild and domesticated animals can sense the unnatural presence of a wraith at a distance of 30 feet. They will not willingly approach nearer than that and panic if forced to do so; they remain panicked as long as they are within that range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Undead
SpecialAbility.Text: Immune to mind-influencing effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, and disease. Not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, energy drain, or death from massive damage.

SpecialAbility.Name: Incorporeal
SpecialAbility.Text: Can be harmed only by other incorporeal creatures, +1 or better magic weapons, or magic, with a 50% chance to ignore any damage from a corporeal source. Can pass through solid objects at will, and own attacks pass through armor. Always moves silently.

SpecialAbility.Name: Daylight Powerlessness
SpecialAbility.Text: Wraiths are utterly powerless in natural sunlight (not merely a daylight spell) and flee from it.

StatsBlock.Name: Wyvern
StatsBlock.Attacks: Sting melee (1d6+4) or bite melee (2d8+2) or 2 wings melee (1d8+1)2claws melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Sting x1 +6 melee (1d6+4) or bite x1 +1 melee (2d8+2) or 2 wings x1 +1 melee (1d8+1)2claws x1 +6 melee (1d6+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 9

Description.General: Some wyverns speak Draconic, but most are too stupid to understand any language.
Description.Combat: A wyvern can slash with its claws only when making a flyby attack, and it cannot make bite, sting, or wing attacks.
Description.Skills: *Wyverns receive a +3 racial bonus to Spot checks when flying during daylight hours.

SpecialAbility.Name: Poison
SpecialAbility.Text: Sting, Fortitude save (DC 17); initial and secondary damage 2d6 temporary Constitution.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the wyvern must hit with both claw attacks. If it gets a hold, it hangs on and stings.

SpecialAbility.Name: Snatch
SpecialAbility.Text: If a wyvern gets a hold on a creature four or more sizes smaller, it automatically deals damage with both claws and its sting attacks each round the hold is maintained. The wyvern can drop a creature it has snatched as a free action or use a standard action to fling it aside. A flung creature travels 30 feet and takes 3d6 points of damage. If the wyvern flings it while flying, the creature suffers this amount or falling damage, whichever is greater.

StatsBlock.Name: Xill
StatsBlock.Attacks: 2 short swords melee (1d6+2) or Unknown (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d4)1 or 2 longbows melee (1d4+2) or Unknown (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: 2 short swords x1 +6 melee (1d6+2) or Unknown (1d6+1) or Unknown (1d4)1 or 2 longbows x1 +6 melee (1d4+2) or Unknown (1d8+2)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 15, Dex 16, Con 15, Int 12, Wis 12, Cha 11
StatsBlock.Skills: Escape Artist +11, Intuit Direction +6, Listen +9, Spot +9, Tumble +11, +11

Description.Combat:
Xills are dangerous opponents, attacking with all four limbs at no penalty. More civilized ones use weapons, usually fighting with two at a time so as to leave two claws free for grab attacks.
Xills typically lie in wait on the Ethereal Plane for suitable prey to happen by, then ambush it using their planewalk ability. They make full use of their Tumble skill in combat: Usually, one or two distract physically powerful enemies by attacking, then assuming a defensive stance while their fellows maneuver to advantage.
Xills seldom destroy enemies in combat but take prisoners whenever they can, dragging them back to the Ethereal Plane and implanting them with eggs.
Description.Feats: A xill receives the Multiweapon Fighting feat as a bonus feat. With its Multidexterity and Multiweapon Fighting feats, it can attack with all its arms at no penalty as a racial ability.
Description.Characters: Xill clerics can choose any two of the following domains: Evil, Law, Strength, and Travel.

SpecialAbility.Name: Improved Grab
SpecialAbility.Text: To use this ability, the xill must hit with one or more claw attacks. The grapple check has a +2 bonus for each claw that hits. If it gets a hold and maintains it the next round, it automatically bites the foe at that time. The bite deals no damage but injects a paralyzing venom.

SpecialAbility.Name: Paralysis
SpecialAbility.Text: Those bitten by a xill must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be paralyzed for 1d4 hours. Barbaric xills secrete enough venom to bite two opponents every 6 hours, while their civilized cousins can bite only once per day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Planewalk
SpecialAbility.Text: These planar travelers like to slip between the folds of space to attack enemies as though from thin air. They can cross from the Ethereal Plane with a move action but take 2 rounds to cross back, during which time they are immobile. As a xill fades away, it becomes harder to hit: Opponents suffer a 20% miss chance on the first round and a 50% miss chance on the second.

SpecialAbility.Name: Implant
SpecialAbility.Text: Xills lay their eggs inside paralyzed creatures. The young emerge about 90 days later, literally devouring the host from inside. A remove disease spell rids a victim of the egg, as does a successful Heal check (DC 20) by someone with that skill. If the check fails, the healer can try again, but each attempt (successful or not) deals 1d4 points of damage to the patient.

StatsBlock.Name: Yeth Hound
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +3 melee (1d8+4)
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

Description.Skills: *A yeth hound receives a +4 racial bonus to Wilderness Lore checks when tracking by scent.

SpecialAbility.Name: Bay
SpecialAbility.Text: When a yeth hound howls or barks, all creatures except other evil outsiders within a 300-foot spread must succeed at a Will save (DC 12) or become panicked for 2d4 rounds. This is a sonic, mind-affecting fear effect. Whether or not the save is successful, an affected creature is immune to that hound's bay for one day.

SpecialAbility.Name: Trip
SpecialAbility.Text: A yeth hound that hits with its bite attack can attempt to trip the opponent as a free action without making a touch attack or provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the opponent cannot react to trip the yeth hound.

SpecialAbility.Name: Flight
SpecialAbility.Text: A yeth hound can fly as the spell cast by an 11th-level sorcerer, as a free action. A yeth hound that loses this ability falls and can perform only partial actions.

StatsBlock.Name: Yrthak
StatsBlock.FullAttacks: Bite x1 +15 melee (2d8+5) or 2 claws x1 +13 melee (1d6+2)
StatsBlock.SpecialAttacks: Sonic Lance +12 Ranged Touch, Explosion, Snatch
StatsBlock.Abilities: Str 20, Dex 14, Con 17, Int 7, Wis 13, Cha 11

Description.General: Despite their intelligence, yrthaks do not speak.
Description.Combat: An yrthak prefers to attack from the air, strafing the ground with sonic attacks or snatching up and dropping prey (eventually landing to devour the flattened mess).
Description.Skills: Yrthaks receive a +4 racial bonus to Listen checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sonic Lance
SpecialAbility.Text: Every 2 rounds, an yrthak can focus sonic energy in a ray up to 60 feet long. This is a ranged touch attack that deals 6d6 points of damage to a single target.

SpecialAbility.Name: Explosion
SpecialAbility.Text: The yrthak can fire its sonic lance at the ground, a large rock, a stone wall, or the like to create an explosion of shattered stone. This attack deals 2d6 points of piercing damage to all within 10 feet of the effect's center. This counts as a use of the sonic lance and thus is usable only once every 2 rounds, and never on a round following a sonic lance attack.

SpecialAbility.Name: Snatch
SpecialAbility.Text: An yrthak that hits a Medium-size or smaller creature with a claw attack attempts to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it gets a hold, it can fly off with its prey and deal automatic claw damage, though it prefers to drop victims from a height. It can drop a snatched creature as a free action, which deals normal falling damage if the yrthak is flying.

SpecialAbility.Name: Blindsight
SpecialAbility.Text: An yrthak can ascertain all foes within 120 feet. Beyond that range it is considered blinded. Yrthaks are invulnerable to gaze attacks, visual effects of spells such as illusions, and other attack forms that rely on sight. An yrthak whose sense of hearing is impaired is effectively blind, treating all targets as totally concealed.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sonic Vulnerability
SpecialAbility.Text: Yrthaks are affected by loud noises and sonic spells (such as ghost sound or silence) and are more susceptible to sound-based attacks, suffering a -2 racial penalty to all saves.
